title: Anyone Else Want to See Trump Shut Up?
description: When the nation looks back on the presidential debate we witnessed this week, do you think itll be remembered as:

title: How the Lakers Beat the Heat in Game 1 of the N.B.A. Finals
description: LeBron James is not accustomed to Game 1s like these.

title: Trump Calls on Extremists to Stand By
description: President Trump didnt hurt Joe Biden in Tuesdays debate, but he badly damaged our country.

title: Facebook will forbid ads that undermine the legitimacy of the coming election.
description: Facebook on Wednesday said it would prohibit the purchase of ads that seek to delegitimize the outcome of the Nov. 3 election, as the social network prepares for a turbulent next few weeks.

title: Can Mike Espy Make History, Again?
description: At the end of the Civil War in 1865, Mississippi was a majority-Black state.

title: Trumps Tax Avoidance Is a Tax on the Rest of Us
description: We dont know if Donald Trumps recent federal income tax returns indicate illegal activity. But even if the $750 income tax bills he paid in each of the first two years of his presidency turn out to have been calculated in compliance with the U.S. Internal Revenue Code, he has enjoyed the benefits of the society we all contribute to build, then skipped out on his share of the bill a sort of dine-and-dash on his fellow Americans.

title: Tokyo Stock Market Halts Trading for a Day, Citing Glitch
description: TOKYO  The Tokyo Stock Exchange shut down for the day on Thursday as its operator raced to solve a technical glitch that halted equities trading throughout the worlds third- largest economy.

title: Images From Four More Years of Whats Going On in This Picture?
description: A slide show including some of our most popular images published from 2016 to 2020 in Whats Going On in This Picture?

title: In Which Rikishi Wear Mawashi
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  Devious. But a great aha moment. Devious and a great aha moment, thats all Im going to say about this puzzle by Adam Fromm.

title: Quotation of the Day: Insults, Bluster and a Sense of a Superpower in Decline
description: The country we have looked to for leadership has descended into an ugly brawl.

title: Corrections: Oct. 1, 2020
description: An article on Sept. 24 about a real estate project that would have led to the expansion of the Industry City complex in Brooklyn referred imprecisely to the relationship between Chelsea Market and its developer, Jamestown. Jamestown created Chelsea Market and owns the rights to the Chelsea Market brand, but Google bought the complex in 2018.

title: U.S. Debate, Vladimir Putin, African Art: Your Thursday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: 2020 French Open: What to Watch on Thursday
description: How to watch: 5 a.m. to 3 p.m. on the Tennis Channel; streaming on the Tennis Channel app.

title: N.F.L. Week 4 Predictions: Our Picks Against the Spread
description: The N.F.L.s nearly perfect record in containing the coronavirus took a major hit when multiple members of the Tennessee Titans tested positive following last weeks win over Minnesota. Now, a huge matchup between Tennessee and Pittsburgh  both of which are 3-0  has been delayed until Week 7. Things got worse on Saturday, when positive tests forced the weeks other top game, between Kansas City and New England, to be postponed until Monday or Tuesday. Thus far the impact on the league has been manageable, but things could quickly get out of control without major precautions.

title: Hong Kong Is China, Like It or Not
description: HONG KONG  No amount of outcry, condemnation or sanctions over the Chinese governments purported encroachment in Hong Kongs affairs will alter the fact that Hong Kong is part of China and that its destiny is intertwined with the mainlands.

title: Chrissy Teigen and John Legend Lose Baby After Pregnancy Complications
description: The model and cookbook author Chrissy Teigen said late Wednesday that she and her husband, the singer John Legend, had lost their third child, a son, days after she posted on social media about suffering pregnancy complications.

title: Word + Quiz: guttural
Samantha Bee Decries Trumps Stand Back and Stand By
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Were all stuck at home at the moment, so here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: Confrontation
For Voters Still Mulling, One Thing Is Clear: That Debate Didnt Help
description: [Watch live VP debate and analysis.]

title: At the Edge of Time, a Litter of Galactic Puppies
description: Astronomers announced on Thursday that they had discovered a giant black hole surrounded by a litter of young protogalaxies that date to the early universe  the beginning of time.

title: Layoffs grow as companies gauge the course of the pandemic  and prospects for federal aid.
description: American employers continue to cut jobs, signaling new anxiety about the course of the coronavirus pandemic and uncertainty about further legislative relief.

title: I feel like crying: In Rio, the pandemic has stopped an unstoppable parade.
description: Wars, disease and political turmoil have never prevented Rio de Janeiro from putting on its famous carnival. Now, the pandemic has forced a suspension of the annual parade for the first time since 1932.

title: Lesson of the Day: How to Get the Most Out of Art (Even When Youre Not Sure You Get It)
description: Featured Article: How to Get the Most Out of Art (Even When Youre Not Sure You Get It)

title: After The Salisbury Poisonings, Locals Picked Up the Pieces
description: LONDON  After a former Russian spy was found convulsing on a park bench in the English city of Salisbury, the British prime minister at the time, Theresa May, stood before Parliament and the world and accused the Kremlin of a brazen act to murder innocent civilians on our soil.

title: Judge John Hodgman on Annoying Birthday Requests
description: Kate writes: Every time I ask my boyfriend, Joel, what he wants for his birthday, he says, A tiger. He wont stop. He is clearly joking, but its exasperating. I want an injunction against the joke. Also, what would be a good gift for him?

title: Are You Having a Tough Time Maintaining Friendships These Days?
description: Do you find it difficult to keep up with your friendships in a time of social distancing? Do you find it hard to make new friends in the era of remote schooling, and when people are spending so much time more at home? Has the pandemic brought you closer together, or moved you farther apart, from friends?

title: Distance Learning, With Shades of Big Brother
description: Theres an adorable video being sent to parents in at least one public school I know of, aimed at teaching children some Covid-era etiquette. It also reminds me of prison. Titled Rules of the Digital Classroom, it was made by an edutainment outfit called Manic Turtle, and its as peppy and upbeat as the name of the company implies. Organized in a basic dos-and-donts format, it features an adorable little girl, maybe 5 or so, demonstrating correct and incorrect strategies for attending school while staying home.

title: A Renter Wanted to Return to Her Childhood Neighborhood. Could She Still Afford It?
description: With her Bronx lease expiring, a single mother decided to take her family back home  or as close as they could get. Which of these options did she choose?

title: Shout Out to the Bodega Boys, From the Bronx to the Best-Seller List
description: BOYS TO MEN When Daniel Baker, a.k.a. Desus Nice, got a call from his agent, reps and lawyer out of nowhere in late September, he panicked. I was like, oh wow, the show mustve gotten canceled, he said in a three-way phone interview with Joel Martinez, a.k.a. the Kid Mero, his co-host on their late-night TV series, Desus & Mero. It scared the hell out of me.

title: Why Biodegradable Isnt What You Think
description: It sounds positive, but there are a few ways the label biodegradable may cause more problems than it solves.

title: Finding Help to Take Their Next Steps
description: When Denisha Smith left her Brooklyn home at 14, she had nowhere to go.

title: Alexander Vindman Knew Trump Would End His Career
description: Alexander Vindman  war hero, European affairs expert, lieutenant colonel in the Army  had lofty dreams of serving the United States. But a call he heard between President Trump and Ukraines president, Volodymyr Zelensky, gave him pause. Little more than a year after taking a job at the White House, Colonel Vindman testified before Congress regarding the Ukraine scandal, and was a key witness in the impeachment inquiry into Mr. Trump.

title: Poem: On Taking the Measure of Your Book
description: In this deeply appealing poem by the Californian Fran Claggett-Holland, from her new book, The Consciousness of Stone (RiskPress Foundation), reading is experienced as a supple activity, an actual posture as one moves to engage with textual experience. Its a physical revelation as well as a landscape  not just a passive stare. I could feel the fresh exhilaration of a beach, wind and air inside my own body after reading this, without having been to any beach for a long time. Sometimes when people ask how to read a poem, one might simply say, Go inside it. Selected by Naomi Shihab Nye

title: For the Sake of Democracy, Cancel the Trump-Biden Debates
description: Little more than 12 hours after the conclusion of the most chaotic, counterproductive and outright offensive American presidential debate in my lifetime, the Commission on Presidential Debates promised unspecified format changes in the two remaining faceoffs between Donald Trump and Joe Biden so that the events would be more orderly, which is to say watchable at all.

title: Tenants Facing Eviction Over Covid-19 Look to a 1970s Solution | Retro Report
description: As a housing crisis set off by the Covid-19 pandemic has put low-income tenants at risk of eviction, a counterintuitive proposal to help renters buy their apartments has emerged. Its an idea that originated during a 1970s eviction battle in San Francisco.

title: Considering a Coronavirus Divorce? Youre in Good Company
description: One of the few good things about a deadly pandemic is that if you are a person who enjoys talking on the phone, as I am, you will now have lots of time to do this, far more time than you did during regular life.

title: The Rights Relentless Supreme Court Justice Picking Machine
description: In 1992, according to an article in The Times, Justice Clarence Thomas told two of his clerks that he planned to remain on the court until 2034.

title: She Was Resting With Her Sons. Then a Shot Was Fired.
description: Bertha Arriaga was resting in a bedroom with her three sleeping sons when she heard a commotion outside and went to the window. It was after midnight.

title: How Trump Voters View His Position on Pre-existing Conditions
description: When Pamela Jean Locke votes in November, one issue shell be thinking about is protections for Americans with pre-existing health problems.

title: When Latinos Saw Themselves Onscreen: It Was Exhilarating
description: The experiences of American-born or -raised Latinos remain largely overlooked in entertainment  or conflated with border-crossing stories, and those set in Latin America. So we assembled a list of 20 essential films released since the year 2000 that focus on characters with an American identity and Latino heritage. Here, some of the Latino actors and filmmakers whose work appears on the list share when they first felt seen onscreen.

title: New York Becomes First Big City in U.S. to Reopen All Its Schools
description: [Read more on NYC school closings due to Covid-19]

title: The 51st State America Needs
description: As Election Day nears, conservative lawmakers like Senator John Barrasso of Wyoming have warned that Democrats plan to stack the Senate by admitting new states to the union if they win control of the presidency and Congress. We certainly hope so. Democrats should make District of Columbia statehood a top priority if they win in November. Adding a star to the American flag for the district would be good for the Democratic Party and good for democracy.

title: Why This Artist Is Paying Bodegas With 120,000 Pennies
description: A conceptual artist walked into a bodega during a pandemic carrying a box full of pennies.

title: A Brief History of the Taxpayer in Chief
description: This weeks investigation by The Times into President Trumps long-hidden tax returns uncovered staggering business losses and such vigorous exploitation of loopholes that the president paid only $750 in federal income taxes in 2016 and 2017. When asked during Tuesdays presidential debate about the revelations, Mr. Trump was unrepentant. It was the tax laws, he declared. His tax avoidance was like every other private person, unless theyre stupid.

title: With His New Mystery Novel, John Banville Kills Off a Pen Name
description: The Irish novelist John Banville is a famous perfectionist  the kind of writer who can spend a day on a single sentence. His books, most written in the first person, are lapidary, intricate, Nabokovian. Or just difficult, some readers have complained, more interested in style than in storytelling. They invariably come laden with words that seem meant to prove his vocabulary is bigger than yours: flocculent, crapulent, caducous, anaglypta, mephitic, velutinous.

title: With Evictions Looming, Cities Revisit a Housing Experiment From the 70s
description: Even before the coronavirus pandemic rang down the curtain on much of the U.S. economy, times could be tough for the roughly 110 million Americans living in rental housing. For many of them, paying the landlord was a tattered hope and staving off the sheriffs deputies an endless worry. Nearly four million eviction petitions were filed each year. On any given night as many as 200,000 people were without a home.

title: Laughter May Be Effective Medicine for These Trying Times
description: Some enlightened doctors, nurses and therapists have a prescription for helping all of us to get through this seemingly never-ending pandemic: Try a little laughter.

title: When Your Job Is to Make Sure Nov. 3 Isnt a Disaster
description: A flood of mail-in ballots that will need processing. Foreign disinformation campaigns. A shortage of poll workers. And voters afraid of catching a potentially fatal disease at the ballot box.

title: The Army Rolls Out a New Weapon: Strategic Napping
description: Turns out Beetle Bailey had it right all along.

title: Jim Murray, a Top Whiskey Critic, Faces Accusations of Sexism
description: For more than a decade, the British spirits writer Jim Murray has held sway as the worlds most influential whiskey critic, thanks largely to his Whisky Bible, an annual compendium of thousands of reviews, including his prestigious World Whisky of the Year award. His words can make or break a brand, his books have sold more than a million copies, and his tasting events, which take him from Kentucky to India to points in between, attract thousands of fans.

title: In U.S.-China Tech Feud, Taiwan Feels Heat From Both Sides
description: TAINAN, Taiwan  The United States and China are wrestling to lead the world in artificial intelligence, 5G wireless and other cutting-edge technologies. But the real wizardry that makes those advancements possible is being performed on a yam-shaped island that sits between them, geographically and politically.

title: Roland Mouret on How to Create a Vacation Bag for the Summer That Wasnt
description: Here, Roland Mouret, known for his feminine silhouettes and famous bodycon Galaxy dress, has chosen to create a knotted handbag out of a simple square of denim and an inexpensive metal chain. He calls it the Nimes.

title: The American Latino Experience: 20 Essential Films Since 2000
description: Hollywood still doesnt get it.

title: A Battle for the Souls of Black Girls
description: BINGHAMTON, N.Y.  Zulayka McKinstrys once silly, sociable daughter has stopped seeing friends, talking to siblings and trusting anyone  changes Ms. McKinstry dates to the day in January 2019 when her daughters school principal decided that hyper and giddy were suspicious behaviors in a 12-year-old girl.

title: Russian Opposition Leader Navalny Says Putin Is Behind His Poisoning
description: BERLIN  Aleksei A. Navalny, Russias most prominent opposition leader, who was poisoned in August in Siberia, says he has no doubt that President Vladimir V. Putin was behind the attack.

title: In Germany, New Plays Consider Autonomy in the Age of Corona
description: HAMBURG, Germany  Late last month, I shared a picture on Twitter of the audience at the Thalia Theater shortly before a performance.

title: Indoor Dining Returns to N.Y.C. After 6 Months
description: [Want to get New York Today by email? Heres the sign-up.]

title: 40 More Intriguing Photos to Make Students Think
description: Four years ago we published a collection of 40 intriguing photographs from the first four years of our popular weekly feature Whats Going On in This Picture? The slide show quickly became a go-to resource for teachers around the world, and it remains one of our most utilized teaching resources  ever.

title: Jacinda Ardern Admits Past Cannabis Use. New Zealanders Shrug: Us, Too.
description: SYDNEY, Australia  The question from the debate moderator in New Zealand was simple and to the point: Jacinda Ardern, have you ever used cannabis?

title: Fans celebrate the Stanley Cup champions, well outside the N.H.L.s pandemic bubble.
description: The Tampa Bay Lightning won the National Hockey Leagues top trophy on Monday from within the confines of a 24/7 pandemic bubble in western Canada, and without any fans in the arena to watch.

title: A YouTuber Hangs His Own Shingle With an Auction Website
description: Making the most important pitch of his career, Doug DeMuro stood in cargo shorts in front of a camera, unwavering in his giddy demeanor. He was about to unveil his new car auction website to his 3.7 million YouTube subscribers. The site would feature cars that I like most, he said.

title: A Users Guide to Mail-In Voting
description: The pandemic will mean that many more Americans vote by mail this year.

title: Trumps Fear of Biden
E.U. Brings Suit Against U.K. on Eve of Crucial Trade Talks
description: LONDON  A decision by the European Commission on Thursday to press ahead with legal action against Britain over its plans to override parts of an agreement on withdrawal from the bloc raises the stakes at a critical moment in talks that will determine whether the two sides can avert an economically ruinous rupture.

title: The Trump Debate Fallout
description: Senate Republicans do the old dance around Trump and racism, while Biden presses his case in Ohio and Pennsylvania. Plus, a Q. and A. with Jim Rutenberg about his explosive voter-suppression investigation. Its Thursday, and this is your politics tip sheet. Sign up here to get On Politics in your inbox every weekday.

title: 12 Hour Shift Review: When a Bedside Manner Includes Murder
description: How quickly we pivot from honoring our frontline workers. In the exploitation splatter comedy 12 Hour Shift, two nurses manage an organ-trafficking network out of their Arkansas hospital. The drug-addled Mandy (Angela Bettis), who takes her orders from Karen (Nikea Gamby-Turner), brings fresh harvests to the soda machine just outside the buildings doors. From there, Regina (Chloe Farnworth), who harbors a misapprehension that shes Mandys cousin, is supposed to shuttle organs in a picnic cooler to their destination.

title: Eternal Beauty Review: Sally Hawkins, in Another Transformation
description: The Welsh actor Craig Roberts dedicates his second directorial feature to the real Calamity Jane, making clear that Eternal Beauty is based on actual people in his life. (Hes also said so in interviews.) The Jane he presents in this movie  hes also the writer  is played by Sally Hawkins, and her performance is another startling transformation in her filmography. (Shes a two-time Oscar nominee, for her work in The Shape of Water and Happy Go Lucky, playing two very different characters.)

title: A Call to Spy Review: A Resistance Led by Women
description: A Call to Spy is a welcome, albeit imperfect, addition to the existing slate of movies about World War II. The propulsive historical drama, which was written by Sarah Megan Thomas (she also plays Virginia Hall, one of the three leads) and directed by Lydia Dean Pilcher, explores the lives of three remarkable women who served as spies for the Allied nations.

title: Save Yourselves! Review: Alien Invasion in the Smartphone Generation
description: Imagine surviving an alien invasion when youre a staunchly anti-gun Brooklyn millennial with no survival skills beyond making a sourdough starter. That amusing premise sets the stage for this apocalyptic comedy from the writer-directors Alex Huston Fischer and Eleanor Wilson, which should belong in a subgenre sillier than mumblegore, the horror offshoot of the low-budget, dialogue-heavy mumblecore.

title: Possessor Review: Its by a Cronenberg, but Not the One You Think
description: Possessor, about an assassin who works by taking over the mind and body of someone who can get close to the victim without suspicion, could have sprung from the imagination of David Cronenberg and, like his early films, Possessor is equal parts cerebral and visceral. But this film is the work of the writer-director Brandon Cronenberg, his son. It depicts horrific murders in appalling detail as it relentlessly interrogates the experience of inhabiting a foreign body.

title: The Great American Lie Review: Another Interpretation of the Dream
description: The run-of-the-mill documentary The Great American Lie fires shots at the American Dream, criticizing a country that has failed its promise.

title: Take It or Leave It
description: Want this delivered to your inbox each day? Sign up here.

title: Dick Johnson Is Dead Review: A Fathers Painful, Funny Goodbye
description: Critics like to pigeonhole movies using familiar categories  fiction, nonfiction, happy, sad  but one of the charms of Dick Johnson Is Dead is how slippery it is. Pitched artfully between the celebratory and the elegiac, it is an inarguably serious documentary with light, surrealistic flourishes that, at times, veer into exuberant goofiness. Even at its silliest, the movie retains an undertow of melancholia because (as the title announces) its a death notice. It is also a love letter from a daughter to a father who, for the viewer, becomes fully human even as he fades away.

title: Editors Note
description: This article was published in error.

title: Chinas Golden Week Kicks Off in Boost to Battered Tourism Industry
description: Along the Great Wall, extra security guards have been deployed to deter rowdy tourists. Hotel bookings in Lhasa, the capital of Tibet, have risen 600 percent from the same period last year. In Wuhan, where the coronavirus outbreak began late last year, visitor demand for the citys Yellow Crane Tower has been so high that the landmark sits atop a major travel agencys list of the Countrys Hottest Scenic Spots.

title: Is It Time to Rethink Milton Friedman?
description: To commemorate the 50th anniversary of Milton Friedmans influential essay, The Social Responsibility of Business Is to Increase Its Profits, DealBook teamed up with The New York Times Magazine to collect thoughts from executives, political leaders and Nobel Prize winners on its legacy.

title: Breaking Impasse, E.U. Imposes Sanctions on Belarus
description: BRUSSELS  European Union leaders early Friday finally broke a longstanding impasse to impose sanctions against Belarus as they tackled a raft of interconnected issues  from Turkey to the coronavirus recovery fund to the rule of law  that would have been complicated even if taken one by one.

title: Corporate Americas Role in the Fight for Racial Justice
description: Corporate leaders have been pledging support for civil rights initiatives and re-examining their records on racial inequality, but critics contend that well-intentioned promises have had little effect. On this DealBook Debrief call, Nikole Hannah-Jones, a Pulitzer Prize-winning reporter for The Times Magazine and creator of the 1619 Project, said that corporate America has a much, much larger role to play.

title: Amid a surge in cases, India plans to reopen cinemas, entertainment parks and some schools.
description: Despite a fast-growing number of coronavirus cases, India will allow cinemas and entertainment parks to open with limited capacity beginning Oct. 15, in an effort to revive an economy that has been battered by the pandemic. Swimming pools will be open for athletes in training, and states could be allowed to open schools.

title: If MAGA Hats Are Business Casual, Why Isnt My Biden Shirt?
description: I am a Democrat in a very red state. I work at a small service business where I interact with customers in person. Several of my co-workers wear bright red Make America Great Again caps. So, I bought a Joe Biden T-shirt to express my views. Recently, though, my boss, the owner of the company, issued a rule that customer-facing employees are not allowed to wear political garb. I cant wear my shirt, but the accounting guys in the back office can still wear their MAGA hats. I dont think this is fair. Do you? What about my First Amendment rights?

title: A Countercultural Dreamland From Tokyo Flickers at MoMA
description: Norma Desmond was right, the pictures got small. Once cinema filled your field of vision, but in this century, as ever cheaper digital displays have replaced projection technologies, we have grown accustomed to smaller and smaller movies. The old movie palaces, with their 50-foot silver screens, have mostly shut down. The multiplexes are in trouble. You probably watched your last movie on a 55-inch TV set, a 21-inch computer monitor, or, feel free to admit, a 6-inch cameraphone screen.

title: Ts Design & Luxury Issue: Safe Havens
description: Before a home is a place of beauty, or a stage for its inhabitants personality, its something that provides that most essential of needs: shelter, whether from weather or, as we all now well know, disease.

title: Long Islands Enduring Black Beachfront Community
description: A brief history of how New Yorks Sag Harbor became a refuge for African-American families, with testimonials from some of the residents whove summered there for much of their lives.

title: On Long Island, a Beachfront Haven for Black Families
description: WHILE VACATIONING ONE summer in the late 1930s, Maude Terry decided to go fishing. On her way to Gardiners Bay in eastern Long Island, she came across a secluded, underdeveloped, marshy, wooded area that faced a beach. Immediately, she felt a sense of tranquillity in the sylvan space, surrounded by tall old oak and walnut trees. Green shrubbery and weeds grew amid the sand at her feet, and her skin turned sticky in the salt air. It was heaven.

title: Facebook bans ads that aim to undermine the election.
description: Facebook on Wednesday said it would prohibit the purchase of ads that seek to delegitimize the outcome of the election, as the social network prepares for a turbulent next few weeks.

title: A far-right group that trades in political violence has gotten a boost from Trump.
description: When hundreds of supporters of President Trump gathered for a Labor Day rally in Oregon, a man in the signature black-and-gold shirt of the Proud Boys approached the crowd with a welcoming smile.

title: For undecided voters, one thing is clear: The debate didnt help.
description: Useless. Ridiculous. Horrible.

title: Trump renews fears of voter intimidation as G.O.P. poll watchers mobilize.
description: The group of Trump campaign officials came carrying cellphone cameras and a determination to help the presidents re-election efforts in Philadelphia. But they were asked to leave the citys newly opened satellite election offices on Tuesday after being told local election laws did not permit them to monitor voters coming to request and complete absentee ballots.

title: A study found the single largest driver of coronavirus misinformation. It was the president.
description: Of the flood of misinformation, conspiracy theories and falsehoods seeding the internet on the coronavirus, one common thread stands out: President Trump.

title: Will Trump participate in the next two debates? The White House wont commit.
description: There are two more presidential debates left before Election Day, but now, after the debacle of the first debate  90 minutes dominated by insults, attacks and interruptions by President Trump  everything seems up in the air.

title: Where Does America Sit in a Pandemic World?
description: The pandemic has disrupted life as we knew it, and the Trump administration has upended American policies along with it. The Times foreign affairs columnist Tom Friedman joined us for a DealBook Debrief call to make sense of it all.

title: The Calculus Behind Trumps Covid Response
description: Maggie Haberman, White House correspondent for The Times, joined us for a DealBook Debrief call to assess how the Trump administration was managing its pandemic response, re-election campaign and more.

title: Inside the New Tech Cold War
description: Tensions between China and the U.S. have climbed ever higher in recent months, with clashes over Chinese tech companies becoming a huge flash point. David Sanger, The Timess national security correspondent, joined us for a DealBook Debrief call with readers to discuss the battle between Washington and Beijing over tech companies like Huawei and TikTok.

title: Turkey admits not including asymptomatic people in its count.
description: Turkey has acknowledged that it was not making all confirmed coronavirus cases public in its daily announced tally, but counting only those patients showing symptoms.

title: Pence heads to Iowa, as Biden and Trump catch their breath and host fund-raisers.
description: Here are the daily schedules of the presidential and vice-presidential candidates for Thursday, Oct. 1. All times are Eastern time.

title: The battle over restrictions in Madrid moves to the courtroom.
description: The debate over how and whether to lock down Madrid, the epicenter of Spains second wave of the virus, is moving to the courtroom as the region challenges a national decree that would lock down the capital and prevent Madrid-area residents from traveling to other parts of the country.

title: An Interview With the Pac-12 Commissioner
description: Pac-12 football is coming back, or so the league hopes.

title: Unemployment claims in the U.S. show little relief from pandemic layoffs.
description: American employers continue to cut jobs at rates that dwarf the pace of layoffs in past decades, even as the economy crawls forward from the coronavirus-induced recession that began last spring.

title: Fauci pushes back against Trump for misrepresenting his stance on masks.
description: Dr. Anthony S. Fauci, the leading U.S. official on infectious diseases, hit back at President Trump on Wednesday for what he called the misrepresentation of his stance on using masks to curb the coronavirus.

title: A High-Tech Twin for a Renaissance Masterpiece
description: FLORENCE, Italy  For the past five centuries, Michelangelos David has been celebrated for its sculptural perfection and its embodiment of youthful beauty and strength.

title: Three charts about the markets in the third quarter.
description: Its a new month, and a new quarter. Todays DealBook newsletter ran the numbers

title: Plenty of work for homebuilders, but few commercial construction jobs.
description: Home construction workers, whose livelihoods were on the line as the economy collapsed in the spring, are benefiting from a newly resurgent housing market, while builders of commercial and retail properties struggle.

title: The T List: Five Things We Recommend This Week
description: Welcome to the T List, a newsletter from the editors of T Magazine. Each week, were sharing things were eating, wearing, listening to or coveting now. Sign up here to find us in your inbox every Wednesday. You can always reach us at tlist@nytimes.com.

title: Which Cities Are Converting the Most Factories Into Homes?
description: As the pandemic stretches on, office buildings sit empty as their tenants work from home, and brick and-mortar stores continue to lose ground to online shopping. Witness the bankruptcies of major retail giants J.C. Penney and Neiman Marcus, and the pile of Amazon deliveries in your building lobby, as clear evidence.

title: 5 Art Accounts to Follow on Instagram Now
description: As the pandemic continues to devastate countries around the world, natural disasters bear down and Election Day draws nearer, I find myself struggling with opposite impulses: I want to keep up with the news, and I want to escape into pleasure and imagination. Instagram offers both. Some accounts help me process current events, others provide aesthetic wonder, and still others manage the two at once. This list covers all the points on that spectrum. Consider it a creative coping mechanism for staying engaged during a trying time.

title: On the Market in New York City
description: This weeks properties are in Prospect-Lefferts Gardens, Forest Hills and Kips Bay.

title: Homes for Sale in Brooklyn, Queens and Manhattan
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties:

title: On the Market in the New York Region
description: This weeks properties are six-bedroom homes in Armonk, N.Y., and Washington Township, N.J.

title: Homes for Sale in New York and New Jersey
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties:

title: The Astros Are Moving On, Even if the Rest of You Arent
description: The Houston Astros hear you. Even with no crowds to heckle them from the stands, they know what you think of them. You want them to go away.

title: Her hours cut to almost nothing, she spent the time trying to launch a new career.
description: Joann Taylor, a catering coordinator at a McAlisters Deli franchise in Houston, used to work about 30 hours per week. But when the pandemic hit, her boss put her in an on-call position for deliveries only.

title: These peoples job is making sure Nov. 3 isnt a disaster.
description: A flood of mail-in ballots that will need processing. Foreign disinformation campaigns. A shortage of poll workers. And voters afraid of catching a potentially fatal disease at the ballot box.

title: Subsidized furlough programs keep a lid on eurozone unemployment.
description: The unemployment rate in the eurozone edged up to 8.1 percent in August from 8 percent in July, the European Union said Thursday, as government support cushioned much of the economic impact of the pandemic.

title: Where You Carry Body Fat May Affect How Long You Live
description: Being overweight is linked to an increased risk for premature death, but which part of the body carries the added fat could make a big difference. Extra weight in some places may actually lower the risk.

title: After a layoff, a couple struggles to get by on one salary and jobless benefits.
description: Until June, MacKenzie Nicholson worked for the American Cancer Society, lobbying state and federal legislators to increase funding for cancer research. She lost her job after the pandemic forced the organization to cancel events across the country, eroding its revenue.

title: Google commits $1 billion to license content from news publishers.
description: Google said on Thursday that it would spend more than $1 billion to license content from international news organizations, after years of criticism that it was not providing fair compensation for articles and other content linked to by its internet search products.

title: Yankees Will Face the Tough Rays After a Record-Setting Playoff Win
description: CLEVELAND  At one point in the eighth inning of the epic Game 2 of the wild-card series between the Yankees and the Indians, Yankees third baseman Gio Urshela looked back at the giant scoreboard at Progressive Field and saw that the clock was approaching 1 a.m. Thursday.

title: On Chinas National Day, Hong Kong Police Quash Protests
description: HONG KONG  One year ago, Chinas National Day on Oct. 1 was a day of protest and turmoil in Hong Kong. Demonstrators set fires and blockaded streets. The police responded with tear gas and pepper spray. One officer shot a young demonstrator with a live bullet.

title: Mellon Foundation to Provide $5 Million to Aid Black Theaters
description: Black theaters across the country will receive a significant financial boost thanks to a multimillion-dollar program announced today by the Billie Holiday Theater, a Black-led artistic institution in Brooklyn.

title: Galleries and an Auction House Follow Collectors to Florida
description: As the birds fly south for the winter, some of the art world will undertake a similar migration: Pace Gallery, Acquavella Galleries and Sothebys are opening seasonal gallery spaces in Palm Beach, Fla., a hub for wealthy vacationers.

title: The Special Place Where Ella Fitzgerald Comes Alive
description: Ella Fitzgerald hardly ever crooned the blues, and her vocals rarely overflowed with pathos or fury. Listening to her nail a ballad, you may not feel invited to leap into her own world and feel her pain, like you would with Billie Holiday or Little Jimmy Scott.

title: 7 Podcasts for Music Lovers
description: No corner of culture has been untouched by the pandemic, with institutions shuttered, most movie and TV production in limbo, and most live performances indefinitely postponed. But music has weathered the storm better than many art forms, as artists turn to virtual concerts during lockdown or produce records inspired directly by the quarantine, like Charli XCXs How Im Feeling Now and Taylor Swifts Folklore.

title: The Artists Giving New Life to Fake Flowers
description: IN EARLY REGENCY-ERA England, neo-Classicism defined design: Walls were painted the pale hues of a summer morning. Greek motifs abounded. But such subtlety was too tame for the Victorians who followed, who preferred resplendent fakery: papier-mch molded into heavy-looking armoires, giltwood chairs carved to resemble bamboo, lace crocheted to mimic snowflakes.

title: The Pandemics Pressure on Military Spouses
description: At the beginning of the pandemic, military wives across the country were circulating a smug meme: Some of you have never had the government ruin your plans and it shows.

title: After 2 Years of Paralysis, Belgium Forms a (Very Fragile) Government
description: BRUSSELS  For nearly two years, Belgium has been without a formal government, leaving a country that was already divided by language and politics to endure a pandemic with lame-duck caretakers wielding emergency powers.

title: Italys daily new cases topped 2,000 for the first time since April.
description: Italy registered a number of infections exceeding 2,000 for the first time since April on Thursday, when 2,548 residents tested positive for coronavirus in one day.

title: Trump Launches Xenophobic Attack Against Omar in Minnesota Speech
description: Chants of lock her up broke out during a campaign rally for President Trump after he accused Representative Ilhan Omar of telling us how to run our country.

title: Facing 200 Abuse Claims, Diocese Becomes U.S.s Largest to Seek Bankruptcy
description: Facing more than 200 lawsuits over sexual abuse allegations, the Diocese of Rockville Centre on Long Island said on Thursday that it filed for bankruptcy, the largest Roman Catholic diocese in the United States to do so.

title: Fraud Schemes Exploit Weak Spots in Unemployment Claims System
description: The for-sale ad appeared last week in an underground internet bazaar that specializes in selling stolen accounts and data. It was for access to a filched unemployment insurance claim in California that had been approved and offered benefits worth $17,550.

title: Brennan Rebuffed Requests to Lower Confidence in Key Russia Finding
description: WASHINGTON  The former C.I.A. director John O. Brennan disagreed with the recommendation of two senior officers in early 2017 who wanted to override intelligence analysts determination that the agency had high confidence in one of its major judgments in the assessment of Russias 2016 election interference: that President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia tried to help Donald J. Trump by discrediting Hillary Clinton.

title: Overlooked No More: Lucy Diggs Slowe, Scholar Who Persisted Against Racism and Sexism
description: This article is part of Overlooked, a series of obituaries about remarkable people whose deaths, beginning in 1851, went unreported in The Times. It is also part of The Timess continuing coverage of the centennial of the 19th Amendment, which gave women the vote.

title: A day after refusing to condemn white supremacists, Trump aims a xenophobic attack at Ilhan Omar.
description: A day after he refused to condemn white supremacists at the first presidential debate, President Trump unleashed a xenophobic attack on Representative Ilhan Omar at a rally in Minnesota Wednesday night, accusing her of telling us  meaning his overwhelmingly white audience  how to run our country.

title: H&M will close stores and ramp up digital efforts as online sales rise.
description: Shares in the Swedish retailer H&M rose more than 7 percent after the company said online sales were growing strongly and the company had already returned to profit in the third quarter.

title: Good for the Psyche of This City: Indoor Dining Resumes in N.Y.C.
description: Indoor dining resumed in New York City at 25 percent capacity. However, some diners remained wary as coronavirus cases grew throughout the city.

title: The Postal Service Needs Fixing. Heres How It Could Happen.
description: WASHINGTON  On at least one issue, most of Washington agrees: The Postal Service needs an intervention.

title: The Feats and Failures of Jimmy Carter
description: HIS VERY BESTJimmy Carter, a LifeBy Jonathan Alter

title: Kingdom of Silence Review: A Spotlight on Jamal Khashoggi
description: The documentary Kingdom of Silence is debuting on Showtime two years to the day after Saudi agents killed and dismembered the Washington Post columnist Jamal Khashoggi inside the Saudi consulate in Istanbul. Its aim is not simply to serve as a memorial, or as muckraking, but to capture Khashoggis career in all its contours and contradictions against a backdrop of changing geopolitics.

title: How Bob Dylan Turned David Remnick on to Serious Reading
description: [The Best Books of 2020: View our full list.]

title: The White House press secretary declines to explicitly denounce white supremacy, saying the president has already done so.
description: Kayleigh McEnany, the White House press secretary, repeatedly refused to denounce white supremacy on Thursday, insisting that President Trump had already done so and angrily accusing the media of refusing to accept his answer.

title: In Supreme Court Fight, McSally Sees a Chance to Reboot Her Senate Campaign
description: Shortly after the death of Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg, people close to Senator Martha McSally, the imperiled Arizona Republican, began calling in to offer their advice.

title: On the Rocks Review: Daddy Dearest and His Late Bloomer
description: It isnt surprising how effortlessly Bill Murray takes possession of Sofia Coppolas gently comic On the Rocks  though this hijacking may be more of a sly directorial surrender. Casting Murray is a surefire way to win over an audience. It also means yielding at least part of the movie to him, which is what happens here. He plays a bigger-than-life sybarite whose daughter enlists him to help with her marital woes. If that sounds like a dubious idea for a grown child, its also a playful conceptual gambit for a director whose father, Francis Ford Coppola, casts his own long shadow.

title: Amy Coney Barrett signed an ad in 2006 urging overturning the barbaric legacy of Roe v. Wade.
description: Judge Amy Coney Barrett, President Trumps nominee to Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburgs seat on the Supreme Court, signed a newspaper ad in 2006 that supported overturning Roe v. Wade, the landmark decision establishing the right to abortion.

title: Verne Edquist, Virtuoso Piano Tuner, Is Dead at 89
description: As a piano tuner, Verne Edquist spent his career tweaking the infinitely complicated mechanical actions under the lids of pianos in Toronto, pricking hammers with needles to give the sound different characteristics and adjusting tiny parts with names most pianists do not know  wippens, agraffes, knuckles and backchecks.

title: An Uber Wage Experiment Worked
description: This article is part of the On Tech newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it weekdays.

title: House Democrats pushed through an aid package with little chance of becoming law.
description: House Democrats on Thursday pushed through a $2.2 trillion stimulus plan that would provide aid to families, schools, restaurants, businesses and airline workers, advancing a wish list with little chance of becoming law.

title: Whats Going On in This Graph? | 2020 U.S. Census
description: These graphs, showing the projected share of uncounted addresses for the 2020 United States census as of Sept. 30, appeared elsewhere on NYTimes.com.

title: David Hockney: A Life in Drawing
description: Whether were related by blood or not, our loved ones have been very much with us these last several months. Some have been physically with us, at our elbows, sheltering at home, strengthening and sometimes straining the ties that bind. Or they are with us in absentia, in yearning, across great distances, sometimes oceans. Others are no longer among the living; their absences may have been caused by the current pandemic, leaving a fresh painful void and the suspicion that they died in vain.

title: The Sun Pushed the Limits of Winning, Losing and Playing in Pain
description: The pain of defeat, of a seasons abrupt end, was still raw when Curt Miller emerged from the Connecticut Sun locker room late Tuesday.

title: The Keeper Review: Accepting an Enemy as a Teammate
description: The Keeper is inspired by the true story of Bert Trautmann, a German who during World War II served as an ardent member of the Hitler Youth and later of the Luftwaffe. Then after the war he played soccer in England, as a goalkeeper for Manchester City. His presence on the team, which hired him in 1949, inspired protests, although a Manchester rabbi urged against holding the Nazis crimes against Trautmann individually, and fans eventually accepted him as a star player (particularly after he continued playing with what turned out to be a broken neck when Manchester City won the Football Association Cup in 1956).

title: Help for the jobless has also been a bonanza for criminals.
description: The unemployment insurance system  the main artery for delivering financial assistance to laid-off workers  has been besieged during the coronavirus crisis by fraud schemes aimed at bilking the government out of hundreds of millions of dollars.

title: Companies Ditch Plans for Rapid Coronavirus Spit Tests at Home
description: For months, public health experts have been eagerly watching the companies developing spit tests for the coronavirus that could be used at home, producing results in a matter of minutes.

title: The Good Lord Bird Review: The Necessity of John Brown
description: The Good Lord Bird has not received what you could call kid-glove treatment from Showtime. It was announced for Feb. 16 but pulled, then rescheduled for Aug. 9 and pulled again. It will finally premiere, without much fanfare, this Sunday. Its curious treatment for a prestige mini-series based on a National Book Award-winning novel that was spearheaded by and stars one of Americas most accomplished actors.

title: Membership of Anti-Mask Facebook Groups Jumps Sharply
description: Its no surprise that people pushing anti-mask arguments popped up online around the time the coronavirus pandemic hit the United States in March and April.

title: Fires and Storms Push Demand for Emergency Shelter to a New High
description: WASHINGTON  A year already filled with historic wildfires and hurricanes can now claim another dubious distinction: Americans have spent far more time in emergency housing than in any year during the past decade, smashing 2017s full-year record with three months left to go.

title: Glass Fire Burns in California as Winds Cause Concern
description: Forecasters and fire officials warned that strong, dry gusts, known as Diablo winds, could worsen the Glass Fire. The fire has burned more than 50,000 acres in Californias Napa and Sonoma Counties.

title: 7 Things to Do This Weekend
description: Live theater has returned to Manhattan, though no seats are available. In Voyeur: The Windows of Toulouse-Lautrec, actors from Bated Breath Theater Company will lead eight-person audiences on a walking tour of the West Village. That neighborhood will double for 19th-century Montmartre, the quarter where the artist Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec spent some of his final syphilitic months. The show, conceived and directed by Mara Lieberman with puppet design by James Ortiz, takes place mostly outdoors with one brief foray inside. As audiences wander the Villages wide and narrow byways, masked performers emerge from sidewalk and stoop, conjuring the cabarets and cafes of Bohemian Paris. Through windows, spectators can peek into Toulouse-Lautrecs aperitif-fueled dreams.

title: Gas Tax Spikes in N.J. Because of Pandemics Impact
description: Motorists in New Jersey began reaching deeper into their wallets on Thursday to fill their gas tanks as the states fuel tax rose by more than 9 cents a gallon to the nations fourth-highest rate  a spike linked to a steep decline in traffic during the pandemic.

title: New York and New Jersey join a growing list of states with contact-tracing apps residents can use.
description: Residents of New York and some surrounding states can now use their smartphones to track whether they have come close to someone with the coronavirus.

title: White House Says Trump Has Always Denounced White Supremacy
description: Kayleigh McEnany, the White House press secretary, repeatedly refused to denounce white supremacy on Thursday, insisting that President Trump had already done so.

title: Despite Billions in Fees, Banks Predict Meager Profits on P.P.P. Loans
description: Loath to be seen profiting from the economic disaster caused by the coronavirus, the nations biggest banks were quick to pledge that they would donate to charity any money earned from helping deliver the governments signature small-business relief plan.

title: Why Male Baboons Benefit From Female Friends
description: In the shadow of Mount Kilimanjaro, baboons live out their daily dramas. They tussle, they mate, they care for their young. Some are loners and others have lots of friends.

title: N.F.L.s New Two-Minute Drill: Juggling a Coronavirus Outbreak
description: Football is a game tightly controlled by a clock. Yet through the spring and summer, the N.F.L. had something most coaches and players covet: time.

title: 35 Thoughts About Mario on Super Marios 35th Anniversary
description: Almost exactly 35 years ago, Super Mario Bros., the iconic video game from Nintendo, debuted  making a high-jumping plumber named Mario the Japanese video game companys equivalent of Mickey Mouse.

title: The Best Documentaries on Netflix Right Now
description: Netflix has been the home to some of the best documentaries and docu-series of recent years  some of them produced in-house, some picked up for distribution at prestigious film festivals and some licensed from the top independent production companies. Below is our regularly updated guide to the must-see docs currently on Netflix, subdivided by genre. (Note: Netflix sometimes removes titles without notice.)

title: White Actors and Directors Still Dominate Broadway Stages, Report Finds
description: White actors, writers and directors still dominate Broadway stages, according to an annual report released on Wednesday by the Asian American Performers Action Coalition in partnership with the American Theater Wing.

title: What to Do With Your Plants for the Winter
description: Its time to decide: Should you bother trying to save the plants youve been laboring over all summer or just buy replacements come spring?

title: Please Let Me Terrify Some Kids on Halloween
description: I have always loved the holidays. All holidays. Im a quarter Christmas elf on my mothers side, and Thanksgiving at my house has topped out as high as 70 guests. The Easter Bunny always appears in spring, as do sparklers in July. If it were legal, Id rent a woodchuck for Groundhog Day.

title: Stream These Great British Detective Shows
description: Through its Watching newsletter, What to Watch page and many curated lists, The New York Times looks to guide readers through the chaotic world of streaming services and offer recommendations of the best films and TV shows to watch.

title: Please Keep Snow Days
description: To the Editor:

title: For French Open Contenders, Serving Is Mental. So Stop Thinking So Much.
description: PARIS  Raffaella Reggi rose to 13th in the world in womens tennis in the late 1980s despite a serve so balky she once recorded 28 double faults in a match in Rome. With the shrill voices of fans pleading with her to use an underhand motion still ringing in her ears, Reggi said she walked into the press room afterward and professed, I have no idea how to serve.

title: Turkey Jumps Into Another Foreign Conflict, This Time in the Caucasus
description: ANKARA  When a long-simmering conflict in the south Caucasus burst into open warfare this week, Turkeys President Recep Tayyip Erdogan was the first world leader to jump into the fray.

title: How Californias Diablo Winds Could Worsen Wildfires
description: Millions of acres in California have already burned during this years California wildfire season. But forecasters say that hot, dry air known as Diablo winds in portions of Northern California could make fires even more destructive.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: China has kicked off Golden Week, the annual spree of shopping and travel built around the Oct. 1 National Day celebrations, and the first major holiday since the country brought its coronavirus outbreak more or less under control.

title: Owners of BitMEX, a Leading Bitcoin Exchange, Face Criminal Charges
description: American authorities brought criminal charges on Thursday against the owners of one of the worlds biggest cryptocurrency trading exchanges, BitMEX, accusing them of allowing the Hong Kong-based company to launder money and engage in other illegal transactions.

title: Citing security, Texas governor limits counties to one spot each for in-person ballot drop-offs.
description: Gov. Greg Abbott of Texas issued a proclamation on Thursday ordering counties to offer only one location for voters to drop off mail-in ballots in person.

title: Whitney Biennial Postponed Until 2022
description: The Whitney Biennial that was scheduled for spring 2021 has been postponed for a year, the museum said on Thursday, months after the pandemic interrupted its exhibition schedule and cast a long shadow of uncertainty.

title: Stanley McChrystal, a Top General Fired Over Insults to Biden, Says Hell Vote for Him
description: WASHINGTON  On the day it was published in the summer of 2010, the Rolling Stone article electrified Washington in a way that almost seems quaint by todays news standards: The commander of American troops in Afghanistan, Gen. Stanley A. McChrystal, and his aides were quoted privately mocking several government officials. One McChrystal aide referred to Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. using the phrase bite me.

title: Republicans Sow Doubts About Debate Fairness
description: After Tuesdays chaotic presidential debate, in which President Trump repeatedly ignored the ground rules, his supporters turned their anger on Chris Wallace, the Fox News anchor who served as the debates moderator, accusing him of being biased against the president.

title: Companies ditch plans for rapid spit tests at home.
description: The technology for rapid saliva-based coronavirus tests that could be used at home is not panning out the way some have hoped.

title: Government Lawsuit Over John Boltons Memoir May Proceed, Judge Rules
description: WASHINGTON  A judge declined on Thursday to dismiss a federal lawsuit against John R. Bolton, President Trumps former national security adviser, in which the Justice Department is seeking to seize his $2 million advance and any future proceeds from his recently published memoir.

title: Film Club: Tears Teacher
The Trump campaign relocates one of Saturdays Wisconsin rallies after criticism over a spike in coronavirus cases.
description: President Trump abandoned plans to hold a rally Saturday night in La Crosse, Wis., and will move the event to another part of the state after the mayor pleaded for the event to be canceled because the area is experiencing a spike in coronavirus cases.

title: Pelosi Hopeful for Another Coronavirus Relief Package
description: Speaker Nancy Pelosi told reporters that Republicans and Democrats were still in talks about a coronavirus relief package.

title: John Turner, Briefly Its Leader but Long a Force in Canada, Dies at 91
description: John Turner, a Canadian politician who introduced major reforms to Canadian law, fleetingly served as prime minister and then rose again to prominence by leading the opposition to a free trade deal with the United States, died on Sept. 19 at his home in Toronto. He was 91.

title: Few Games, but Very Little FOMO, in College Footballs Less Glamorous Tier
description: The North Dakota State Bison, who have won eight national titles in the last decade in the Football Championship Subdivision, will open their fall season on Saturday in Fargo.

title: Airlines, Facing a Painfully Slow Recovery, Begin Furloughing Thousands
description: When Congress gave passenger airlines a $50 billion bailout in March, industry executives hoped the aid would tide them over until the fall, when more people might be traveling and a vaccine might be closer at hand. Several months later, that hopeful future remains extremely murky.

title: From Geoffrey Chadsey, a Visual Diary of the Last Days of Summer
description: The Brooklyn-based artist Geoffrey Chadsey is known for his meticulous water-soluble-pencil-and-crayon drawings on mylar of unnerving figures in various states of undress. They bare themselves while kind of glaring at you, the artist, 53, says of his invented subjects, whom he frequently bestows with ambiguous forms and states of mind  a portrait might feature a hairy chest and curvy hips, a ghostly set of extra limbs, or a fanny pack and antlers. Currently, Chadsey is working on a new series for a 2021 show at Jack Shainman Gallery in New York and thinking more than ever about how an exposed body can be monstrous, clownish and, at the same time, really touching.

title: Alarmed by Trump: The Debate Fallout
description: To the Editor:

title: 100,000 New Mail-In Ballots Go Out, but N.Y. Voters Are Now Wary
description: Two days after officials said that as many as 100,000 voters had received faulty absentee ballots in Brooklyn, it remained unclear how many people had actually been affected, and confused voters said they now distrusted the process.

title: How Much Watching Time Do You Have This Weekend?
description: Every Monday, Wednesday and Friday, Margaret offers hyper-specific viewing recommendations in our Watching newsletter. Read her latest picks below, and sign up for the Watching newsletter here.

title: Trump Virtually Cuts Off Refugees as He Unleashes a Tirade on Immigrants
description: WASHINGTON  The Trump administration said it would cut its already rock-bottom refugee admissions still deeper into record territory for the upcoming year, as President Trump returned to his anti-immigrant themes in the closing month of his re-election campaign.

title: 10 New Books We Recommend This Week
description: It never dawned on me at the start of this pandemic, when everybody was raising their drawbridges and lowering their blinds to hunker down solo in quarantine, that I might make new friends in the midst of it all. But as the days grew longer and I took my dog on increasingly roundabout walks through our neighborhood, people emerged: children first, wanting to pet Whimsy or throw his ball, and then their parents behind them, chatting at an epidemiologically safe distance about sports or school or working from home. Or books! Some of my neighbors are real readers, it turns out, and books  what were reading, what we recommend  can provide a reliable source of social connection even in a time of social distancing.

title: Lebanon and Israel, Officially Enemies, Agree to Talks on Sea Border
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Lebanon and Israel have agreed to open their first negotiations on nonsecurity issues in three decades, a rare if limited breakthrough between hostile neighbors that are technically at war and have no formal diplomatic relations.

title: Biden breaks the $365 million fund-raising record that he set in August.
description: Joseph R. Biden Jr. raised more money in August than any past presidential candidate had in a single month: $364.5 million. Now he has done it again.

title: Federal Prisons Will Let Inmates Have Visitors During Pandemic
description: Relatives and friends will be permitted once again to begin visiting inmates in federal prisons as of Saturday, six months after such visits were ended over concerns about the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Jobs, N.Y.C. Schools, Ella Fitzgerald: Your Thursday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this newsletter in your inbox? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Rene C. Fox, Founding Figure of Medical Sociology, Dies at 92
description: Rene C. Fox, a leading scholar of medical sociology, a field she was instrumental in creating in an era when women had a difficult time being heard in academia, died on Sept. 23 at a hospice center in Philadelphia. She was 92.

title: This Is An Amazing Moment, Says N.Y.C. Mayor on Schools Reopening
description: New York City reopened all of its public schools, the largest school system in the U.S., and Mayor Bill de Blasio said they will implement monthly coronavirus testing for students and teachers to keep everyone safe.

title: Should the Presidential Debates Be Canceled?
description: This article is part of the Debatable newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it on Tuesdays and Thursdays.

title: Yuri Orlov, Bold Champion of Soviet Dissidents, Dies at 96
description: Yuri Orlov, a Soviet physicist and disillusioned former Communist who publicly held Moscow accountable for failing to protect the rights of dissidents and was imprisoned and exiled for his own apostasy, died on Sunday at his home in Ithaca, N.Y. He was 96.

title: Grace Meo, Skilled Seamstress and Serious Sinatra Fan, Dies at 93
description: This obituary is part of a series about people who have died in the coronavirus pandemic. Read about others here.

title: Data Shows Fewer Afghan Women Than Men Get Covid. Thats Bad News.
description: Sarah Hawkes, co-director of the Global Health 50/50 research group

title: Unemployed Stage Actors to Face New Health Insurance Hurdle
description: Facing enormous financial strain because of the shutdown of the theater industry, the health insurance fund that covers thousands of stage actors is making it more difficult for them to qualify for coverage.

title: New Layoffs Add to Worries Over U.S. Economic Slowdown
description: The American economy is being buffeted by a fresh round of corporate layoffs, signaling new anxiety about the course of the coronavirus pandemic and uncertainty about further legislative relief.

title: Joe Laurinaitis, a Star as Tag Teams Animal, Dies at 60
description: Joe Laurinaitis, half of a tag team known as the Road Warriors who brought a brash, muscular showmanship to professional wrestling in the 1980s and were among the sports biggest stars in that era, died on Sept. 22 in Missouri. He was 60.

title: Amy Coney Barrett, Trumps Supreme Court Pick, Signed Anti-Abortion Ad
description: WASHINGTON  Judge Amy Coney Barrett, President Trumps Supreme Court nominee, signed a statement in a 2006 newspaper advertisement opposing abortion on demand.

title: Spotlighting Health Care, Democrats Seek to Use Court Fight to Damage Republicans
description: WASHINGTON  Senate Democrats have begun a concerted push to make the fight over Judge Amy Coney Barretts confirmation to the Supreme Court a referendum on the Affordable Care Act, working to turn a short-term victory for President Trump and Republicans into a liability that could cost them control of the Senate.

title: The Miami Heat Were Hot. Now Theyre Hurting.
description: LAKE BUENA VISTA, Fla.  Before it all began to fall apart for the Miami Heat, Erik Spoelstra, the teams coach, reflected on a time before it all came together.

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
description: The American economy is continuing to show signs of struggle, and many economists are becoming increasingly anxious about the months ahead.

title: Raised by Wolves: Ridley Scott Explains That Monstrous Finale
description: This interview includes spoilers for the first season of Raised by Wolves.

title: Politically Connected N.Y. Union Boss Is Accused of Shocking Corruption
description: One of the most powerful and politically connected union leaders in New York State has been indicted on racketeering and fraud charges, the authorities said on Thursday.

title: Wisconsin Is Frazzled by Surging Virus Cases and Growing Campaign Frenzy
description: OSHKOSH, Wis.  Steve VanderLoop, 64, heard that several of his co-workers at a manufacturing plant in Wisconsin had fallen ill from Covid-19. Then there was his brother-in-laws entire family in nearby Washington County. A good friend in Appleton, up the shore of Lake Winnebago. And last week, the gut punch: Mr. VanderLoops 96-year-old mother learned she had the virus.

title: The Very Strong Case for Bidenomics
description: Thanks to Donald Trumps shouting and nonstop lying, there wasnt much of a substantive policy discussion at the debate on Tuesday.

title: At His Core, Trump Is an Immoralist
description: So far, the 21st century has been a century of menace and insecurity. The threats have come in rapid succession: terrorism, financial collapse, plague, climate change, the quaking of our democracy. For good reasons, a tone of heightened alarm has become the default setting across the media.

title: McMaster, Mostly Silent Until Now, Says Trump Is Aiding and Abetting Putins Efforts
description: The retired Lt. Gen. H.R. McMaster became the latest of President Trumps former aides on Thursday to declare that the president was aiding Russias disinformation campaign by failing to acknowledge how President Vladimir V. Putin was trying to manipulate American voters.

title: Michigan charges two right-wing operatives with felonies over voter suppression scheme.
description: Two right-wing political operatives were charged Thursday with a series of felonies in connection with a robocall scheme that Michigans attorney general said was part of a broad effort intended to intimidate minority voters from casting mail-in ballots.

title: Facing Grim Polls, Trump Leans Into Playing the Victim
description: [Follow our latest coverage of the Biden vs. Trump 2020 election.]

title: As Trump Sows Doubts on Mail, Some Democrats Push In-Person Voting
description: [Watch live VP debate and analysis.]

title: How Likely Is Election Doomsday?
description: Hi. Welcome to On Politics, your guide to the day in national politics. Im Lisa Lerer, your host.

title: What Students Are Saying About Democracy, Caring For Plants and Flights to Nowhere
description: For this roundup of student comments on our writing prompts, we asked teenagers to reflect on how their generation is fighting for democracy, to tell us if they have ever grown anything and to muse about if they would take a flight to nowhere.

title: Judge Blocks Trumps Ban on Foreign Workers
description: LOS ANGELES  A federal judge ruled on Thursday that President Trump overstepped his authority in suspending new visas for hundreds of thousands of foreign workers amid the coronavirus pandemic, enabling major companies like Microsoft, Goodyear Tire and Exxon Mobil to resume bringing employees from abroad.

title: Teenagers in The Times: September 2020
description: Here is the September edition of Teenagers in The Times, a roundup of the news and feature stories about young people that have recently appeared across sections of NYTimes.com. We publish a new edition on the first Thursday of each month.

title: With Bipartisan Deal Elusive, Democrats Push Through Their Own Stimulus Bill
description: WASHINGTON  House Democrats pushed through a $2.2 trillion stimulus plan on Thursday that would provide aid to families, schools, restaurants, businesses and airline workers, advancing a wish list with little chance of becoming law as negotiations with the Trump administration failed to yield a bipartisan agreement.

title: A top Trump aide has tested positive for the virus.
description: One of President Trumps most senior advisers has tested positive for the coronavirus, three people familiar with the matter said Thursday night.

title: Trump Says Hell Begin Quarantine Process After Hope Hicks Tests Positive for Coronavirus
description: [Update: President Trump has tweeted that he and the first lady, Melania Trump, tested positive for the coronavirus. Follow our live coverage. ]

title: One Hand Washes the Other
description: FRIDAY PUZZLE  A quick programming note before we begin: I will be on another assignment next week, but you will be in the very clean and excellent hands of Helen Verongos and Caitlin Lovinger.

title: Judge Overturns Murder Conviction, Citing Racial Animus in Prosecutors Emails
description: Frances Choy was 17 when she was arrested in 2003 and charged with pouring gasoline around her home in Brockton, Mass., and setting a fire that killed her parents. After two trials ended in hung juries, she was convicted on murder and arson charges in 2011 and sentenced to life in prison without parole.

title: In Profane Rant, Melania Trump Takes Aim at Migrant Children and Critics
description: WASHINGTON  The first lady, Melania Trump, delivered a profanity-laced rant about Christmas decorations at the White House and mocked the plight of migrant children who were separated from their parents at the border in 2018 during a conversation secretly taped by a former aide and close confidante.

title: Quotation of the Day: When Your Job Is to Ensure Nov. 3 Isnt a Debacle
description: There are a lot of OMGs.

title: Real Estate Sales Continue to Stagnate in Manhattan
description: Despite hopes that New Yorks real estate market would spring back to life over the summer after the coronavirus lockdown was lifted in June, the number of closed sales in Manhattan was down by 46 percent in the third quarter compared to the same period in 2019, according to new sales data.

title: In My Sari, Kissing the Soccer Coach
description: Seeing the movie Bend It Like Beckham on a Girl Scouts overnight shaped my romantic preferences for years to come. As the sole Desi member of our suburban Indiana troop, I watched in a state of bliss, relieved to finally see someone who looked like me onscreen.

title: 2020 French Open: What to Watch on Friday
description: How to watch: 5 a.m. to 3 p.m. on the Tennis Channel; streaming on the Tennis Channel app.

title: Preakness Stakes Experts Picks: Who Will Win?
description: The Preakness Stakes, normally run on the third weekend in May as the second leg of thoroughbred racings Triple Crown, will instead take place this Saturday, becoming the final race in the 2020 series because of schedule changes related to the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Corrections: Oct. 2, 2020
description: An article on Wednesday about the decision to impose tough shutdown measures in Quebec after a resurgence in coronavirus cases misstated the title of David Buckeridge of McGill University in Montreal. He is a professor, not an assistant professor.

title: The Oakland As Conquer One Demon. Could the Astros Be Next?
description: No team knows the agony of instant elimination like the Oakland Athletics. In the eight seasons of the Major League Baseball wild card game, only the As found a way to lose it three times: to Kansas City in 2014, the Yankees in 2018 and Tampa Bay last October.

title: 30 Years After Reunification, Old German-German Border Is a Green Oasis
description: MITWITZ, Germany  Two men, one riding a bicycle, the other wearing binoculars, met in a field in the middle of Germany on a recent afternoon. Both 61, they started arguing politely, the way strangers do, about where exactly the border between East and West Germany had been. Soon, it became clear that both had good reason to think they were right.

title: Trumps Positive Coronavirus Test, Belarus Sanctions, Aleksei Navalny: Your Friday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: New Jersey Mans Body Is Recovered From the Depths of Lake Tahoe
description: In early August, Ryan Normoyle steered a rented open-bow boat into Lake Tahoe, set his phone up so he could record himself, and jumped into the cobalt-blue water.

title: Eliud Kipchoge Emerges as the Philosopher-King of Running
description: KAPTAGAT, Kenya  One afternoon in January, three months after he became the first man to run a marathon in under two hours, Eliud Kipchoge sat on a bench inside his Rift Valley training camp, reflecting on how it felt to be a newly minted sporting icon.

title: Trump Tests Positive for the Coronavirus
description: [Read our live updates on President Trumps coronavirus diagnosis.]

title: Indonesias Stimulus Plan Draws Fire From Environmentalists and Unions
description: BANGKOK  Indonesias Parliament is on the verge of approving a sweeping coronavirus stimulus package that opponents charge would undermine worker protections and permit widespread destruction of the countrys rainforests.

title: Word + Quiz: patina
Covid-19 Upends South Koreas Thanksgiving, and Its Rituals
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Once a year for the past three decades, the Joo brothers have traveled back to their hometown from South Koreas capital to mark the Chuseok holiday.

title: Trump and first lady test positive for the virus.
description: President Trump said early Friday that he and his wife, Melania, had tested positive for the coronavirus, throwing the nations leadership into uncertainty and escalating the crisis posed by a pandemic that has already killed more than 207,000  Americans and devastated the economy.

title: Trumps positive cause global markets to tumble.
description: Global markets dropped early Friday after President Trump said that he and the first lady had tested positive for the coronavirus.

title: Trumps Coronavirus Is Another Jolt of Uncertainty for Investors
description: Theres a pandemic, an economic recovery thats losing steam, stalled stimulus talks in Congress and a deeply contentious election that has raised the specter of a constitutional crisis. As if that were not enough to make investors anxious, President Trump provided another reason to worry in the wee hours of Friday.

title: Trumps Secret Service Has Struggled With Outbreak at Training Center
description: WASHINGTON  The Secret Service sustained a coronavirus outbreak at its training facility in Maryland in August, weeks before President Trump was infected, evidence of growing infections at the agency responsible for protecting the president.

title: Trump Tests Positive for Coronavirus, and the World Shudders
description: LONDON  President Trumps disclosure that he had been infected by the coronavirus sent a shudder around the world on Friday, drawing sympathy from leaders who have grappled with the pandemic in their own countries and more pointed responses from critics who noted Mr. Trumps cavalier handling of the threat.

title: Sitting and Standing
W.N.B.A. Finals Storm-Aces Preview: A Battle of M.V.P.s
description: A rapid-fire W.N.B.A season will end with a finals collision between the leagues top two teams: the Las Vegas Aces and the Seattle Storm.

title: Do Politics Belong in Retirement Planning?
description: In a sharply polarized environment, Americans saving for retirement are increasingly concerned about politics  those of their financial advisers.

title: Colleges Learn How to Suppress Coronavirus: Extensive Testing
description: In rural Iowa, just one of the 875 students on Cornell Colleges campus has tested positive for the coronavirus this semester. At Amherst College in Massachusetts, the number of undergraduate virus cases has been a bit higher: three.

title: TV news networks begin live coverage of the presidents infection.
description: Television news networks leapt into breaking news mode early Friday morning, rousing anchors and correspondents from their beds as the nation began to absorb the news about President Trump and the first lady.

title: On Monday, Trump Updated the Nation on Virus Strategy. By Friday, He Tested Positive.
description: WASHINGTON  On Monday, President Trump updated the nation on the administrations coronavirus testing strategy and announced a plan to distribute 150 million rapid tests. By early Friday morning, he had the virus himself.

title: Lesson of the Day: As Covid-19 Closes Schools, the Worlds Children Go to Work
description: Featured Article: As Covid-19 Closes Schools, the Worlds Children Go to Work by Jeffrey Gettleman and Suhasini Raj

title: In His Own Words, Trump on the Coronavirus and Masks
description: President Trump  who insisted when the coronavirus first emerged that it would not be a threat in the United States  spent months playing down the effectiveness of masks, initially refused to be photographed with one on and this week mocked former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. for wearing one.

title: Every Place Under Threat
description: In the Amazon, today's environmental problems become tomorrow's catastrophe.

title: Trumps Positive Coronavirus Test Upends Campaign in Final Stretch
description: [Watch live VP debate and analysis.]

title: The U.S. presidential campaign is upended in its final stretch.
description: President Trumps announcement early Friday that he had contracted the coronavirus upended the presidential race in an instant, inviting significant questions about his cavalier attitude toward the pandemic and the future of his campaign just 32 days before the election.

title: New in Paperback: Running Home and The Shadow King
description: ONE GIANT LEAP: The Impossible Mission That Flew Us to the Moon, by Charles Fishman. (Simon & Schuster, 512 pp., $18.)
