title: Laurie Santos Says Self-Care Doesnt Have to Be Selfish
description: Laurie Santos, a psychology professor at Yale University and host of The Happiness Lab podcast, is a leading expert in positive psychology, a relatively young field. Since she began teaching The Science of Well-Being in 2018, it has become the most popular course in Yales history, with nearly a quarter of students enrolling. The class, now online for free, applies what Dr. Santos calls a preventative medicine approach to mental health  harnessing science and evidence to help people lead more fulfilling lives.

title: What You Get for $375,000
description: A two-story brick rowhouse in Philadelphia; a converted 1893 church in Castleton, Vt.; and a one-bedroom condo in Austin, Texas.

title: $375,000 Homes in Pennsylvania, Vermont and Texas
description: This brick house is in the East Passyunk Crossing neighborhood in South Philadelphia, about two miles from Center City and close to restaurants (currently with street dining), vintage stores, cafes, parks and the Singing Fountain at East Passyunk Avenue north of Tasker Street, which belts out Sinatra and other standards from hidden speakers.

title: Berlin Trial Opens for Man Charged With Murder on Behalf of Russia
description: BERLIN  The trial opened on Wednesday for a Russian man accused of murdering a former Chechen field commander in a Berlin park last year, allegedly at the behest of the Russian state.

title: Backlash Grows in Orthodox Jewish Areas Over Virus Crackdown by Cuomo
description: [Latest updates: How a virus surge among Orthodox Jews became a crisis for New York.]

title: This Castle (Almost) Survived the Hundred Years War
description: This 11th-century castle on 94 acres in the French village of Verteuil-sur-Charente is on the market for $3.3 million.

title: House Hunting in France: A Once-in-a-Millennium Castle for $3.3 Million
description: Perched above the Charente river and the village of Verteuil-sur-Charente, among the rolling hills of Frances Poitou-Charentes region, this 94-acre estate comes with a 14-bedroom stone castle, a separate library, chapels and a watchtower.

title: Montenegros most prominent cleric has tested positive.
description: The most prominent religious leader in Montenegro, who once described a pilgrimage as Gods vaccine, has tested positive for the coronavirus and is in stable condition, his representatives said on Wednesday.

title: Manhattan D.A. Can Obtain Trumps Tax Returns, Judges Rule
description: The Manhattan district attorney can enforce a subpoena seeking President Trumps personal and corporate tax returns, a federal appeals panel ruled on Wednesday, dealing yet another blow to the presidents yearlong battle to keep his financial records out of the hands of state prosecutors.

title: Islamic State Beatles Jailers Are Charged in Abuse of Murdered Hostages
description: WASHINGTON Two notorious Islamic State detainees from Britain were brought to the United States on Wednesday to face federal charges over accusations that they jailed and tortured Western hostages, some of whom were beheaded, Justice Department officials said.

title: SITI Company Announces Final Season
description: After 30 seasons, Anne Bogart and Tadashi Suzukis famed experimental New York theater company will take its final bow in 2022.

title: 10 Monologues That Make Solo Music
description: The shutdown of live theater has meant a boom in short, sharp Zoom monologues. But the form goes way back, before social isolation, and some of the most celebrated examples are full-length shows. (One of them, Fleabag, went on to be adapted into an award-winning multicharacter television series.)

title: It Takes One: How the Monologue Speaks Loudest in Lockdown
description: Youve been talking to yourself again, havent you? It seems fair to assume that such behavior has become, well, pandemic during the past six months. Thats a natural thing to do in quarantine, when the mind is seething with internal conversations and possibilities for real dialogue are frustratingly limited.

title: Heres what polling tells us ahead of the debate.
description: As they prepare for their debate, Vice President Mike Pence and Senator Kamala Harris are confronting an electorate that is more or less divided. About one-fifth of voters say they dont have much of an opinion of each candidate, but among those who do, strong opinions outnumber mildly favorable or unfavorable views.

title: Biden says if Trump still has Covid, we shouldnt have a debate.
description: Joseph R. Biden Jr. said on Tuesday night that there should not be a presidential debate next week in Miami if President Trump still has Covid, just hours after Mr. Trump said he intended to participate in the event.

title: An attack ad targets a non-politician: Mark Zuckerberg.
description: In the final weeks of the election, ads will air across the country attacking President Trump, Joseph R. Biden Jr., incumbent senators and representatives, their challengers  even sheriffs wont be spared.

title: Arizona Senate candidates sparred over health care and the president in their only debate.
description: Senator Martha McSally, Republican of Arizona, and her Democratic challenger, Mark Kelly, attempted to shed their party labels Tuesday night and reach out to independent voters in their only debate for the seat Ms. McSally was appointed to in 2018.

title: Why this vice-presidential debate could be far different from its predecessors.
description: Vice-presidential debates  like tonights  are usually low-voltage affairs. Thats not to say there isnt plenty of spirited argument, but they usually arent particularly well watched nor do they have much of an impact on the outcome. People vote for the president.

title: Republicans are spending $60 million on a digital get-out-the-vote campaign.
description: With voting underway in more than 30 states, the Republican National Committee has begun a $60 million digital get-out-the-vote campaign that will harness social media, text messaging, email and other platforms to digitally chase voters.

title: Eddie Van Halen, the Shredder Supreme
description: Eddie Van Halen played not just fast but hyperfast. He played loud. He was flashy, assertive and explosive, often interrupting one virtuosic display with an even showier screech or run or glissando. As the lead guitarist in Van Halen, he plucked, tapped, strummed, bent, flicked, pinged and scraped his strings, simultaneously supporting his bands lead singers and goading them with manic counterpoint.

title: The Yankees Tried a Sneaky Move With All the Wrong Pieces
description: The Yankees tried to beat the Tampa Bay Rays at their own game in their American League division series on Tuesday. But they failed to grasp how that game is played.

title: A court rules that Arizona voters must fix missing signatures by Election Day.
description: Ballots in Arizona that have missing signatures must be corrected by a voter before Election Day, rather than five days after, in order for their vote to count, a federal appeals court ruled on Tuesday.

title: Mapo Tofu Wins the Day
description: Good morning. Andrea Nguyen is in The Times this week with a delightful exploration of her decadeslong fascination with mapo tofu, the fiery, fragrant specialty of Sichuan Province in China. Years of eating and reporting have led her to a bulletproof recipe for the dish (above) and, more recently, to the courage to use the flavors of the original to inform other dishes, including mapo tofu spaghetti and amazing mapo tofu nachos.

title: Baptized in Blackness: Why Homecoming Is Vital to the Black College Experience
description: Our video asks H.B.C.U. students and alumni what homecoming means to them, and what is lost this year as festivities go virtual.

title: Welcome to Homecoming!
description: At historically Black colleges and universities (known as H.B.C.U.s), homecoming is more than a football game.

title: Hurricane Delta Hits Mexico
description: Hurricane Delta made landfall in Mexico on Wednesday as a Category 2 storm and could produce life-threatening conditions in the Yucatn Peninsula, according to the U.S. National Hurricane Center.

title: How to watch tonights vice-presidential debate.
description: The debate between Vice President Mike Pence and Kamala Harris takes place on Wednesday night from 9 to 10:30 p.m. Eastern. Here are some of the many ways you can watch it:

title: Johnny Nash, Who Sang I Can See Clearly Now, Dies at 80
description: Johnny Nash, a singer whose I Can See Clearly Now reached No. 1 on the Billboard charts in 1972, helping to bring reggae music to a mainstream audience in the United States and over the decades becoming an anthem of optimism and renewal, died on Tuesday at his home in Houston. He was 80.

title: N.F.L.s Coronavirus Cases Rise With New Positive Tests
description: For the second straight week, the N.F.L. is grappling with the fallout from positive coronavirus tests, an existential threat to the leagues adherence to playing the season according to its schedule.

title: A $200 Winter Round Trip to the Tropics?
description: The airline industry, as we have known it for decades, is over. A restructured industry will be landing soon, changing how we fly and what we fly.

title: How Will Pence Fare vs. Harris? 5 Moments From 2016 Offer Clues
description: This is not Mike Pences first vice-presidential campaign debate. In 2016, he faced Senator Tim Kaine of Virginia, Hillary Clintons running mate. It was a vigorous and contentious 90 minutes, and it gives a hint of what Mr. Pence might be like on Wednesday night when he debates Senator Kamala Harris, the Democratic vice-presidential candidate.

title: Joseph L. Bruno, Power Broker in New York Senate, Dies at 91
description: Joseph L. Bruno, a Rensselaer County Republican who rose from poverty to a pinnacle of power as the New York State Senate majority leader, but fell from grace when he spent a decade fighting corruptions charges of which he was ultimately acquitted, died late Tuesday at his home in Brunswick, N.Y. He was 91.

title: Hillary Clinton and Stacey Abrams accuse the Trump campaign of encouraging voter intimidation.
description: Commiserating over their narrow defeats in the 2016 presidential election and the 2018 Georgia governors race, Hillary Clinton and Stacey Abrams warned Democrats that history could repeat itself if they are not prepared to combat voter suppression tactics by the Trump campaign.

title: Metallicas Kirk Hammett: Eddie Van Halen Blew Open Everyones Minds
description: Earlier this year, Metallicas Kirk Hammett got word that one of his favorite guitarists was not well, and if you wanted to say goodbye to Eddie Van Halen, nows the time.

title: Modern Science Didnt Appear Until the 17th Century. What Took So Long?
description: The Nobel Prize-winning physicist Richard Feynman once recalled a friend, an artist, who would say that he could properly appreciate the beauty of a flower, while a scientist like Feynman always insisted on taking the flower apart and making it dull. Of course, Feynman disagreed. I can imagine the cells inside, which also have a beauty, Feynman wrote, calling his friends prejudice nutty. There are all kinds of interesting questions that come from a knowledge of science, which only adds to the excitement and mystery and awe of a flower.

title: The plexiglass barriers at tonights debate will be pretty useless, virus experts say.
description: A box fan, an air filter  and duct tape to attach them. With four such devices cobbled together for a grand total of about $150, the vice-presidential debate on Wednesday night can be made much safer than with the plexiglass barriers being used, according to experts in airborne viruses.

title: The Manhattan D.A. can obtain Trumps tax returns, an appeals panel rules.
description: The Manhattan district attorney can enforce a subpoena seeking President Trumps personal and corporate tax returns, a federal appeals panel ruled on Wednesday, dealing yet another blow to the presidents yearlong battle to deny prosecutors his financial records.

title: New York City Shopping Inches Back. No Store Required.
description: The city is woollier than its been in a while  everyone seems to be crimping the usual boundaries. E-bikes and scooters zip through the middle of the street, and restaurants have annexed the pavement outside their doors in hopes of keeping their businesses afloat. After a brutal spring and summer of pandemic uncertainty and economic instability, New York is doing its best to pass for its old self, but in truth, things havent felt this unsteady since right after 9/11.

title: The World According to Bad Bunny
description: The Puerto Rican reggaetonero has come to dominate global pop on his own terms.

title: These Americans Are Determined to Cast a Last Ballot Before Dying
description: Annamarie Eggert has voted in every presidential election since 1948, when she cast her ballot for Harry S. Truman. Now she is 94 and ailing, but she is determined to vote in this one, too.

title: Putin, whose government has been accused of aiding Trump, praises Democrats in an interview.
description: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia, whose government was accused by American officials of interfering in the 2016 American election to help the Trump campaign, gave a wide-ranging interview on American politics on Wednesday in which he spoke warmly about Democrats.

title: U.S. Announces Multiple Charges for Islamic State Beatles Jailers
description: Justice Department officials and the F.B.I. director, Christopher A. Wray, announced that two Islamic State detainees from Britain will face federal charges over accusations that they jailed and tortured hostages.

title: Covid, Climate and Denial
description: Welcome to the Climate Fwd: newsletter. Please join us on Thursday for the latest episode in our virtual event series, Netting Zero. This panel, moderated by Somini Sengupta, our international climate reporter, will focus on solutions to reduce emissions within food systems. You can sign-up here.

title: A Choir Finds a Way to Sing. Just Ignore the Steering Wheel.
description: I love singing four-part harmony. It isnt just about the precision, the ringing sound when voices blend together. Its also about community, listening to one another and breathing together, creating a mood-lifter and balm in a fraught world.

title: Congress Agrees: Big Tech Is Broken.
description: This article is part of the On Tech newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it weekdays.

title: With Three Simple Words, Thomas Jefferson Byrd Etched a Memory
description: There is a scene in Spike Lees Get on the Bus that has always stuck with me.

title: Trump ad enlists an ex-football player (and accused insider trader) to tout the presidents criminal justice reform.
description: With President Trump trailing badly in the polls and garnering single-digit support from Black voters, his campaign broadcast an advertisement on Sunday voiced by a former pro football player touting the presidents support for criminal justice reform.

title: Inside the C.I.A.
description: Looking back on his youth, John O. Brennan, the former director of the Central Intelligence Agency, recalls having been an earring-wearing, at least one-time hashish-smoking rebel who in the 1976 election cast a ballot for the Communist Partys presidential candidate  a protest vote spurred by his disgust at the partisan politics of both the Democrats and the Republicans, he writes in his memoir, Undaunted: My Fight Against Americas Enemies, at Home and Abroad. A few years later, when he applied for a job at the C.I.A., Brennan confessed this vote but was assured that it would not affect his application  a response affirming my rights as a citizen that dispelled any concerns I had about joining an organization that had been routinely accused over the years of flouting American values and liberties. Brennan had found his own group: the permanent national security bureaucracy that President Trump would someday portray as an evil deep state.

title: The Biden campaign talks up Mike Pences debate skills before he faces Kamala Harris.
description: Biden campaign surrogates played up Vice President Mike Pences skill as a debater ahead of his matchup with Senator Kamala Harris on Wednesday, while previewing how Ms. Harris planned to make a case against President Trumps handling of the coronavirus.

title: LeBron James Is Mr. October This Year
description: Want more basketball in your inbox? Sign up for Marc Steins weekly N.B.A. newsletter here.

title: Biden Leads Trump in Nevada and the Two Are Tied in Ohio, Polls Show
description: [Follow our live polls tracker on Trump vs Biden.]

title: British Dorms on Lockdown After Coronavirus Outbreaks
description: This is the Coronavirus Schools Briefing, a guide to the seismic changes in U.S. education that are taking place during the pandemic. Sign up here to get this newsletter in your inbox.

title: Theater to Stream: Scotland Speaks and Nurses Get Their Say
description: Much of the theater made since the pandemic has been on Zoom, but surprisingly the behaviors induced by the platform itself have been underexplored. Enter Natalie Margolins goofy, eye-opening  and hopefully not overly prescient  play The Party Hop.

title: Lyon Gardiner Tyler Jr., Grandson of the 10th President, Dies at 95
description: Lyon Gardiner Tyler Jr., the older of two surviving grandsons of the 10th president of the United States, John Tyler, and part of a genealogical marvel that in just three generations spanned almost the entire history of the United States, died on Sept. 26 in Franklin, Tenn. He was 95.

title: Biden leads Trump in Nevada and the two are tied in Ohio, New York Times polls find.
description: Joseph R. Biden Jr. maintains a steady lead over President Trump in Nevada and the two are virtually tied in Ohio, as voters continue to express dissatisfaction with the presidents handling of the pandemic, according to New York Times/Siena College polls released Wednesday.

title: BuzzFeed News Pulls Reporter From White House, Citing Virus Risk
description: BuzzFeed News has pulled a political correspondent from the White House press pool, citing concerns that the area has become a coronavirus hot zone after President Trump, many of his top aides  including the press secretary Kayleigh McEnany  and several journalists have tested positive for the virus.

title: In Scuttling Stimulus Talks, Trump Invites Political Risk for Himself and Republicans
description: WASHINGTON  President Trumps decision to walk away from bipartisan talks over a coronavirus aid bill less than a month before Election Day was a remarkably perilous act for a president about to face voters and for Republicans who are fighting to keep the Senate and now risk being blamed for the collapse of a compromise that had always faced steep obstacles.

title: A New Jersey postal worker was arrested after he threw away nearly 100 blank ballots, prosecutors say.
description: A few days after nearly 100 ballots were recovered from a dumpster in New Jersey, a Postal Service employee was arrested Wednesday on charges that he intentionally delayed and obstructed the delivery of mail, the authorities said.

title: Netflix Is Charged in Texas With Promoting Lewdness in Cuties
description: A Texas grand jury has indicted Netflix, prosecutors said Tuesday, on a charge of promoting lewdness in the French film Cuties, which has been maligned by some as child exploitation and defended by others as a complex coming-of-age story about preadolescent girls.

title: Cooking Class | Yabu Pushelberg
description: In the kitchen of their Amagansett, N.Y., home, designers George Yabu and Glenn Pushelberg prepare one of their favorite dishes, a summer halibut with fennel, olive and lemon chutney.

title: A Surprisingly Simple Fish Dish From a High-Concept Design Duo
description: The kitchen of Glenn Pushelberg and George Yabus spare, light-filled house in Amagansett, N.Y., is defined by glass. Five panels of the stuff separate the couples gray quartz-topped counters from the otherwise open-plan living and dining area on the homes second floor; a particularly Covid-weary guest might mistake it for a high-concept sneeze guard. But for Yabu, who along with Pushelberg co-owns the architecture and design firm Yabu Pushelberg  perhaps best known for its projects with the Edition hotel group and Barneys New York  it was a necessary design choice to achieve the energy he craves when entertaining the guests that often fill the house.

title: The Promise and the Reality of Gene Editing
description: EDITING HUMANITYThe Crispr Revolution and the New Era of Genome EditingBy Kevin Davies

title: The South Carolina Senate race between Lindsey Graham and Jaime Harrison is now rated a toss-up by a prominent analyst.
description: Senator Lindsey Graham, a South Carolina Republican who went from being one of President Trumps fiercest critics to one of his biggest boosters, faces a much tougher challenge than he expected as he seeks re-election. The nonpartisan Cook Political Report announced Wednesday that it now considers his race against the Democrat Jaime Harrison a toss-up.

title: Can You Spot One of These Migrating Birds?
description: More than 500 bird species in North America migrate in the fall, so its a great time to whip out the binoculars.

title: Texass Supreme Court upholds extension of early voting but strikes down Houstons plan to expand mail-in balloting.
description: The Texas Supreme Court intervened on two closely watched voting issues on Wednesday, blocking Houston election officials from sending out mail-in ballot applications to more than 2 million voters and upholding Gov. Greg Abbotts order to extend the timetable for early voting because of the pandemic.

title: QAnon Believers Say Being Banned From Facebook Is Proof of the Conspiracy
description: QAnon followers were speculating on Tuesday night that Facebooks new ban on all QAnon groups and pages was part of a complex plan by the Trump administration to root out the deep state and arrest their enemies. Or the social media company was trying to squelch the impending news that President Trump was about to crack down on his foes.

title: Derek Chauvin, Ex-Officer Charged in George Floyds Death, Is Released on Bail
description: For months, protesters trained their anger on Derek Chauvin, a former Minneapolis police officer who was shown on video holding his knee on the neck of George Floyd before his death. They demonstrated outside of Mr. Chauvins home, posted his mug shot across the internet and chanted outside his first in-person court appearance last month.

title: Plexiglass Barriers Wont Stop the Virus at the Debate, Experts Warn
description: A box fan, an air filter  and duct tape to attach them.

title: Who Will Win the 2020 Nobel Prize in Literature?
description: Will it be a superstar, or an Eastern European writer youve never heard of? Here are the major candidates.

title: De Blasio Says New Restrictions Will Go Into Effect on Thursday
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio of New York City said that the restrictions in parts of Brooklyn and Queens aimed at curbing coronavirus clusters will go into effect on Thursday.

title: This Years Nobel Prize in Chemistry Honors a Revolution
description: When Jennifer Doudna was in sixth grade, she came home one day to find that her dad had left a paperback titled The Double Helix on her bed. She put it aside, thinking it was one of those detective tales she loved. When she read it on a rainy Saturday, she discovered she was right, in a way. As she sped through the pages, she became enthralled by the intense drama, filled with colorful characters, about ambition and competition in the pursuit of natures wonders. Even though her high school counselor told her girls didnt become scientists, she decided she would.

title: A Digital Ailey Season Celebrates Revelations at 60
description: Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater is the latest company to move ahead with the creation of new work while performing arts venues remain almost completely shut down in New York. The troupes monthlong December season will include a world premiere from Jamar Roberts, Aileys choreographer in residence, and the debut of a collaborative response to Alvin Aileys Revelations by Matthew Rushing, Clifton Brown and Yusha-Marie Sorzano.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Two months ago, New Zealand was celebrating success in its battle with the coronavirus when a major outbreak in Auckland forced a retreat. Now, after a second round of lockdowns, the country is hoping it has beaten back the virus for good.

title: A Great Gatsby Quote Takes On New Resonance
description: It could have been any day on the internet: A critical comment, not naming President Trump or his Republican allies but clearly aimed at them, circulated on social media.

title: The Artist Charles Gaines Creates a Fellowship for Black Students
description: In another effort to address the lack of diversity in the countrys art institutions, the artist Charles Gaines has established a fellowship to support Black students in the renowned M.F.A. program in art at the California Institute of the Arts (CalArts), where he has been a longtime member of the faculty.

title: The family of an Arizona woman killed by members of the Islamic State will be Pences guests at the debate.
description: The family of an Arizona woman who was captured, tortured and then killed by members of the Islamic State will be guests of Vice President Mike Pence at his first debate against Senator Kamala Harris, an administration official said.

title: The Times Endorses Joe Biden, and Readers Applaud
description: To the Editor:

title: Putin, Long the Sower of Instability, Is Now Surrounded by It
description: YEREVAN, Armenia  In Russias self-proclaimed sphere of influence, Russia is losing its influence.

title: Polls show Biden edging out Trump in Iowa and Wisconsin and holding firm leads in Pennsylvania and Florida.
description: Joseph R. Biden Jr. has strengthened his advantage in a range of keyswing states that President Trump won four years ago, according to a batch of state polls conducted after last weeks presidential debate and released on Wednesday.

title: Why Conspiracy Theories Are So Addictive Right Now
description: The other night, as President Trump convalesced at Walter Reed, I took a spin through social media to see the latest news on his health.

title: Fancy Cars, Fine Dining, Creator Mansions, Cash: Triller Is Shelling Out for Talent
description: When talk of a possible TikTok ban began in July, the leaders of a small social video app called Triller saw a growth opportunity.

title: Im Jealous of the Easy Pregnancy I Never Had
description: When I turned 35, I briefly entertained the idea of getting pregnant again. The memories of first flutters and baby showers danced in my head. At the store, my eyes fell on adorable onesies and ultrasoft plushies. I yearned for those early new-mom moments, playing peekaboo during diaper changes, rocking a baby to sleep in my arms, sniffing that intoxicating newborn aroma.

title: A North Dakota candidate who died of Covid-19 remains on the ballot.
description: North Dakotas top election official said on Wednesday that it was too late to remove from the ballot the name of a candidate for State Legislature who died Monday from Covid-19.

title: Studying Bad Bunny, and Finding All of Puerto Rico
description: Times Insider explains who we are and what we do, and delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how our journalism comes together.

title: How We Exercise During a Pandemic
description: Welcome. In her latest Phys Ed column, Gretchen Reynolds wrote of exercise habits during the pandemic. She looked at several recent studies and concluded that our exercise patterns have indeed been disrupted, but precisely how differs from one study to the next  some show us moving more, some less. The results of a new study out of the United Kingdom showed that most of us have been less physically active in quarantine, and a large percentage of those whove been exercising as much or more than before are older than 65. (The findings have not yet been peer reviewed.)

title: Plexiglass and preparations as the vice-presidential candidates gear up for a high-stakes debate.
description: The plexiglass dividers that will separate Vice President Mike Pence and Senator Kamala Harris when they face off at their debate tonight in Salt Lake City will serve as powerful reminders of how the coronavirus has upended the presidential campaign and life in America.

title: For a Second Series of Play Readings: More Shows, More Stars
description: The plays range from old reliables (The Best Man and Uncle Vanya) to new classics (This Is Our Youth and Time Stands Still). As is usually the case these days, they were recorded on Zoom and will be streamed once. But its the starry performers who have signed on to a roster of seven play readings that promise to be especially attention-getting.

title: Welcome to the New Modern Love Podcast
description: For 16 years, the Modern Love column has given readers of The New York Times a glimpse into the complicated love lives of real people.

title: My Patients Cant Take Trumps Advice
description: Imagine wanting, needing, to take a gulp of air and finding that you cant. On Monday, a patient walked into the emergency room where I work. He struggled to breathe as he explained his symptoms to me. When the test result came back positive for the coronavirus, his eyes brimmed, and he spoke quietly: Will I be OK?

title: Nevada Halts Use of Rapid Coronavirus Tests in Nursing Homes, Citing Inaccuracies
description: Nevada has ordered its nursing facilities to immediately suspend the use of two rapid tests for the coronavirus, manufactured by companies Quidel and Becton, Dickinson and Company, after the tests performance was found to be lacking, according to a directive issued on Friday by the states department of health.

title: Trump returned to the Oval Office even as the White House outbreak grew.
description: President Trump returned to the Oval Office on Wednesday, even as a full picture of his health remained unclear and many of his aides were in quarantine amid a West Wing outbreak that continues to grow.

title: Matthew Williams on His Givenchy Debut and What Kanye Taught Him
description: This week Matthew Williams, a 34-year-old American from Pismo Beach, Calif., with no formal fashion training, took the reins at Givenchy in what was the biggest  and only  debut in Paris.

title: Hear the Brilliance of Eddie Van Halen
description: Eddie Van Halen, an innovator who turned himself into a new kind of guitar hero, died on Tuesday at 65. Reading about his contributions to rock is one thing; hearing them is another.

title: Supreme Court Hears Copyright Battle Between Google and Oracle
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court considered on Wednesday whether Google should have to pay Oracle billions of dollars in a long-running lawsuit over software used on many of the worlds smartphones, wrestling during a lively argument with the potentially enormous implications of what has been called the copyright case of the decade.

title: Notre Dames President Faces an Angry Campus After Getting the Coronavirus
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind.  As college leaders deliberated whether to bring students back to campus, none led the charge for reopening more forcefully than the president of the University of Notre Dame.

title: Mark Andrews, North Dakota Farmer-Politician, Dies at 94
description: Mark Andrews, a North Dakota Republican farmer whose strident support for farmers helped him win nine elections to the House of Representatives and one to the Senate, but who could not stave off defeat for a second Senate term in 1986, died on Saturday in Fargo, N.D. He was 94.

title: Barrett refused to divulge her legal views on health care and abortion rights on a call, Coons says.
description: Senator Chris Coons, Democrat of Delaware, said that Judge Amy Coney Barrett, President Trumps nominee for the Supreme Court, repeatedly declined during a phone call on Wednesday to share her views of legal issues around abortion rights or the Affordable Care Act, citing the need to maintain impartiality on the bench.

title: In a First, New England Journal of Medicine Joins Never-Trumpers
description: Throughout its 208-year history, The New England Journal of Medicine has remained staunchly nonpartisan. The worlds most prestigious medical journal has never supported or condemned a political candidate.

title: Rebuking Trump, The New England Journal of Medicine calls for ousting the nations dangerously incompetent leaders.
description: Throughout its 208-year history, The New England Journal of Medicine has remained staunchly nonpartisan. The worlds most prestigious medical journal has never supported or condemned a political candidate.

title: Anxious for a Lifeline, the U.S. Economy Is Left to Sink or Swim
description: Here is the situation the U.S. economy faces, a month before Election Day: Job growth is stalling. Layoffs are mounting. And no more help is coming, at least not right away.

title: The Artist John Newman Says a Fake Check Scam Cost Him $12,000
description: When the $12,000 showed up in John Newmans bank account from someone who had bought a pair of his drawings online, his first thought was relief.

title: Fed Officials Warned of Slowdown Without Stimulus
description: WASHINGTON  Federal Reserve officials were counting on Congress and the White House to pass additional aid for households and businesses hit by the pandemic as they laid out an optimistic forecast for the economic recovery last month. Now, that outlook is in jeopardy.

title: Facebook Widens Ban on Political Ads as Alarm Rises Over Election
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Over the past few weeks, Mark Zuckerberg, Facebooks chief executive, and his lieutenants have watched the presidential race with an increasing sense of alarm.

title: Djokovic and Kenin Push Through to French Open Semifinals
description: Novak Djokovic typically pounds his groundstrokes, not his own legs and left arm. But his laborious quarterfinal victory on Wednesday over Pablo Carreo Busta of Spain was strange from the start.

title: Citigroup is fined $400 million over longstanding internal problems.
description: Two months after one of its bankers accidentally sent nearly $1 billion to the wrong people, Citigroup agreed to pay $400 million to federal regulators over long-running problems keeping its daily operations under control.

title: Wait, Wall Street Is Pro-Biden Now?
description: [Follow our live Biden vs. Trump 2020 election coverage.]

title: A Trump-supporting plexiglass manufacturer on plexiglass getting political.
description: Jaime Harrison, the Democrat challenging Lindsey Graham, brought his own plexiglass to the South Carolina Senate debate over the weekend. In Wednesday nights vice-presidential debate, Senator Kamala Harris and Vice President Mike Pence will be separated by two sheets of it.

title: 4 Art Gallery Shows to See Right Now
description: The painter Ficre Ghebreyesus (1962-2012), whose work makes its New York solo debut with the show Gate to the Blue, traveled a long way in his cut-short life. He was born in Eritrea, East Africa, and left at 16 to escape the countrys brutal war of independence with Ethiopia. He traveled on foot to Sudan and lived as a refugee in Italy and Germany. In 1981, he settled in the United States, where he studied painting at the Art Students League in New York and at the Yale School of Art and supported himself for years as a restaurant chef in New Haven, Conn.

title: California Sunday Suspends Publication After Emerson Collective Pulls Out
description: The California Sunday Magazine, a sumptuously produced and award-winning magazine that got its start as a throwback to the glory days of print, has suspended publication after Emerson Collective, the organization founded by the billionaire investor Laurene Powell Jobs, severed ties with its parent company.

title: A New Issue Grips the Campaign: Debate Safety
description: Update, Oct. 8: The Commission on Presidential Debates is planning for the next presidential debate to be held virtually. President Trump said he would refuse to participate.

title: Facebook will ban political ads indefinitely after polls close on Nov. 3, as alarm rises over the election.
description: On Wednesday, Facebook said it would take more preventive measures to keep political candidates from using it to manipulate the elections outcome and its aftermath. The company now plans to prohibit all political and issue-based advertising after the polls close on Nov. 3 for an undetermined length of time. And it said it would place notifications at the top of the News Feed notifying people that no winner had been decided until a victor was declared by news outlets.

title: 2020 Debate, Stimulus Bill, Homecoming: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this newsletter in your inbox? Heres the sign-up.)

title: I think this was a blessing from God that I caught it, Trump says of the virus in a new video.
description: President Trump on Wednesday released a direct-to-camera video address to the nation in which he called getting the coronavirus a blessing from God, calling the unapproved drug a cure and saying he would provide hundreds of thousands of doses of unapproved drugs to Americans free of charge.

title: As Harris prepares to take the debate stage, Asian-Americans flood Twitter with stories of their sheroes.
description: The hashtag #AAPISheRose was trending on Twitter on Wednesday, as Asian-Americans shared stories of their family members and prominent women who have paved the way for what they see as a historic moment: Senator Kamala Harris, a Black and Indian-American vice-presidential candidate, taking the debate stage.

title: Theres Not Much Work for Actors. Now Their Unions Are Fighting.
description: For unemployed theater artists, there has been one bright spot during a pandemic that has prevented live performance: streaming.

title: New York Grandparents Are Kidnapped and Taken to Canada
description: On Sept. 27, a group of men broke into a home in Moira, N.Y., a town of about 3,000 people near the Canadian border, and kidnapped the couple in their 70s who lived there, the authorities said.

title: Biden will resume airing negative ads against Trump.
description: Joseph R. Biden Jr.s campaign is resuming its negative advertising against President Trump, a campaign official said Wednesday, days after it pulled back from such attacks in response to the news that Mr. Trump had tested positive for the coronavirus.

title: Taylor Swift, leaning further into politics, endorses Joe Biden and Kamala Harris.
description: Taylor Swift, the pop megastar who has increasingly leveraged her fame and platform to weigh in on political matters and social causes, announced Wednesday that she would support Joseph R. Biden Jr. and Senator Kamala Harris in the presidential election.

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
description: After savaging the Northeast in the spring and the South and the West this summer, the virus is now devastating another region in the United States  the Midwest and Great Plains.

title: An appeals court has rejected another attempt by the Trump administration to end the census early.
description: A federal appeals court on Wednesday upheld a lower-court ruling that barred the Trump administration from ending the head-counting part of the 2020 census a month early, handing a victory to state and local governments that said more time was needed for an accurate count.

title: See the Black Art Remaking Our Culture
description: Jenna Wortham and Kimberly Drew share a portfolio of favorite works  and discuss curating Black art when so much creativity is online and ephemeral.

title: Some Republicans Seem to Think This Isnt Going to Go Their Way
description: Have you noticed that right now everything is about Amy Coney Barrett, the new Supreme Court nominee?

title: New York Needs the Faithful to Help Stop the Coronavirus
description: A growing coronavirus outbreak in several Brooklyn and Queens neighborhoods is the most serious public health emergency New York City has faced since the spring, when the virus claimed more than 20,000 lives.

title: Justice Dept. Eases Election Fraud Inquiry Constraints as Trump Promotes False Narrative
description: For decades, federal prosecutors have been told not to mount election fraud investigations in the final months before an election for fear they could depress voter turnout or erode confidence in the results. Now, the Justice Department has lifted that prohibition weeks before the presidential election.

title: Stars Bring a Broadway Tune Back to Times Square, Unexpectedly
description: The first notes of the unexpected chorus sounded just after 3:30 p.m. in Times Square, rising above the noise of passing traffic and halting some passers-by in their tracks.

title: Morgan Wallen Loses S.N.L. Music Spot for Violating Virus Rules
description: Morgan Wallen, a country musician who was scheduled to perform on Saturday Night Live this weekend, said on Wednesday evening that he would not be appearing on the show, citing its coronavirus protocols.

title: That Airport Spa? Its a Coronavirus Testing Clinic
description: Until recently, XpresSpa was known for offering manicures, pedicures, massages and waxing services at 25 airports in the United States and around the world, where travelers with some time between flights could get themselves spruced up.

title: A Guide to New Horror Movies This Month
description: Sick of The Exorcist? This Halloween season, the number of new and noteworthy horror films will make your head spin.

title: Trump promotes an experimental treatment, as Biden calls his virus approach a tragedy.
description: President Trump said on Wednesday that he considered his struggle with the coronavirus a blessing from God, and promoted an experimental cocktail of drugs that is still in clinical trials.

title: Full Video: The Pence-Harris V.P. Debate
description: The vice-presidential debate between Vice President Mike Pence and Senator Kamala Harris has concluded in Salt Lake City. It was moderated by Susan Page, USA Todays Washington bureau chief.

title: Full Analysis of the Pence-Harris VP Debate
description: Watch the full video and read our analysis of the vice-presidential debate between Mike Pence and Kamala Harris, moderated by Susan Page of USA Today.

title: How do you lose an S.N.L. gig? Ask Morgan Wallen.
description: Morgan Wallen, a country musician who was scheduled to perform on Saturday Night Live this weekend, wont be appearing on the show after all, citing its coronavirus protocols.

title: Millions of Views Later, Nathan Apodaca Keeps the Vibe Going
description: Nathan Apodaca is here for the good vibes.

title: U.S. Seeks to Draw Down Its Troops in Afghanistan to 2,500 by Early 2021
description: WASHINGTON  President Trumps national security adviser announced on Wednesday that the United States would cut its troops in Afghanistan to 2,500 by early next year.

title: The head of the White House security office is critically ill with Covid-19.
description: The person in charge of the White House security office contracted a severe case of the coronavirus last month and has been hospitalized ever since, according to an administration official with knowledge of the situation.

title: Man Pleads Guilty to Killing and Burning a Utah College Student
description: A Utah man who wrote a book that described the burning deaths of two people pleaded guilty on Wednesday to killing a University of Utah student whose charred remains he buried in his backyard last year, prosecutors said.

title: Greatest Failure, Harris Calls Trumps Coronavirus Response
description: At Wednesday nights debate, Senator Kamala Harris called President Trumps handling of the coronavirus a cover-up and said he should have acted earlier.

title: Pence Defends Trumps Response to Coronavirus
description: Vice President Mike Pence applauded President Trumps handling of the coronavirus pandemic that has killed more than 200,000 Americans.

title: Harris and Pence Clash on Coronavirus Vaccine
description: Kamala Harris said she would not take a vaccine released under the Trump administration unless health professionals recommended it, while Mike Pence said she was undermining confidence in a vaccine.

title: Trump Calls His Illness a Blessing From God
description: President Trump claimed on Wednesday that catching the coronavirus was a blessing from God and portrayed as a miracle cure the unproven therapeutic drug he was given after testing positive last week for the virus.

title: Regeneron Asks F.D.A. for Emergency Approval for Drug That Trump Claimed Cured Him
description: The drugmaker Regeneron said on Wednesday evening that it had submitted an application to the Food and Drug Administration for emergency approval of the experimental antibody cocktail that President Trump had praised just hours earlier without evidence as a cure for the coronavirus.

title: Puckered
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  Todays theme relies on a really rich word-substitution trick, one that broke me for a good part of the solve and seems to be one of those gimmicks that most often comes to you in an inspired but inconvenient moment and then slips away forever. I assumed that the professional puzzler Jeff Chen was behind the concept, and then I was delighted to learn that it came from his co-collaborator, Francesca Goldston, making her debut. A simple and clean idea, beautifully presented, makes for a capital Thursday solve.

title: Look for People to Scam Online
description: FRIDAY PUZZLE  Solvers, Im writing this in advance with the fervent hope that we make it through the week. This Sam Buchbinder construction is a good reward, if youre the type that gets satisfaction from imposing puzzles that solve in fits and starts. That was my experience, anyway  there were several moments where this grid was just too hard, up until the moment that it wasnt.

title: Maya Wiley Enters Mayors Race: I Am Not a Conventional Candidate
description: Maya D. Wiley, a former top lawyer for Mayor Bill de Blasio who has gained a national following as a political and legal analyst for MSNBC, announced her run for mayor of New York City on Wednesday night and immediately sought to distance herself from her former boss.

title: Nevada halts use of rapid coronavirus tests in nursing homes, citing inaccuracies.
description: The coronavirus tests kits are small and fast  they produce results in as a little as 15 minutes  and when they were first distributed to nursing homes around the country in August by the federal government, they were welcomed with open arms.

title: Pence and Harris Go Head-to-Head on Taxes
description: Senator Kamala Harris criticized tax cuts for wealthy Americans instituted by President Trump, while Vice President Mike Pence contended that a Biden administration would raise taxes.

title: Harris and Pence Clash on Climate Change
description: In Wednesday nights debate, Kamala Harris and Mike Pence argued about fracking and job creation related to climate change.

title: An exchange about Breonna Taylor and George Floyd crystallizes the candidates opposing views on racial justice.
description: An exchange between Vice President Mike Pence and Senator Kamala Harris late in the debate crystallized the deep differences in the two sides approaches to racial justice.

title: Pence faults Biden in Kayla Muellers killing, saying she could have been rescued from ISIS.
description: Vice President Mike Pence brought the parents of Kayla Mueller, the human rights activist who was killed in 2015 by members of the Islamic State in Syria, to the debate hall and attacked Joseph R. Biden Jr. during the debate for not doing more as vice president to rescue her.

title: Who Do You Think Won the Debate: Harris or Pence?
description: Theres been a lot of discussion this election cycle about what the vice president will mean to the next administration and beyond. Kamala Harris and Mike Pence have just wrapped up their one and only debate. Who do you think made the biggest impact on voters? Which moments were most revealing to you? Please answer the questions below. Well publish a selection of responses on Thursday.

title: Harris Calls Trumps Refusal to Condemn Racism Part of a Pattern
description: Senator Kamala Harris criticized President Trump for repeatedly refusing to condemn white supremacists.

title: A fly sat atop Mike Pences head for two minutes during the V.P. debate.
description: President Trumps handling of the country was the elephant in the room during Wednesdays vice-presidential debate, but it was a fly, taking a brief break from flying, that couldnt be ignored by viewers watching the event from home.

title: Pence and Harris Square Off Over Abortion
description: Mike Pence and Kamala Harris took contrasting positions on the Supreme Court nomination of Amy Coney Barrett and what it may mean for Roe v. Wade.

title: Virus Takes Center Stage as Pence and Harris Skirmish in Debate
description: Vice President Mike Pence and Senator Kamala Harris clashed over the Trump administrations handling of the coronavirus pandemic on Wednesday night, with Mr. Pence defending the White Houses record without addressing its fundamental failures, while Ms. Harris accused him and President Trump of presiding over a catastrophic failure in public-health policy.

title: Harris Dodges Pence on Packing Supreme Court
description: Kamala Harris said the Supreme Court vacancy should be filled by the president voters elect in November, while Mike Pence accused Ms. Harris and Joe Biden of wanting to pack the Supreme Court.

title: A Fly Landed on Mike Pence
description: During Wednesday nights debate, a large fly landed on Vice President Mike Pences head and rested there.

title: Pence Deflects Question on Accepting Election Results
description: In Wednesday nights debate, Kamala Harris and Mike Pence were asked if the election results would lead to a peaceful transfer of power.

title: Corrections: Oct. 8, 2020
description: A chart with an article on Wednesday about President Trumps decision to cut off talks on an economic stimulus deal misstated the day that the S&P 500 dropped. It fell at the end of the day on Tuesday, not Monday.

title: U.S. Vice-Presidential Debate, New Zealand, Vladimir Putin: Your Thursday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Kamala Harris calls Trumps virus response the greatest failure of any presidential administration.
description: At the vice-presidential debate on Wednesday night, Senator Kamala Harris of California wasted no time in prosecuting the case against the Trump administrations handling of the coronavirus crisis.

title: Im Speaking, Harris Says After Pence Interrupts
description: Senator Kamala Harris asked Vice President Mike Pence to stop cutting in as she responded to a question on taxes.

title: Quotation of the Day: This Could Be Their Last Vote. They Wont Skip It.
description: Im not afraid to play the death card. If thats going to impress somebody into voting, that would be great.

title: 2020 French Open: Womens Semifinal Preview
description: How to watch: 5 a.m. to 2 p.m. on the Tennis Channel and 11 a.m. onward on NBC; streaming on the Tennis Channel app and NBCSN app.

title: N.F.L. Week 5 Predictions: Our Picks Against the Spread
description: More positive tests for the coronavirus. A hurricane possibly forcing a game to be moved. A top matchup delayed indefinitely. Several prominent players out with major injuries. The news has not been good over the last few weeks for the N.F.L., and while the on-field product has remained strong, the growing list of issues is certainly a concern.

title: Pence, Peerless Trump Defender, Confronts His Limits
description: Vice President Mike Pence approached his task on Wednesday as he has approached his four years as the executive straight man to an unruly leader: not merely defending President Trump but effectively insisting, with poker-faced conviction, that those who doubt his boss should not believe their eyes and ears.

title: Kamala Harris faced a double standard on the debate stage.
description: It was the first time a woman of color had ever appeared on a presidential or vice-presidential general election debate stage, and the tightrope Senator Kamala Harris had to walk was never far from sight.

title: How the Internet Viewed the Vice-Presidential Debate
description: There were frustrating interruptions, though not as many as in the first debate. There were dodged questions, animated facial expressions and one candidate running particularly roughshod over the moderator.

title: Watch: Highlights From the 2020 Vice-Presidential Debate
description: Vice President Mike Pence and Senator Kamala Harris sparred on topics including the response to the coronavirus and the Supreme Court vacancy.

title: Karen Pence Appears Without a Mask
description: After Wednesday nights debate, Karen Pence, Vice President Mike Pences wife, appeared on the stage without wearing a mask. Kamala Harriss husband, Douglas Emhoff, did wear one onstage.

title: Six Takeaways From the Vice-Presidential Debate
description: Vice President Mike Pence and Senator Kamala Harris sat a dozen feet apart on Wednesday, separated by plexiglass and an ideological chasm, for a 90-minute debate that for all the hype seems unlikely to affect the trajectory of presidential campaign.

title: Feeble Hitting and Tanakas Poor Start Put Yankees on the Brink
description: SAN DIEGO  The Yankees 2020 season comes down to this: Jordan Montgomery, their fifth-best starting pitcher, on the mound in Game 4 of the American League division series against the Tampa Bay Rays on Thursday.

title: Word + Quiz: brusque
Stella McCartney Had a Question: Why on Earth Would You Be in Fashion?
description: This season Stella McCartney eschewed her normal slot during Paris Fashion Week for a slightly later reveal  with a twist. Shes not coming out just with a collection; shes coming out with a whole lexicon of values, with each letter illustrated by a different artist.

title: Late Night Buzzes Over Mike Pences Fly
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Most of us are stuck at home at the moment, so here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: A Deep Pool of Soccer Talent Is Drying Up. Why?
description: ngel Di Mara never went home. The summer of 2007 had been a good one. He was 19, and had spent a month or so in Canada, representing his country in the under-20 World Cup. He had excelled, scoring three times, and so had his team: Just as in 1995, 1997, 2001 and 2005, Argentina won the tournament.

title: France and Me: A Complicated Dance
description: Times Insider explains who we are and what we do, and delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how our journalism comes together.

title: Train in Twilight
How a Virus Surge Among Orthodox Jews Became a Crisis for New York
description: All summer, life had been returning to normal in the Orthodox Jewish neighborhoods of Brooklyn. On Eastern Parkway and along 13th Avenue, throngs of men in black hats and coats once again visited synagogues three times a day. Children went off to camp. Weddings filled large banquet halls.

title: After a Cinderella British Open Win, a New Star Adjusts to Golfs Majors
description: It was well past midnight in Scotland by the time Sophia Popov FaceTimed with her parents, Philipp and Claudia, and older brothers Alex and Nicholas after winning the Womens British Open at Royal Troon Golf Club in August.

title: Dystopian Sound Show, Fresh From London, Heads to North America
description: A British theater found a hit during the pandemic with Blindness, a sound installation in which masked and socially distanced audience members spend 75 minutes listening to Juliet Stevenson perform an adaptation of Jos Saramagos dystopian novel about a society afflicted by an epidemic.

title: Mary Poppins Returns! Some Modern Families Seek a Governess
description: In her work as an estate manager, Kristin Reyes often finds herself fielding client requests for a special kind of child minder. Callers will say to me, Kristin, I need a modern Mary Poppins. Everyone knows what that means.

title: Lesson of the Day: A Battle for the Souls of Black Girls
description: Featured Article: A Battle for the Souls of Black Girls by Erica L. Green, Mark Walker and Eliza Shapiro

title: Live, From New Yorks Streets: The Philharmonic
description: Curtis Stewart, a violinist and New Yorker, played surprise performances around the city. The show was part of a program that is bringing Lincoln Center musicians to the citys streets.

title: N.H.L. Draft: Rangers Go Big, While Devils and Islanders Look for Scorers
description: While this years N.H.L. draft was virtual, it may have produced some very real talent for the three franchises in the New York metropolitan area.

title: The virus dominates the vice-presidential debate between Pence and Harris.
description: Vice President Mike Pence and Senator Kamala Harris clashed over the Trump administrations handling of the coronavirus pandemic on Wednesday night, with Mr. Pence defending the White Houses record without addressing its fundamental failures, while Ms. Harris accused him and President Trump of presiding over a catastrophic failure in public-health policy.

title: Pandemic Exposes Holes in Swedens Generous Social Welfare State
description: In the popular imagination, Sweden does not seem like the sort of country prone to accepting the mass death of grandparents to conserve resources in a pandemic.

title: David Byrne Likes Reading Aloud to His Friends
description: [The Best Books of 2020: View our full list.]

title: Hilary Mantel Takes On Royals and Rebels in a Book of Essays
description: MANTEL PIECESRoyal Bodies and Other Writing From The London Review of BooksBy Hilary Mantel

title: He Wanted a Two-Bedroom in Harlem for Under $700,000. Which of These Would You Choose?
description: Figuring he couldnt afford new construction on his budget, a first-time buyer focused on prewar buildings where he could rent the second bedroom. Heres where he landed.

title: Jodi Picoult Waited to Write The Book of Two Ways. Her Timing Was Impeccable.
description: STORY DOULA Jodi Picoult was getting ready for the evenings virtual event  a conversation with Kevin Kwan  when she got a call from her editor, letting her know that her 27th novel, The Book of Two Ways, had debuted at No. 1 on the hardcover fiction list. It was a really nice moment in a really bad year, says the veteran author. I was terrified about publishing a book during a pandemic, but this one has rejiggered itself in my mind to be perfect pandemic reading.

title: Killer Mike Says He Has a Choice to Make
description: You might know Michael Render, a.k.a. Killer Mike, from a speech he made that went viral four days after George Floyds death. Protests in Atlanta were escalating and so was the damage and violence. The mayor needed help turning the temperature down.

title: For New Widow, Horrible Days. Then More Help Arrived.
description: Weeks after the coronavirus lockdown began in New York, Mayya Gil, 91, found her husband on the kitchen floor of their apartment.

title: Uncertainty Is Hope
description: I wake up every day now with uncertainty, wondering what new and frightening updates there will be about the coronavirus pandemic, the protests, the climate and the economy. I read headlines about the pain and uncertainty of soaring jobless rates, the uncertain promise of a Covid-19 vaccine and the uncertainties surrounding the presidential election. Even my daily meditation app buzzes: Lead with kindness and understanding through the uncertainty.

title: How to Tell a Great Bedtime Story
description: Once upon a time, there was a father. This father  known throughout the land as Dad  was, by trade, a teller of stories. One night, while perched upon the edge of his elder childs bed, he was called upon to tell a story. He struggled. He stumbled and mumbled. He murmured words about a girl trying to go to school, her path blocked by some nefarious cows.

title: Do You Love Writing or Receiving Letters?
description: Have you ever received a memorable letter? If so, what was it like to see an envelope with your name on it? What did you feel as you unfolded the letter and began to read? Did it feel different than getting an email, phone call or text? Why or why not?

title: How Covid-19 and Power Tools Helped Heal My Relationship With My Son
description: When my son, Noah, entered seventh grade, his voice deepened and his personality changed. Gone was my chatty sidekick. In his place was a sullen recluse.

title: A Writer-Director-Star Breaks Through. It Only Took a Lifetime.
description: On a recent September morning, Radha Blank sat on a paint-blistered bench just above Riverbank State Park, soaking up the late-summer sun. Trucks thundered by on the highway below. Wasps circled a garbage can. Blanks surgical mask tangled with her hoop earrings, but nothing could kill her mood.

title: Fashion Forward Bridal Masks for Your Walk Down the Aisle
description: Alongside veils, tiaras and spiffy neckwear, brides and grooms getting married during the coronavirus pandemic have added face masks to their must-have wedding accessories.

title: Why Dont Young People Vote, and What Can Be Done About It?
description: Most young people in the United States dont vote. Fewer than half of Americans 18 to 29 voted in the 2016 presidential election  a gap of more than 15 points compared with the overall turnout.

title: What Happened to South Americas Missing Mega-Mammals?
description: Millions of years before humans set foot in the Americas, a rush of alien animals began arriving in South America.

title: When You Have Enough, Its Time to Help Others
description: My small house on Cape Cod needs sprucing up, but from the kitchen table, I can see a home that is in much better shape. Its owners hope to sell it for $8 million.

title: After a Hospital Stay for Covid, Patients May Face Months of Rehabilitation
description: Not long ago, Allen Washington was a busy executive who traveled the country on business trips while trying to stay healthy and active, walking up to two miles a day for exercise.

title: Questions for Amy Coney Barrett
description: If I were a member of the Senate Judiciary Committee, here are the questions I would ask Judge Amy Coney Barrett, President Trumps Supreme Court nominee, at her confirmation hearing scheduled to begin next week. I have grouped them into five categories.

title: Pandemic Travel, With Another Family or Maybe Three
description: Seven months into the pandemic, the recommended rules for families are clear: Safety first means safety in low numbers. Learning pods are small. Social bubbles are guarded. The quaranteam lines have been drawn  at home and on the road.

title: The Baby Boomer Bond Dilemma
description: Todays record low bond yields could not come at a worse time for many baby boomers.

title: Their Buzzy Off Broadway Play Shut Down. Heres What They Did Next.
description: Seven months ago, on a brisk Thursday in March, New Yorks theater world came to a sudden halt. Lives were upended, fortunes evaporated, dreams put on hold. Why do people come to New York, if not for some version of the dream embodied by theater: to experience the new, the fantastic, the tragic  some to witness, some to participate in its creation?

title: A Columnist Makes Sense of Wall Street Like None Other (See Footnote)
description: On April 20, something occurred that was unprecedented in the history of financial markets: The price of oil went negative.

title: A Disrupted Thanksgiving Leaves the Turkey Business Guessing
description: Cooks around the country are just starting to calculate menus and decide how many guests they can safely host for Thanksgiving. But for months, the people who grow and sell the centerpiece of the meal have been doing their own kind of turkey math.

title: Under Pence, Politics Regularly Seeped Into the Coronavirus Task Force
description: WASHINGTON  Aboard Air Force Two en route to the Mayo Clinic on April 28, White House aides walked down the aisle distributing masks to members of Vice President Mike Pences entourage, a requirement for everyone entering the renowned hospital in Minnesota as the coronavirus spread.

title: Stanley Cup Revelry Has Mostly Proceeded as Normal. One Tradition May Not.
description: They hoisted, they hugged and they kissed the Stanley Cup  then they filled it with Champagne and gulped it empty again.

title: Dries Van Noten on How to Make an Old Shirt a Piece of Art
description: At his house outside Antwerp, where Dries Van Noten spent the early part of the pandemic, the designer has 55 acres of famously glorious gardens filled with the roses and delphiniums and grasses and gooseberries that have inspired many of the lushly fecund prints that he creates himself, and that have become one of his signatures.

title: Is There a Place for the President of the Confederacy?
description: FAIRVIEW, Ky.  Drive down Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Way in western Kentucky, past Martin Luther King Jr. Elementary School and take a right onto Jefferson Davis Highway, and a gray spike will begin to rise in the air.

title: Best and Worst Moments of the Kamala Harris-Mike Pence Debate: Most Bizarre Moment Was the Fly
description: Welcome to Opinions commentary for the vice-presidential debate between Kamala Harris and Mike Pence. In this special feature, Times Opinion writers pick the winner and then rank the victory on a scale of 1 to 10: 1 means it was a very narrow win; 10 means it was a blowout. Heres what our columnists and contributors thought of the debate.

title: Mike Pences Debate Performance Bugged Me Out
description: We need to talk about that fly.

title: A Devastating Blow: Virus Kills 81 Members of Native American Tribe
description: CHOCTAW, Miss.  For Jason Grisham, it began with a fever. Then came the chills, lingering headaches and a terrifying realization about what the symptoms might mean.

title: A wave of death in Swedens nursing homes has exposed holes in a famously generous safety net.
description: In the popular imagination, Sweden does not seem like the sort of country prone to accepting the mass death of grandparents to conserve resources in a pandemic.

title: After testing positive, Notre Dames president faces outrage over a failure to wear a mask.
description: The Rev. John I. Jenkins, the University of Notre Dames president and a 66-year-old Catholic priest, was among the first college leaders to invite students back to campus, arguing in a New York Times Op-Ed in May that the college had a moral obligation to not be crippled by fear of the virus.

title: The Future of Wealthy SoHo
description: [Want to get New York Today by email? Heres the sign-up.]

title: Watch 6 Standout Moments From Harris and Pence at the Debate
description: By the standards set by President Trump at his debate with Joseph R. Biden Jr., the matchup on Wednesday night between Senator Kamala Harris and Vice President Mike Pence was almost civil. Almost.

title: New Safety Features in Cars (or Just New to You)
description: Advanced automobile safety used to involve a buckled seatbelt, a hopeful glance at the St. Christopher medal on your rearview mirror and faith in your cars crumple zones. Today, theres a blizzard of technologies protecting people inside and outside the vehicle. So many, in fact, you may not even know all of the systems packed into your own car.

title: Dividend Funds Can Add Income, and Risk, to Your Portfolio
description: You can increase your investment income by buying a mutual or exchange-traded fund that owns dividend-paying stocks. Whether you should is a thornier question.

title: Plexiglass and Civility: The Vice-Presidential Debate
description: During most campaigns, the job of the vice-presidential candidates focuses on boosting the person heading the ticket. Proving their suitability for the top job is secondary.

title: In Paris, a Proust Adaptation for the Ages
description: PARIS  Who isnt yearning for lost time right now? Surely a new stage production inspired by Marcel Prousts sprawling, seven-volume saga, In Search of Lost Time, will nod to our current circumstances, you might think, as venues reopen and play catch-up with audiences.

title: How cuts to Swedens social welfare state led to a wave of death in nursing homes.
description: Among the nearly 6,000 people whose deaths have been linked to the coronavirus in Sweden, 2,694, or 46 percent, had been among those living in nursing homes.

title: The V.P. Debate
description: Mike Pence and Kamala Harris are both skilled debaters. And their debate last night was far easier to watch than last weeks presidential debate.

title: How to Use Your Heart and Head to Hack Your Personal Finance
description: You can make it more complicated, but successful financial planning has only two major parts.

title: In the Path of Six Major Storms Since June, Louisiana Braces for Delta
description: NEW ORLEANS  Seen from above this week, the city of Lake Charles, La., made for an unsettling study in blue  blue being the color of the tarps covering the hundreds of roofs that had been beaten by wind, shorn of shingles or punctured by flying trees.

title: A New Activist Playbook
description: Want this delivered to your inbox each day? Sign up here.

title: A devastated Native American community shows the viruss deadly toll on tribal nations.
description: The coronavirus has torn through the Mississippi Band of Choctaw Indians unabated, sickening more than 10 percent of the tribes 10,000 residents and killing at least 81 people. Now the tribe is bracing for a second wave and more devastation.

title: Faith Ba$ed Review: Praying for Laughs
description: With or without a dollar sign, the title Faith Ba$ed is potentially misleading, since this isnt one of the many Christian-themed movies that lays claim to that label, but a mockumentary-style farce about two boneheads who decide to write and direct such a film. They know nothing about filmmaking. Luke (Luke Barnett) cleans pools and sells herbal weight-loss tea in a pyramid scheme. Tanner (Tanner Thomason) tends bar and seduces women by showing them Schindlers List, a choice that ostensibly highlights his sensitivity.

title: Yellow Rose Review: A Timely Tale of Country Music Dreams
description: A small-town Texan teen, Rose Garcia (the Broadway performer Eva Noblezada) lives in a humble roadside motel with her mother, harboring big dreams. In the privacy of her bedroom, she croons beautifully, then whispers affirmations to herself  Thank you, Austin! Ill be here all week!  fantasizing about being a country star.

title: Charm City Kings Review: Growing Up, and Almost Spinning Out
description: The dirt bikes and their exuberant operators are the saving grace  and joy  of the sincere if overstuffed drama Charm City Kings. These arent just any rides and riders. Theyre more like horses and cowboys, with wild moves and flamboyant tricks that can bring to mind a rodeo show. At other times, though, when a particularly skilled rider drives his all-terrain vehicle down a Baltimore street, popping wheelies or standing tall in the saddle, youre suddenly watching a charioteer in his glory.

title: Who Won the Vice-Presidential Debate? Experts Weigh In
description: Last weeks presidential debate was a unique moment in a deeply divided nation, when most Americans seemed to agree that whatever they were seeing, it wasnt good for anyone  Republican, Democrat or otherwise.

title: A New Kind of Fund That Is Stingier With Information
description: A new kind of fund has entered the marketplace. Whether it is better than its predecessors remains to be seen.

title: Oh, the Memories of Normal Debates
description: Hi. Welcome to On Politics, your guide to the day in national politics. Im Lisa Lerer, your host.

title: Louise Glck Is Awarded Nobel Prize in Literature
description: The Nobel Prize in Literature was awarded on Thursday to Louise Glck, one of Americas most celebrated poets, for writing that with austere beauty makes individual existence universal.

title: Britain is said to be weighing the tightening of restrictions in hard-hit parts of the country.
description: The British government is considering a tiered system that would tighten restrictions on pubs and restaurants in the areas of England with the highest rates of infection, according to the BBC and other media outlets.

title: Manila orders karaoke silence for students sake.
description: Manilas mayor, the former actor Francisco Domagoso, banned the daytime use of karaokes, videokes and other sound producing devices beginning Thursday, after complaints from irate parents home-schooling their children amid the pandemic.

title: A Debate Full of Divides, Some Visible, Some Transparent
description: The stars of Wednesdays vice-presidential debate were notable for their firmness, their steadiness and, for a political discussion, their unusual level of transparency.

title: Randy Arozarena Cant Stop Hitting
description: Would you like to know which little-known player is poised for a major league breakthrough? Theres an easy way to tell. Dont bother learning the nuances of scouting or the mysteries of analytics. Just pay attention when the Tampa Bay Rays make a roster move.

title: Campaigns Spar Over Debate Plan After Trump Rejects Virtual Face-Off
description: Next weeks presidential debate was on the verge of cancellation after President Trump said on Thursday that he would refuse to participate in a virtual matchup and Joseph R. Biden Jr. pledged to hold a televised town-hall gathering with voters on the same night.

title: In Spain, Madrids highest court annuls a federal lockdown.
description: Madrids highest regional court on Thursday annulled a lockdown imposed by Spains central government on the capital region in order to contain its Covid-19 infections.

title: Prince William Announces New Prize Aimed at Repairing the Planet
description: LONDON  Prince William on Thursday announced the establishment of an environmental prize worth 50 million pounds, or $65 million, that will reward climate change solutions over the next 10 years, saying it was an effort to turn the current pessimism surrounding environmental issues into optimism.

title: Hong Kong Heist Snares $645 Million in Valuables, Including Mao Scrolls
description: HONG KONG  The thieves hauled away $645 million in artifacts from a Hong Kong apartment while the owner was in mainland China. Then they left by taxi.

title: Todays polls, as we get them.
description: Oct. 8

title: The next presidential debate will be virtual, but Trump says he wont participate.
description: President Trump on Thursday said he would not participate in a virtual debate, speaking on Fox Business Network minutes after the Commission on Presidential Debates announced that the next debate would be virtual because of virus concerns.

title: When a Fly Ruins Your Image
description: It was the accessory that stole the evening.

title: Library of Congress Acquires Archives of the National Womans Party
description: The Library of Congress has acquired the remaining records of the National Womans Party, adding substantially to its already sizable holdings relating to one of the major organizations that advocated for womens suffrage.

title: Hong Kong officials warn of a new wave of infections.
description: A Hong Kong health official said Thursday that the city was considering options for mandatory testing as it prepared for a new wave of coronavirus infections.

title: What to Know About the Vice-Presidential Debate
description: Good morning.

title: Jobless claims in the U.S. remain well above pre-pandemic levels.
description: Applications for jobless benefits in the United States remained high last week, even as the collapse of stimulus talks in Washington raised fears of a new wave of layoffs.

title: Pence, a peerless Trump defender, confronted his limits at the debate.
description: Vice President Mike Pence approached his task on Wednesday as he has approached his four years as the executive straight man to an unruly leader: not merely defending President Trump but effectively insisting, with poker-faced conviction, that those who doubt his boss should not believe their eyes and ears.

title: Who won the vice-presidential debate?
description: The vice-presidential debate on Wednesday night appeared to drive people back into their partisan corners. How you viewed the candidates depended mostly on your partisanship.

title: The virus took center stage in the skirmish between Mike Pence and Kamala Harris.
description: [Read our profile of Kamala Harris, the first woman elected U.S. vice president.]

title: The vice president, like Trump, evaded a question on a peaceful transfer of power.
description: Vice President Mike Pence was asked during Wednesday nights debate, in a question similar to one put before President Trump at last weeks presidential matchup, what he would do if Mr. Trump refused to accept the election results should he lose to Joseph R. Biden Jr.

title: What a fly on a candidates head tells us about America (just kidding, here are the jokes).
description: About an hour into Wednesday nights presidential debate, a fly suddenly appeared on Vice President Mike Pences head, resting motionless yet extremely visible set against his silver hair. It sat there for two minutes and three seconds, enough time to spawn thousands of memes and somehow crash Twitters trending topics.

title: Millennials Face a Steep Climb to Homeownership
description: The U.S. real estate market is topsy-turvy in the pandemic economy. There are fewer homes for sale than usual, and more competition. Prices are up in most markets, yet slipping in others. How do millennials, with their growing families and increasing housing needs, fit into this confusing picture?

title: Black LinkedIn Is Thriving. Does LinkedIn Have a Problem With That?
description: One day in September, Elizabeth Leiba opened the LinkedIn app and saw a post by Aaisha Joseph, a diversity consultant with nearly 16,000 followers on the platform.

title: On the Market in the New York Region
description: This weeks properties are four-bedroom homes in Long Beach, N.Y., and Norwalk, Conn.

description: This weeks properties are in Gowanus, Chelsea and Forest Hills.

title: A top health official in Germany warns, It is possible that the virus spreads uncontrolled.
description: The head of the German federal institute responsible for tracking the coronavirus warned on Thursday that the country could soon see an uncontrolled spread of the virus.

title: Microsoft Says App Stores Should Be More Competitive
description: SEATTLE  Microsoft said on Thursday that it would give developers more control in its app store, providing a sharp contrast to Apple, which is facing growing pressure for its firm grip on its App Store.
