description: SHED DREAD Ten years ago, at the suggestion of a friend who is no longer a friend, the fantasy author V.E. Schwab relocated from Nashville to Liverpool, England, where she paid 200 pounds per month to live in an unheated garden shed furnished with a single bed and a metal bar for hanging clothes. There was no plumbing. Her landlord was a former prison warden who also owned a neighboring house that was benignly haunted by a man who had lived there for 40 years. Schwab says, You could literally hear his footsteps moving through the halls and down the stairs a few times a day.

title: How to Be an Active Bystander When You See Casual Racism
description: Weve all been there.

title: Steve Martin Likes Books in the I Cant Put This Down Genre
description: [The Best Books of 2020: View our full list.]

title: Have You Ever Worried About Making a Good First Impression?
description: This special Student Opinion question features one of the winning essays from our 2019 Personal Narrative Writing Contest. You can read all of the 2019 winning essays here, and learn more about participating in this years contest, open now until Nov. 17, 2020, here.

title: Good Design Is the Secret to Better Democracy
description: Ballots are broken. So we redesigned them.

title: Shes Bursting Big Techs Bubble
description: It finally looks as if Big Tech may face some breakups. Lawmakers are interrogating tech C.E.O.s on Capitol Hill while the Justice Department pursues a landmark antitrust case against Google. For decades, tech giants have avoided such scrutiny  hiding behind the idea that their products are free, beneficial, even beloved.

title: Poem: Gemini
description: This is what we have had to do, amid pandemic, grief, political chaos, fires, human rights disasters: continue on with our lives. Doing chores  taking walks  teaching kids  trying to stay steady. In his brilliant forthcoming book, Tethered to Stars, Fady Joudah writes about the mysterious cosmos swirling with intricate linkages  as his phone is pinging. Ah, yes, Jerusalem, the Holy City! Right now, lets call all our cities holy. Lets hope our trees continue to communicate, whatever humans can or cant accomplish.

title: The Stressful Conclusion of a Clinical Trial
description: When I learned this summer that the clinical trial of the cancer drug that seems to be keeping me alive had unexpectedly shut down, I discovered the murky rules governing drug trials and the stressful confusion they breed in participants.

title: Its Election Day. Do You Know How Your Matches Are Voting?
description: Rebecca Cibbarelli, 23, was texting with a man on Hinge while Senator Kamala Harris and Vice President Mike Pence debated on her TV screen in early October. When she told her match what she was watching, he said he didnt know who either of the people in the debate were, or which political office they were running for.

title: How to Do School When Motivation Has Gone Missing
description: The school year is still young, yet parents and students alike may have noticed that academic motivation is already low. No surprise there. Whether school is remote, in-person or hybrid, many students have come to feel that, if this year were a meal, it would be all vegetables and no dessert. Gone, or hamstrung by screens, masks and plexiglass, are the encouraging company of classmates and teachers, the camaraderie of tackling tedious work alongside friends and the school day boost of exchanging a few words with ones crush. Still here is the steady stream of assignments, assessments and lectures.

title: How Trump Lowered Americas Standing in the World
description: Tuesdays election will be seen globally as a referendum on the durability of democracy. If American democracy, long a beacon, cannot self-correct, then all democracies are at risk. European nations have watched with alarm as President Trump has set about undermining American democracy while attacking the very foundations  the European Union and NATO  that allowed war-torn Europe to become whole, democratic and free.

title: Are There Any Mothers Out There Like Me?
description: Motherhood was a dream of love planted in my heart before I was born, always a when, never an if. Even after I divorced at 34, childless, I still assumed my future would follow the date-marry-procreate blueprint Id always imagined. But four years, dozens of dates and not a single serious boyfriend later, it seemed that a husbands second coming was unlikely in my immediate future.

title: Where Covid Left Holes, Volunteers Stepped In
description: On a blustery day in May, Vanessa Fransen rolled her wagon up to a house in Makoti, N.D. She deposited a bundle on the doormat, rang the doorbell and sprinted away. But this wasnt your typical ding-dong-ditch: When her neighbors opened their door, they found a bag full of books.

title: How the Nxivm Sex Cult Leader Tore One Family Apart
description: She walked into a hushed courtroom on Tuesday, turning to face the man who had sexually abused her as a 15-year-old and slept with her older sisters as well, sometimes at the same time. He had ensnared her entire family with his pseudophilosophy of self-fulfillment and pitted them against one another.

title: So, Russia, You Want to Mess With Our Voting Machines?
description: Put yourself in the shoes of Russian or Iranian leadership for a moment. Why not interfere with the voting in the U.S. presidential election? What could be more advantageous than catalyzing a bitter and protracted battle over the results of the election, with a chance of igniting civil unrest throughout the country? Sure, it might not work  but with little to lose and so much to gain, why not try?

title: America Shocked Itself and the World
description: How could we have been so blind? How could we have been so nave? How did we not believe that the worst was possible until we plummeted into it?

title: Texas Is a Tossup. So Why Wont Trump or Biden Campaign There?
description: BROWNSVILLE, Texas  When Senator Ted Cruz of Texas spoke with President Trump on the phone last week, he congratulated the president on his debate performance, nudged him to keep driving policy-oriented attacks against his opponent, Joseph R. Biden Jr., and relayed one more message.

title: Zeta Knocks Out Power to 2 Million
description: Hurricane Zeta barraged the South with powerful winds on Thursday, shredding homes and businesses, knocking down trees and leaving about two million electricity customers without power.

title: Trump Killed the Pax Americana
description: There are, I suppose, some people who still imagine that if and when Donald Trump leaves office well see a rebirth of civility and cooperation in U.S. politics. They are, of course, hopelessly nave. America in the 2020s will remain a deeply polarized nation, rife with crazy conspiracy theories and, quite possibly, plagued by right-wing terrorism.

title: The Mystery of How Many Mothers Have Left Work Because of School Closings
description: The pandemic has been a continuing nightmare for parents.

title: How Will I Ever Look at America the Same Way Again?
description: Its always assumed that those of us who felt certain of Hillary Clintons victory in 2016 were putting too much trust in polls.

title: Smile, Dad: In a Photo Session With Matthew McConaughey, His Kids Did the Shooting
description: Times Insider explains who we are and what we do, and delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how our journalism comes together.

title: Four Wasted Years Thinking About Donald Trump
description: Its very hard to catalog all the things weve lost under the presidency of Donald Trump.

title: Why Celebrities Are Wearing Hot Pink Suits
description: Around this time four years ago, a grass-roots movement began on Facebook urging women to adopt a specific uniform as they went to the polls. And though #wearwhitetovote and #pantsuitnation were superficially about fashion, they were really about symbolism and female solidarity, about the precedent-changing candidacy of Hillary Clinton and the long line of feminists and suffragists that stretched out behind her.

title: How to Staycation in 6 American Cities
description: The pandemic has decimated urban tourism as Americans, if they choose to travel, have fled populated areas to spread out in rural and wilderness destinations where social distancing comes easier.

title: Turkish Bank Case Showed Erdogans Influence With Trump
description: WASHINGTON  Geoffrey S. Berman was outraged.

title: How Suckerfish Surf Across Blue Whales Without Falling Off
description: In 2014, Jeremy Goldbogen, a marine biologist at Stanford University, stuck video cameras on the backs of blue whales, hoping to learn more about their feeding habits. When he retrieved the footage, he realized he had been photobombed. Dozens of Remora australis were treating his research subjects like dance floors, skimming and twisting across them  even as the whales swam at high speeds.

title: Police Pin a Rise in Murders on an Unusual Suspect: Covid
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  Family and friends of Aaron Pryor say they may never know exactly why the 16-year-old star football player, a lightning-fast running back, was killed in broad daylight on a Sunday in September in a driveway near his Oakland home. Video of the shooting viewed by family members shows an assailant, who has not been arrested, confronting the baby-faced teenager before firing more than a dozen rounds.

title: Facing Gap in Pennsylvania, Trump Camp Tries to Make Voting Harder
description: PHILADELPHIA  President Trumps campaign in the crucial battleground of Pennsylvania is pursuing a three-pronged strategy that would effectively suppress mail-in votes in the state, moving to stop the processing of absentee votes before Election Day, pushing to limit how late mail-in ballots can be accepted and intimidating Pennsylvanians trying to vote early.

title: Death Rates Have Dropped for Seriously Ill Covid Patients
description: The coronavirus struck the United States earlier this year with devastating force. In April, it killed more than 10,000 people in New York City. By early May, nearly 50,000 nursing home residents and their caregivers across the country had died.

title: They Scream! We Scream!
description: Ashley Peldon gets paid to scream.

title: Its Going Away: A Small Movie Theater Struggles to Survive
description: On a rainy day last week, 72 moviegoers visited the Park Plaza Cinema in Hilton Head Island, S.C., to see Liam Neeson in Honest Thief. It was the largest single-day attendance the independently owned five-screen theater had seen since reopening in August after a five-month shutdown. The feeling of celebration was short-lived. The next day, only 22 people showed.

title: Tsunamis of Misinformation Overwhelm Local Election Officials
description: The morning after last months presidential debate, the phones inside the Philadelphia election offices that Al Schmidt helps oversee rang off the hook.

title: 16 New Books to Watch For in November
description: Though details are scant, this is shaping up to be the biggest book of the year. We know its the first of a projected two-volume project and encompasses the former presidents campaign and early years in the White House. Crown is printing 3 million copies, and booksellers are hoping the book will offset a string of difficult months since the pandemic hit.

title: 40 Dead, Now 40 Laid Off: Inside a Nursing Home in Crisis
description: On a recent morning in Staten Island, the quiet at Clove Lakes Health Care and Rehabilitation Center was unsettling. Employees in sanitary gowns and face masks moved through a brightly decorated front area devoid of residents or chatter.

title: Celebrity Vetting and Helping the President to Defeat Coronavirus Despair
description: WASHINGTON  A $265 million public campaign to defeat despair around the coronavirus was planned partly around the politically tinged theme that helping the president will help the country, according to documents released on Thursday by House investigators.

title: Judge John Hodgman on Leftovers Etiquette
description: Jake writes: My wife puts ketchup on her macaroni and cheese. I disagree with this, but I dont mind. Today, however, she dumped ketchup right into a container of leftovers with three servings left. She sees nothing wrong. I see a monster.

title: Have a Creepy, Crawly Halloween
description: The fear of snakes has plagued Sydney Masters as long as she can remember. Ms. Masters, a New York public relations executive, experiences an overwhelming panic-attack type of fear  shortness of breath, rapid heartbeat  whenever shes near anything that slithers.

title: Simon Pegg and Nick Frost Are Back With a British X-Files
description: Simon Pegg and Nick Frost know its been a while. Despite being best friends and an acclaimed comic double act in films like Hot Fuzz and Shaun of the Dead, they have seldom crossed paths, creatively speaking, since 2013s The Worlds End. Its been even longer since they worked together in television  they havent co-starred in a series since the British sitcom Spaced aired over 20 years ago.

title: Trumps Thoroughly Modern Masculinity
description: Remarkably, in these fractious times, President Trump has managed to forge a singular area of consensus among liberals and conservatives, Republicans and Democrats: Nearly everyone seems to agree that he represents a throwback to a vintage version of manhood.

title: Has Texas finally become a true presidential battleground state?
description: When Senator Ted Cruz of Texas spoke with President Trump on the phone last week, he congratulated him on his debate performance, nudged him to keep driving policy-oriented attacks against his opponent, Joseph R. Biden Jr., and relayed one more message.

title: Like Outdoor Dining? Try Outdoor Shopping
description: [Want to get New York Today by email? Heres the sign-up.]

title: As Coronavirus Surges, Chastened Dutch Wonder, What Happened to Us?
description: AMSTERDAM  As coronavirus cases have shot through the roof, waiting times for tests and results have grown so lengthy that the health authorities have considered sending samples to labs in Abu Dhabi. Contact tracing, divided among 25 competing contractors, has never gotten off the ground.

title: New Terror Attacks Leave France Embattled at Home and Abroad
description: NICE, France  A terror attack that killed three people in Nice on Thursday left France increasingly embattled at home and abroad, as the government called for toughening measures against Islamist extremism, amid rising tensions with Muslim nations.

title: When One Car Has More Horsepower Than Churchill Downs
description: In 1967, the Ford GT40 was one of the fastest cars on the planet.

title: The Field: The Specter of Political Violence
description: This episode contains strong language.

title: Trailing in Pennsylvania, the Trump camp tries to make it harder to cast a vote.
description: President Trumps campaign is pursuing a three-pronged strategy in the crucial battleground state of Pennsylvania that would effectively suppress mail-in votes there, moving to stop the processing of absentee votes before Election Day, pushing to limit how late mail-in ballots can be accepted and intimidating Pennsylvanians trying to vote early.

title: Where the Virus Is Less Bad
description: With coronavirus cases surging across most of Europe and the Americas, it can be easy to give into nihilism and wonder whether there is any good way for a country to fight the virus.

title: Where the virus is less bad: Canada and Germany.
description: In todays edition of the Morning newsletter, David Leonhardt writes:

title: The connection between Real Housewives and public health behavior.
description: Kelly Dodd is one of the stars of The Real Housewives of Orange County, a show in its 15th season that follows the travails of six women in Southern California.

title: Madre Review: A Tense Depiction of a Mother Undone
description: A parents worst nightmare, unfolding in real time, opens this Spanish drama. Elena (the superb Marta Nieto) gets a call from her young son, Ivn. Hes vacationing in France with his father, from whom Elena is estranged. Ivns dad went to their camper to fetch something, supposedly, and the 6-year-old boy is alone on a deserted beach. The bars on his cellphone are going down, he says. And so is the sun.

title: Spell Review: Occult Reprogramming
description: In Spell, Omari Hardwick plays a tenacious, wealthy lawyer named Marquis T. Woods; his boss calls him a gladiator. But the boss is also worried that Marquis might go easy on class-action plaintiffs who, like Marquis, are Black. Marquis doesnt seem to have any misgivings. Then he gets a call: His abusive father has died, compelling him to return with his wife and children to a remote pocket of Appalachia he was thrilled to escape. Superstition rules the area. Even an airstrip gas station sells gear for warding off conjurers.

title: Come Play Review: Alexa, Find Me a Derivative Thriller
description: The Babadook goes paperless in Come Play, a thriller in which a spindly creature from another realm torments a child and his family through phone screens and tablets.

title: The Donut King Review: Sweet Dreams
description: In 1975, Ted Ngoy fled the war in Cambodia with his wife and three kids and arrived in America as a penniless refugee. Within a decade, he had become a multimillionaire with a lakeside mansion, fancy European cars and a doughnut empire in Southern California that even Dunkin couldnt rival there.

title: Fire Will Come Review: An Arsonist Returns Home to the Forest
description: Theres not too much story in Fire Will Come, but once the title promise comes to fruition, the viewer has come to care about its characters and how they will weather a devastating forest blaze.

title: Welcome to His World: Bela Tarrs First Meteorological Event
description: Made in 1988 but virtually unknown in the United States, Damnation is the movie with which the great Hungarian filmmaker Bela Tarr fully became Bela Tarr.

title: Us Kids Review: Theyre Not All Right
description: Columbine. Sandy Hook. Parkland. Before the pandemic, school shootings had become so commonplace in the United States that they warranted distressingly detailed charts. Us Kids, a documentary directed by Kim A. Snyder (Newtown), uses the 2018 shooting at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, Fla., to ask difficult questions about what it means to grow up in an America habituated to gun violence.

title: Raining in the Mountain Review: A Martial Arts Gem From 1979
description: From the mid-60s to the end of the 70s, the Hong Kong director King Hu (who died in 1997) made some of the most distinctive, daring and enjoyable wuxia (literally, martial heroes) films ever. Raining in the Mountain, from 1979, is the latest Hu to benefit from a restoration and its a treat.

title: Halloween for Kids: Different This Year, but Still Delightful
description: If you have children, then Halloween will see a lot more trick than treat this year. Here in New York, cruising neighborhoods for candy has been discouraged, parades are canceled and bobbing for apples is the kind of innocent party game that makes virologists cry. It might seem that not even a pillowcase full of mini Kit Kats can improve the situation.

title: What Turn Are We Really Rounding on the Virus?
description: Trump continues to insist that a vaccine is coming, while the Supreme Court let stand decisions in two battleground states allowing more absentee ballots to be counted. Its Thursday, and this is your politics tip sheet. Sign up here to get On Politics in your inbox every weekday.

title: The True Adventures of Wolfboy Review: A Hirsute Teen Drama
description: Paul (Jaeden Martell), the titular 13-year-old of The True Adventures of Wolfboy, has a condition that causes his body to be covered in hair; if he tries shaving, the hair grows back thicker. Bullies ridicule him for his appearance and dont even spare his single father (Chris Messina).

title: For Stock Markets, an Unwelcome Dj Vu Feeling
description: On Nov. 17 and 18, DealBook is holding our first Online Summit. Join us as we welcome the most consequential newsmakers in business, policy and culture to explore the pivotal questions of the moment  and the future. Watch from anywhere in the world, free of charge. Register now.

title: As the West Stumbles, Helmsman Xi Pushes an Ambitious Plan for China
description: The United States is embroiled in a bitter presidential race and a surge in coronavirus infections. Europe is locking down again. In Beijing, by contrast, Xi Jinping is exuding confidence that he and China can emerge from the pandemic stronger and unbowed.

title: The Tax Fight Haunting California
description: Good morning.

title: Manufacturers got a big bounce, but service businesses still face a big climb.
description: The pandemic didnt just shrink the U.S. economy. It also reshaped it, at least temporarily  shutting down some industries almost entirely, while leading to a rise in demand in others.

title: Can I Tell My Friend Her Halloween Costume Is Problematic?
description: A new friend in the Midwest was invited to an outdoor Halloween party where mask-wearing was requested. We went shopping for an art-inspired costume for her. But I saw that she was gravitating toward period costumes. After the party, she posted pictures online. I was stunned! She wore a full-blown Scarlett OHara-type gown  to a mansion, no less! If Id known, I would have tried to talk her out if it. This years widespread Black Lives Matter protests, along with the traditional whitewashing of the antebellum South, make her choice seem insensitive. Ill be seeing her soon, and I already feel awkward. I know shell share details of the party, and I feel obligated to enlighten her. Any advice?

title: The T List: Five Things We Recommend This Week
description: Welcome to the T List, a newsletter from the editors of T Magazine. Each week, were sharing things were eating, wearing, listening to or coveting now. Sign up here to find us in your inbox every Wednesday. You can always reach us at tlist@nytimes.com.

title: On the Market in the New York Region
description: This weeks featured properties are a seven-bedroom in Maplewood, N.J., and a five-bedroom in Sea Cliff, N.Y.

title: Homes for Sale in New York and New Jersey
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties:

title: On the Market in New York City
description: This weeks properties are in Park Slope, Lenox Hill and Woodside.

title: Homes for Sale in Brooklyn, Manhattan and Queens
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties:

title: Black and Hispanic workers, especially women, lag in the U.S. economic recovery.
description: The surge in economic output in the third quarter set a record, but the recovery isnt reaching everyone.

title: Scraping by on benefits and part-time work, but a cutoff looms at years end.
description: When the pandemic hit, Laura Mayer was the general manager at Public House, a restaurant at Oracle Park, the San Francisco Giants baseball stadium. Ms. Mayer, 56, was furloughed in March, and started receiving about $450 a week in state unemployment benefits in May.

title: A $265 million feel-good P.R. effort to boost Trump on the coronavirus draws Democrats ire.
description: A $265 million Trump administration campaign to defeat despair about the coronavirus was planned partly around the politically tinged theme that helping the president will help the country, according to documents released on Thursday by House investigators.

title: Student Voting Surges Despite Efforts to Suppress It
description: With many campus quads resembling ghost towns and childhood bedrooms serving as lecture halls, politically active college students have moved their get-out-the-vote efforts online, hosting debate watch parties on Zoom, recruiting poll workers over Instagram and encouraging students to post their voting plans on Snapchat.

title: Cars led a wave in spending on goods.
description: As the U.S. economy rebounded in the third quarter, one sector played a big role: Motor vehicles and parts were selling rapidly, contributing to an overall bounce in durable good spending.

title: Todays economic report shows a record-setting rebound. But the numbers are misleading.
description: U.S. economic output grew at the fastest pace on record last quarter as businesses began to reopen and customers returned to stores. But the economy has climbed only partway out of its pandemic-induced hole, and progress is slowing.

title: Quick, Quick, Quick: Trump Rushes Martha McSally at Rally
description: On Wednesday night at a rally in Arizona, President Trump rushed Senator Martha McSally on stage as she fights to hold on to her seat.

title: What Trumps disrespectful treatment of Martha McSally says about his own struggles.
description: President Trumps dismissive and disrespectful treatment of his nominal political ally Senator Martha McSally in Arizona on Wednesday was cast by local media as a humiliating coda to her difficult campaign.

title: Home building has helped drive the U.S. recovery. Exports have lagged.
description: The main factor behind the big third-quarter rebound in U.S. economic output was growth in spending by consumers. Business investment played a major role too, and for similar reasons: Activity was all but halted during the spring lockdowns, then bounced back once the economy began to reopen.

title: A Not-So-Merry Mix: Shakespeare, Bluegrass and Randy Quaid
description: Among the casualties of the current Broadway shutdown are shows in previews that will never officially open, as well as those whose futures are still in limbo. This series is looking at the curious history of five other shows aimed for Broadway that never got to opening night.

title: There Are Tons of Brown Faces Missing: Publishers Step Up Diversity Efforts
description: This summer, as people across the United States gathered to protest police brutality and racial injustice, Krishan Trotman, an executive editor at Hachette Books, approached the head of the company with a proposal.

title: Gileads Covid-19 Drug Is Mediocre. It Will Be a Blockbuster Anyway.
description: The United States reached a milestone, of sorts, when last week the Food and Drug Administration approved the first treatment for Covid-19.

title: Labour Party Suspends Jeremy Corbyn Over Anti-Semitism Response
description: LONDON  Britains main opposition party, Labour, suspended its former leader Jeremy Corbyn on Thursday after he deflected blame for the partys handling of anti-Semitism allegations, setting the stage for an extraordinary rupture with Labours recent past and another period of tortured infighting over its future.

title: The American Economy Was Hit by a Bus. Its Healing, but Slowly.
description: To understand what the latest numbers on gross domestic product are telling us, imagine you are an obsessive sort who takes various measures of your health every day, puts those readings into a spreadsheet, and then every three months averages those daily numbers to get a summary of whether you are getting better or worse.

title: The Trump campaign celebrated a growth record that Democrats downplayed.
description: The White House celebrated economic growth numbers for the third quarter released on Thursday, even as Joseph R. Biden Jr.s presidential campaign sought to throw cold water on the report  the last major data release leading up to the Nov. 3 election  and warned that the economic recovery was losing steam.

title: Zeta Causes Widespread Damage After Hitting Gulf Coast
description: After hitting the Louisiana coast as a Category 2 hurricane, Zetas strong winds caused widespread power outages in Mississippi, Alabama, Georgia and the Carolinas.

title: When It Comes to Octopuses, Taste Is for Suckers
description: Should anything ever compel you to lick an octopuss arm, keep this in mind: That arm has all the cellular machinery to taste your tongue right back.

title: Poll roundup: Bidens numbers stay strong, as an NBC/Marist survey finds him ahead in Florida.
description: A trove of polls conducted mostly or entirely after the final presidential debate  which the Trump campaign had hoped would turn around the presidents sagging numbers  landed on Wednesday, and they offered little in the way of encouragement for President Trump.

title: After bitter debate in Georgia, Senator David Perdue cancels third face off with Jon Ossoff.
description: Senator David Perdue of Georgia withdrew on Thursday from the final debate in his tight re-election race, a day after his Democratic challenger, Jon Ossoff, called him a crook and accused the vulnerable Republican of trying to profit from the coronavirus pandemic.

title: In This Strange Election Year, Foreign Embassies Find Little Access to Democrats
description: WASHINGTON  Last July, as Joseph R. Biden Jr. was about to accept the Democratic nomination for president, the British ambassador to Washington invited a few of the former vice presidents close friends and advisers to an intimate dinner.

title: Here Are the Policy Advisers Who Have Joe Bidens Ear
description: WASHINGTON  Joseph R. Biden Jr., plotting an ambitious presidency that would begin amid twin health and economic crises, is leaning on veteran advisers with high-level governmental experience rather than outsiders and ideological rivals to help guide him on subjects including the coronavirus pandemic and the countrys diminished standing in the world.

title: As details emerge in Whitmer plot, F.B.I. arrests Michigan men said to be tied to a white supremacist group.
description: Federal and state authorities arrested two men in Michigan on Thursday who they said were members of a white supremacist group, taking the men into custody just three weeks after more than a dozen members of a separate, anti-government group were accused of plotting to kidnap the states governor.

title: David Guillod, Hollywood Executive, Arrested Again After Assault Report
description: David Guillod, a former Hollywood executive who was out on bail after being charged with sexually assaulting four women, was arrested again on Wednesday in connection with another sexual assault report, the Los Angeles Police Department said.

title: The South Park Guys Break Down Their Viral Deepfake Video
description: Like so many other things on the internet, the viral video Sassy Justice seemed too good to be true when it started showing up on television and then on the internet earlier this week. Presented as a local news broadcast from a station in Cheyenne, Wyo., the video is hosted by a reporter named Fred Sassy, who appears to be a dead ringer for President Trump  if he wore a cheap suit and a white wig and spoke with a campy accent.

title: Kayleigh McEnany, the White House press secretary, blurs the line between government and politics.
description: Kayleigh McEnany, the White House press secretary, has suddenly started appearing on Fox News from a set-up at President Trumps re-election headquarters, further blurring the lines between government and political activity.

title: How to Shop for a Used Computer
description: Sure, buying a good used PC takes a little more work, but a laptop or desktop from a few years ago can be much cheaper.

title: At the Queens Museum, Home and the World
description: Over the years, the Queens Museum has helped me define my sense of what an art museum can be: a place as much about ideas as about objects, as much about politics as about aesthetics, and as much about local as about global.

title: Pelosi, predicting a Biden win, says shed push sweeping virus relief in the lame duck session.
description: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi predicted on Thursday that Democrats would win back the White House and said she was already making preparations for a Joseph R. Biden Jr. presidency.

title: Kavanaugh Fixes Error in Election Opinion After Vermont Complaint
description: Justice Brett M. Kavanaugh on Wednesday corrected an error in an opinion issued as part of a Supreme Court ruling that barred Wisconsin from counting mail-in ballots that arrive after Election Day.

title: A campaign-closing R.N.C. ad acknowledges what Trump played down: the pandemic and unemployment.
description: The Republican National Committee is going on the air in two battleground states in the final days before the election with an ad campaign that acknowledges two issues President Trump has often ignored or insisted are irrelevant: the coronavirus pandemic and high unemployment.

title: Leon Black Calls Relationship With Jeffrey Epstein a Terrible Mistake
description: Leon Black, the billionaire private equity executive whose financial ties to Jeffrey Epstein have sparked questions from his powerful clients, said Thursday that it had been a terrible mistake to give Mr. Epstein a second chance after his sex-crimes conviction in 2009.

title: Goodnight to Our Beautiful, Wet Blue Moon
description: The moon remains, perpetually and since antiquity, a source of cultural wonder. Last week, when NASA announced that it would reveal an exciting new discovery about the moon in a matter of days, the internet, thirsty for distraction, went wild speculating about it. (It happened to be exciting news for space scientists  water and ice on the moon are more accessible than previously thought  but not the supernatural or extraterrestrial news many yearned for.)

title: What We Know About the Death of Walter Wallace Jr. in Philadelphia
description: On the afternoon of Oct. 26, two Philadelphia police officers fatally shot Walter Wallace Jr., a 27-year-old Black man who was armed with a knife. In the nights that followed, protesters clashed with officers in the streets, and city officials imposed a curfew to try to curb the unrest.

title: You (YOU!) Can Stop Election Rumors
description: This article is part of the On Tech newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it weekdays.

title: Pelosi Very Confident Biden Will Win
description: Speaker Nancy Pelosi said on Thursday that she had already made preparations for the Democratic nominees presidency.

title: Chinas Leaders Vow Tech Self-Reliance, Military Power and Economic Recovery
description: Chinas Communist Party emerged from four days of meetings behind closed doors in Beijing declaring the countrys leader, Xi Jinping, a helmsman who would lead the ship of socialism sailing into the wind and waves with determination.

title: Yes, We Liked the Berkshires Shows. Heres $2 Million.
description: The calls came in late August. A couple who had moved up to the Berkshires during the pandemic had seen the first two union-approved theatrical productions of the summer, and were impressed. Now they had a question: What would it cost to keep those theaters intact for another six months?

title: Biden and Cunningham Hold Slim Leads in North Carolina, Poll Finds
description: Joseph R. Biden Jr. holds a small but durable lead over President Trump in North Carolina, where fully 64 percent of likely voters say they have already cast their ballots, according to a New York Times/Siena College poll released on Thursday.

title: In M.L.S., the Pandemic Changes the Playoff Math
description: Major League Soccers reworked regular season is, at last, racing to a conclusion. Many of the leagues teams have only two games left to play of this years truncated, 23-game schedule. Several others must squeeze in three matches in the next 11 days.

title: How Virus Politics Divided a Conservative Town in Wisconsins North
description: MINOCQUA, Wis.  When coronavirus cases began to spike in Wisconsin this fall, Rob Swearingen kept his restaurant open and let customers and employees decide whether they wanted to wear masks.

title: Bob Biggs, Los Angeles Punk-Rock Entrepreneur, Dies at 74
description: Bob Biggs, who sensed opportunity in the Mohawk-filled mosh pits of the Los Angeles punk movement in the late 1970s and founded Slash Records, which became one of the most successful independent record labels of its era, died on Oct. 17 at his ranch in Tehachapi, Calif. He was 74.

title: Bidens Call for National Mask Mandate Gains Traction in Public Health Circles
description: WASHINGTON  As the nation heads into what public health experts are calling a dark winter of coronavirus illness and death, public health experts are coalescing around Joseph R. Biden Jr.s call for a national mask mandate, even as they concede such an effort would require much more than the stroke of a presidential pen.

title: Bidens national mask mandate would face challenges, but he has other ways to encourage their use.
description: A growing cadre of public health experts is coalescing around Joseph R. Biden Jr.s call for a national mask mandate, even as they concede such an effort would require much more than the stroke of a presidential pen.

title: Justice Kavanaugh corrects an error in opinion that alarmed Democrats.
description: Justice Brett M. Kavanaugh on Wednesday corrected an error in an opinion he issued as part of a Supreme Court ruling that barred Wisconsin from counting mail-in ballots that arrive after Election Day.

title: Women Could Decide the Election. Heres How Theyre Voting.
description: If President Trump loses his re-election bid, female voters will probably have played a critical role.

title: The Wine Worlds Most Elite Circle Has a Sexual Harassment Problem
description: Master sommelier is the most prestigious title in American wine, and those who earn it instantly join the ranks of the highest-paid and most influential members of the profession.

title: A Glass House in the Mexican Desert
description: At dusk, the house appears as a phosphorescent box, its mirrored panels reflecting the light of the sky and the ocher hues of the mountainside that, as if a mirage, will soon vanish as night falls. Casa Etrea  perched above San Miguel de Allende on the rugged slopes of the extinct Palo Hurfano volcano, part of the greater Los Picachos mountain range of Central Mexico  is both an architectural showpiece and a site-specific art installation, one built to inspire a sense of awe. A feat of sustainable engineering that uses solar energy and collected rainwater, the 800-square-foot dwelling has a glass exterior (with a striped UV-reflective coating) that is bird-friendly  even as it creates the effect of a seemingly infinite landscape.

title: Ancient Dog DNA Shows Early Spread Around the Globe
description: The most extensive study of ancient dog DNA to date has shown how rapidly dogs spread across the world after domestication, and pins their likely origin to a group of extinct wolves.

title: Remarkable Records of Joni Mitchells Changes
description: The story of why Joni Mitchell quit piano lessons is also the story of how Joni Mitchell wrote her first song. She was around 7, and the tune was called Robin Walk  it was real bouncy, she remembers in a spirited interview with Cameron Crowe for the liner notes of her new archival collection, Joni Mitchell Archives Vol. 1: The Early Years (1963-1967).

title: Transitioning From Fossil Fuels
description: To the Editor:

title: Chris Pendergast, Who Fought A.L.S. Mile After Mile, Dies at 71
description: Chris Pendergast, a Long Island teacher who defied the odds by surviving 27 years with Lou Gehrigs disease, leading marathon rides for life for hundreds of miles from his motorized wheelchair to publicize the plight of fellow patients and raise $10 million for research, died on Oct. 14 at his home in Miller Place, N.Y. He was 71.

title: Hurricane Zeta disrupts early in-person voting in Georgia.
description: The morning after Hurricane Zetas forceful winds downed power lines, toppled trees and caused road closures across the state of Georgia, widespread outages left more than 600,000 Georgians without electricity and took some of the states advanced voting locations offline Thursday  the penultimate day for early, in-person voting.

title: For Retailers, a Halloween Shock: Its Actually Happening
description: Scott Morris, a co-owner of Morris Costumes in Charlotte, N.C., has slept at the office for the past 50 days but he isnt complaining.

title: After Terror Attacks, Muslims Wonder About Their Place in France
description: IVRY-SUR-SEINE, France  At age 42, Mehdy Belabbas embodied the French republican promise of upward social mobility: the son of a Muslim construction worker of Algerian descent, he was the first in his family to attend graduate school and served for 12 years as the deputy mayor of the working-class city where he grew up.

title: Biden leads in a new poll in Pennsylvania, one of the states that may decide the election.
description: Quinnipiac University released polls in four major swing states on Thursday, showing former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. leading in Pennsylvania, narrowly ahead in Ohio, and effectively tied with President Trump in Florida and Iowa.

title: Glenn Greenwald Leaves The Intercept, Claiming He Was Censored
description: The national security journalist and free speech advocate Glenn Greenwald has left The Intercept, the news website he helped create, claiming his work had been censored.

title: The Venezuelan-American Vote, From a First-Timer in Florida
description: MIAMI  This year Ill be voting for the first time in a U.S. presidential election. Registering to vote online, the option to mail-in my ballot or vote early  its all new to me.

title: 12 New Books We Recommend This Week
description: To a horror fan, Halloween vs. Covid-19 sounds almost as promising as Godzilla vs. Kong. But in the end its been no real contest  not in my neighborhood, anyway, where health officials are reminding people that parties are a bad idea this year and recommending that children forgo the usual trick-or-treating. Thats ironic, maybe, for a holiday meant to show that were not afraid of death. But there you have it. Were afraid of death.

title: 8 Things to Do This Halloween Weekend
description: Best to stay in this Halloween weekend, lest you encounter 2020s most frightening monster: the superspreader event.

title: Amid a Local Outbreak, a Historically Black University Cancels Basketball Season
description: The womens basketball team at Bethune-Cookman University conducted an ordinary practice on Monday morning. The coaches spent time reviewing the fundamentals of the pack-line defense, testing the players knowledge of different sets. They proceeded with a lengthy scrimmage.

title: A Top Aide to Saddam Hussein Is Reported Dead
description: One of the most senior leaders of Saddam Husseins government and the highest-ranking figure to have eluded capture after the American invasion in 2003 has died, according to Iraqi officials and the deceased dictators Baath Party.

title: What Students Are Saying About Embarrassing Parents, Personal Style and Social Media Perceptions
description: For this weeks roundup of student comments on our writing prompts, we asked teenagers if they have ever felt embarrassed by their parents, what their style choices says about their personality and if they believe social media is an accurate reflection of peoples lives.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: Hundreds of thousands of migrant workers who have largely been confined to dormitories since last spring will be allowed to visit designated recreation centers on their days off starting Saturday, if they test negative for the coronavirus.

title: Economys Big Rebound Leaves a Shortfall as Progress Slows
description: U.S. economic output increased at the fastest pace on record last quarter as businesses began to reopen and customers returned to stores. But the economy has climbed only partway out of its pandemic-induced hole, and progress is slowing.

title: Zoe Lister-Jones on The Craft and Womens Power
description: Growing up, Zoe Lister-Jones, the actress and filmmaker, was not into frights. Not a horror person. I never did the Ouija board, Bloody Mary, light-as-a-feather slumber-party vibe, she said. It was Brooklyn in the 90s, and I think that my life felt scary enough.

title: Tony La Russa Returns at 76, Ready to Combine Old Wisdom and New Data
description: Tony La Russa has a permanent home along the top row of the back wall in the Hall of Fames plaque gallery in Cooperstown, N.Y., between Bobby Cox and Frank Thomas. That is where visitors will find La Russa: in profile, lips creased, eyes focused, a strategist in bronze. The first sentence of the text below his image cites his 2,728 victories, the third most for a manager.

title: Have States Split Their Electoral College Votes
description: To the Editor:

title: Justice Dept. Is Said to Quietly Quash Inquiry Into Tamir Rice Killing
description: WASHINGTON  The Justice Department decided more than a year ago to effectively shut down its civil-rights investigation into the high-profile killing of Tamir Rice, a 12-year-old Black boy carrying a pellet gun who was shot by a Cleveland police officer in 2014, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Virtual Reality: Realizing the Power of Experience, Excursion and Immersion in the Classroom
description: In 2015, The New York Times pioneered a new form of storytelling: virtual reality journalism. In an introduction to its first V.R. video, The Displaced, a documentary about three children who had been forced from their homes by war and persecution, Jake Silverstein, The New York Times Magazines editor, wrote:

title: Billy Joe Shaver, Outlaw Singer and Songwriter, Dies at 81
description: Billy Joe Shaver, the Texas singer-songwriter whose trenchant, vivid compositions helped launch country musics outlaw movement in the 1970s, died on Wednesday in Waco, Texas. He was 81.

title: No Selfies or Hugs, but Biden Is Sneaking In Meet and Greets
description: Before a speech this month in Durham, N.C., Joseph R. Biden Jr. made his way around a circle of participants, chatting with each of them before posing for a group photograph. In Chester, Pa., a week later, he kibitzed with supporters, playfully punching one in the arm. And on a recent trip to Florida, his private schedule for the day included time for a photo line.

title: Why Is Europe Keeping Its Schools Open, Despite New Lockdowns?
description: BERLIN  When Chancellor Angela Merkel announced the latest round of restrictions on public life, she named bars, restaurants, theaters, concert halls, gyms and tattoo parlors as institutions that would be forced to close. But missing from the list released on Wednesday were schools and day care centers  among the first to be shuttered in the spring lockdown.

title: Biden leans into climate change with two new ads.
description: Former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. is leaning into climate change in the final days before the election, issuing new national ads attacking President Trumps science denial even as Mr. Trump continues to hammer his rivals position on the oil industry.

title: Waiter, Theres a Fly in Our Bubble
description: With a monumental election on the horizon, we want to bring up a few recent events that reveal some sort of truth amid the confusion. From the N.B.A. bubble to the fly in Mike Pences debate-night hair to the HBO series Lovecraft Country, these are the moments that point us beyond the present, to be our best and greatest selves.

title: Its Up to You, You Hold the Key, Biden Tells Florida Voters
description: Campaigning in South Florida, Joseph R. Biden Jr., the Democratic presidential nominee, called on Latino voters to reject President Trump, and promised to reverse Trumps hard-line Cuba policy.

title: U.S. Coronavirus Cases Surpass 9 Million With No End in Sight
description: CHICAGO  The United States, which reported its first known coronavirus case in Washington State 282 days ago, surpassed nine million total infections on Thursday, including more than half a million in the past week, as Covid-19 spiraled out of control in the lead-up to Election Day.

title: Lingering Mail Problems Worry Voters in Final Week of Election
description: WASHINGTON  She waited and waited for her mail-in ballot to arrive until  finally, maddeningly  she could wait no more.

title: Film Club: Three Families. Nine Weeks. Things Are Getting Annoying.
description: Three Families. Nine Weeks. Things Are Getting Annoying. profiles three families, seven parents and nine kids who filmed themselves and share what it has been like to work, parent, school, eat, sleep and hang out all jammed under one roof for three months straight during quarantine. This eight-minute film touches on themes of family, love, conflict and perseverance and offers many practical and often humorous lessons on parenting in a pandemic like Trust your kids to do their work, Dont force mindfulness and Dont forget to follow your own rules.

title: From Bolivia, Lessons for a Successful Election
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia  As nationalism, misinformation and the pandemic have emerged as threats to democracy  and a presidential election has roiled the United States  the relatively small nation of Bolivia, in political upheaval for most its 195-year history, managed a free and fair vote.

title: U.S. to Remove Wolves From Protected Species List
description: Gray wolves, one of the first animals shielded by the Endangered Species Act after Americans all but exterminated them in the lower 48 states, will no longer receive federal protection, officials announced Thursday.

title: Trump Boasts About G.D.P Growth and Attacks News Media
description: President Trump campaigned in Tampa, Fla., Thursday boasting about third-quarter economic gains, and assailing the news media as the enemy of the people.

title: Long Lines, Steady Rain: Voting Early in N.Y.C.
description: At least 700,000 voters have flocked to New York City poll sites since early voting began, causing long waits in some places. Heres what voters at the site with the most assigned voters in the city had to say.

title: Twitter Bots Poised to Spread Disinformation Before Election
description: Be aware: Fake Twitter accounts will very likely sow disinformation in the few remaining days before Election Day on Nov. 3.

title: Slump in Air Travel Hindered Weather Forecasting, Study Shows
description: Government researchers have confirmed that the steep decline in air traffic during the coronavirus pandemic has affected the quality of weather forecasting models by sharply reducing the amount of atmospheric data routinely collected by commercial airliners.

title: F.B.I. Arrests Michigan Men Tied to White Supremacist Group
description: Federal and state authorities arrested two men in Michigan on Thursday who they said were members of a white supremacist group. The arrests come three weeks after more than a dozen men tied to a separate anti-government group were accused of plotting to kidnap the states governor.

title: In Voting Cases, Chief Justice Roberts Is Alone but in Control
description: WASHINGTON  In a little over a week, the Supreme Court issued five sets of orders in election cases. In three of them, Democrats prevailed.

title: Chris Christie Makes Cameo Video For Montana Democrat (By Mistake)
description: Chris Christie, the former New Jersey governor, on Thursday became the latest Republican politician to be fooled into making a campaign video on behalf of a Democrat.

title: Walmart, citing unrest in Philadelphia, takes guns off its sales floors.
description: Citing civil unrest in Philadelphia, Walmart has moved all of its guns and ammunition off the sales floors in its stores as a precaution for the safety of our associates and customers.

title: How Much Watching Time Do You Have This Weekend?
description: Every Monday and Friday, Margaret offers hyper-specific viewing recommendations in our Watching newsletter. Read her latest picks below, and sign up for the Watching newsletter here.

title: For a High Risk-Mom, Halloween Feels Extra Tricky
description: I always know when my older daughter is about to cry. Shes 9 now, but her voice still gives her away, a slight squeak settling into her words. When she doesnt speak, her cheeks show me, a blush spreading out from their centers. It was this way one night in late August as she pulled pajamas from her drawers.

title: The Stories Behind 5 Horror Movie Masks
description: Michael Myerss mask from the Halloween movies was based on a death mask originally made for Captain Kirk on Star Trek.

title: Twitter Bots Poised to Spread Disinformation Before Election
description: Researchers found that bots have helped spread falsehoods related to the coronavirus and far-right conspiracy theories such QAnon and pizzagate.

title: Times reporters discuss election, polling and more.
description: With just five days to go until Nov. 3, join as Rachel Dry, a New York Times deputy politics editor, chats with politics reporters Alex Burns, Maggie Haberman, Astead W. Herndon and Lisa Lerer to discuss what to watch for and their best guess as to what will unfold.

title: An Astronomers Guide to Stargazing with Your Space-Obsessed Kid
description: As a little girl growing up in Portugal, Raquel Nuno made birthday wishes upon shooting stars. She was born near the peak of the Perseids meteor shower, one of the most prolific annual cosmic light shows. Every year her father whisked her and her family away to the beach to celebrate under the celestial fireworks. There, she gazed up at the dazzling display amid a backdrop of stars as countless as the grains of sand at her feet.

title: Whats Going On in This Graph? | Unemployment During the Pandemic
description: Our next Whats Going On in This Graph? live-moderated discussion will take place on Wednesday,  Nov. 18.

title: A Man in a Black Ski Mask Cuts Short a 17-Year-Olds Life
description: Derek Trucios was still a high school student, just 17, but he already was talking about going to medical school. He had finished his online courses on Wednesday afternoon and was strolling with a 16-year-old friend down a residential Brooklyn street when a man in a black ski mask came up to them.

title: Big Tech Continues Its Surge Ahead of the Rest of the Economy
description: While the rest of the U.S. economy languished earlier this year, the tech industrys biggest companies seemed immune to the downturn, surging as the country worked, learned and shopped from home.

title: In a Lawsuit, Jerry Falwell Jr. Accuses Liberty University of Defamation
description: Jerry Falwell Jr. is suing his former employer, Liberty University, accusing the evangelical college of damaging his reputation in a series of actions taken after his dramatic departure from the school in August.

title: New York Nightmare: Man Falls Through Sidewalk Into Rat-Filled Chasm
description: On Saturday just past noon, Leonard Shoulders strolled up to a bus stop in the Belmont neighborhood of the Bronx. A handful of people stood around, waiting for their rides or looking down at their phones  an unremarkable scene.

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
description: Amid a pandemic of bad news, theres a bright spot: Survival rates among Covid-19 patients, even those with severe cases, are improving.

title: G.D.P., Florida, Octopus: Your Thursday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this newsletter in your inbox? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Dan Bongino Has No Idea Why Facebook Loves Him
description: Just a few years ago, Dan Bongino was a B-list pundit working on the fringes of conservative media.

title: Races to Watch in California
description: In some ways, California and its concerns have been more visible than ever in this presidential election.

title: At Least 140 Drown in Worst Shipwreck of 2020, U.N. Agency Says
description: At least 140 people drowned when a boat carrying migrants sank off the Senegalese coast over the weekend in the deadliest shipwreck this year, the International Organization for Migration, a United Nations agency, said on Thursday.

title: NASAs Asteroid Mission Packs Away Its Cargo. Next Stop: Earth.
description: A NASA spacecraft 200 million miles away from Earth has packed up a sample of an asteroid it collected last week.

title: Dan Baum, Journalist, Author and Long-Form Tweeter, Dies at 64
description: Dan Baum had been a successful freelance writer and author for 17 years when he landed a staff writing job at The New Yorker. He called it the ne plus ultra of journalism gigs.

title: Holidays Must Look Different This Year. Lives Are at Stake.
description: In some ways, the coronavirus is still a mystery. Scientists cant say for certain why its deadly or debilitating in some people but has virtually no effect in others. They dont know exactly how long immunity lasts or whether (or when) a vaccine will stop its spread and bring this wretched chapter to a close.

title: Lies, Damned Lies and Trump Rallies
description: Donald Trump lies a lot. In fact, he lies so often that several media organizations try to keep a running tally, and even try to draw political inferences from fluctuations in the number of lies he tells in a given month (although the trend has been relentlessly upward).

title: The Voting Suppression Tipping Point
description: This article is part of the Debatable newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it on Tuesdays and Thursdays.

title: Choua Yang, Hmong Refugee and Educator, Dies at 53
description: This obituary is part of a series about people who have died in the coronavirus pandemic. Read about others here.

title: Dems Mess With Texas
description: Hi. Welcome to On Politics, your guide to the day in national politics. Im Lisa Lerer, your host.

title: Jimmy Orr, a Favorite Target of the Colts Unitas, Dies at 85
description: Jimmy Orr, the Baltimore Colts receiver who teamed with quarterback Johnny Unitas in one of the N.F.L.s leading passing combinations of the 1960s, died on Tuesday at his home in Brunswick, Ga., in the states coastal low country. He was 85.

title: Trump and Biden Converge in Florida, an Elusive Prize Still Up for Grabs
description: TAMPA, Fla.  That old political heartbreaker, the presidential battleground of Florida, lured the two White House contenders to the same city on Thursday, as President Trump and Joseph R. Biden Jr. confronted some of their biggest political vulnerabilities in a state that is once again shaping up as the most elusive prize in next weeks election.

title: Trumps Hard-Line Immigration Policies Go Before Voters
description: McALLEN, Texas  The leadership of the Department of Homeland Security gathered on Thursday under the shadow of 30-foot, black-painted, steel bollards to promote the near completion of 400 miles of President Trumps border wall.

title: Five Great Things Biden Has Already Done
description: Many of our best presidents have been underestimated. Truman was seen as the tool of a corrupt political machine. Eisenhower was supposedly a bumbling middlebrow. Grant was thought a taciturn simpleton. Even F.D.R. was once considered a lightweight feather duster.

title: Clemsons Trevor Lawrence Tests Positive for the Coronavirus
description: Trevor Lawrence, the star quarterback at top-ranked Clemson and a leading contender for the Heisman Trophy, has tested positive for coronavirus, the university said Thursday night.

title: The Original Nachos Were Crunchy, Cheesy and Truly Mexican
description: The biggest claim to fame for the border city of Piedras Negras, in Coahuila, Mexico, is that it was the birthplace of nachos, one of Americas most popular snacks. Yet that fact is not widely known beyond the region, something that has long frustrated the people of Piedras, as locals call their hometown. Theyre so proud of their invention that they started the International Nacho Festival there in 1995.

title: First Pass Friday
description: FRIDAY PUZZLE  Welcome back to a featurette that I like to call First Pass Friday, where solvers get to see how I did on the first tricky themeless puzzle of the week and, subsequently, feel much, much better about themselves.

title: Will Mank Be Netflixs First Best-Picture Winner?
description: Citizen Kane has cast a vast cinematic shadow for nearly eight decades, sitting atop countless lists of the greatest films ever made.

title: Corrections: Oct. 30, 2020
description: An article on Wednesday about the use of conservative judicial appointments as an incentive for people to vote Republican misstated the number of vacancies in the federal appellate courts. Several hours before Justice Amy Coney Barrett was confirmed by the Senate, a judge from the First Circuit, Juan Torruella, died. The courts now have two vacancies, not one.

title: Quotation of the Day: Tech Start-Ups Are Divided on Politics
description: Its disingenuous and its also the luxury of the privileged to say, We dont have a point of view.

title: Coronavirus, Nice Attacks, U.S. Election: Your Friday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: A Remix from The Daily
description: Listen to a Halloween edition of Michael Barbaros intro on The Daily.

title: N.H.L. Team Drops Top Draft Pick Accused of Racist Bullying
description: The Arizona Coyotes said on Thursday that they had renounced the rights to their top pick in this years N.H.L. draft after a published report described the players 2016 conviction in a juvenile-court case related to bullying of a Black classmate who has a developmental disability.

title: The Ghost Was the Least of Our Problems
description: My ghost is a mother. I am convinced of this by both the ghosts behavior and the history of our house. You see, a mother died here, on the property. We were told the three-story Victorian was being sold as is after the longtime owners, a couple, had died tragically.

title: Travis Roy, Who Inspired Millions After a Hockey Tragedy, Dies at 45
description: Travis Roy, who suffered a paralyzing injury just 11 seconds into his first hockey game for Boston University in 1995 and, as a philanthropist and motivational speaker, was revered by the sports world as an example of determination and courage, died on Thursday in a hospital outside Burlington, Vt. He was 45.

title: New Zealands Advance Preview of a Post-Virus World
description: Roughly three weeks ago, I stepped off a plane and into a parallel universe. Here in New Zealand, coronavirus lurks far from the limelight, the recent election was orderly and uncontroversial, and the national mood  for the most part  approximates relief and even elation.

title: In Avignon, Snatching Theater From the Jaws of New Lockdowns
description: AVIGNON, France  Festivalgoers who cross the medieval ramparts of Avignon are used to being greeted with a riot of activity. Every July, thousands of posters cover the citys walls to advertise stage productions as the official Avignon Festival and its Fringe compete for attention. Seemingly every street corner brings hopeful performers ready to pitch their work to passers-by, day and night.

title: A Korean news agency publishes an op-ed from Biden.
description: In the waning days of the presidential race, former Vice President Joseph R. Biden is straying way off the traditional political map to chase votes: He delivered a closing argument in an op-ed published Friday by a prominent South Korean news agency.

title: Biden and Trump will criss-cross the Midwest as the campaign enters its last weekend.
description: With Election Day less than 100 hours away, the Trump and Biden campaigns are fanning out across the crucial swing states that are likely to decide the race. The president will campaign in Michigan, Minnesota and Wisconsin today, while Joseph R. Biden Jr. travels to Minnesota, Wisconsin and Iowa.

title: Prosecutors Call Former Embassy Employee an Experienced Sexual Predator
description: A former employee at the U.S. Embassy in Mexico, described by prosecutors as an experienced sexual predator, was arrested in San Diego this month and charged with videotaping and photographing a woman while she was partially naked and unconscious.

title: A vote-counting official in Florida who gave money to Trumps campaign resigns.
description: The acting chairman of the county board that inspects and tabulates mail-in ballots in Jacksonville, Fla., resigned on Thursday amid criticism that he had made political donations to President Trump and displayed his campaign signs at his home.

title: As virus cases rise across the U.S., records topple.
description: More than 2,000 new coronavirus cases in Colorado. More than 6,400 new cases in Illinois. And more than 1,000 new cases in New Mexico.

title: An unproven Covid-19 drug is turning out to be a proven moneymaker for its manufacturer.
description: The United States reached a milestone, of sorts, when last week the Food and Drug Administration approved the first treatment for Covid-19: Veklury, better known by its scientific name, remdesivir.

title: In voting cases, Chief Justice Roberts is alone but in control.
description: In a little over a week, the Supreme Court issued five sets of orders in election cases. In three of them, Democrats prevailed.

title: Late Night Is Too Nervous to Believe in Biden-Leading Polls
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Were all stuck at home at the moment, so here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: Biden leads by 3 points in North Carolina, a Times/Siena College poll found.
description: Joseph R. Biden Jr. holds a small but durable lead over President Trump in North Carolina, where 64 percent of likely voters say they have already cast their ballots, according to a New York Times/Siena College poll released on Thursday.

title: Clemsons star quarterback tests positive for the virus.
description: Trevor Lawrence, the star quarterback at top-ranked Clemson and a leading contender for the Heisman Trophy, has tested positive for coronavirus, the university said Thursday night.

title: Nap Time
Rogue City Review: An Action Movie Skimping on Action
description: Crime fiction has long been fascinated by the fuzzy line between crooked cops and the criminals they are meant to chase. The new French film Rogue City tramples it, positing that corruption is pervasive and we live in a hopeless, brutal world from which there is no escape. Its a bleak vision that makes Olivier Marchals movie radical in its nihilism.

title: These Are the Perks Companies Use to Get Workers Back to Their Offices
description: At the headquarters of SL Green, a real estate company in Manhattan, employees walk the halls with masks on, line up with proper spacing for free lunch and sit at cubicles behind plastic barriers that rise up well over six feet.

title: News Quiz: Amy Coney Barrett, Lockdowns, Anonymous
description: Did you follow the headlines this week?

title: Lesson of the Day: Why Nigeria Is Now Erupting
description: Featured Article: Why Nigeria Is Now Erupting by Rick Gladstone and Megan Specia

title: These Zombies Threaten the Whole Planet
description: REDWATER, Alberta  William Romaniuk stopped his tractor at the edge of his field and sniffed. A breeze came off the North Saskatchewan River, rippling across rows of ripe wheat, but a caustic scent flooded his nose. An oil well between his crops and the river was leaking, and enough gas was flowing out of a pipe below the rusty pump jack that the farmer could smell gas and see it swirling in the air.

title: After Jon Ossoff calls him a crook during a Georgia Senate debate, David Perdue cancels final one.
description: The Republican Georgia Senator David Perdue withdrew on Thursday from the final debate in his tight re-election race a day after his Democratic challenger, Jon Ossoff, called him a crook and accused him of trying to profit from the coronavirus.

title: New Zealand Voters Approve Euthanasia but Reject Recreational Marijuana
description: New Zealand will join a small number of countries that have legalized euthanasia after its citizens voted overwhelmingly in favor of it in a referendum this month.

title: As virus cases surge to new records, outbreaks in swing states could shape the election.
description: Voters in several swing states are casting their ballots even as the coronavirus reaches new peaks in their communities, creating more uncertainty about how they will vote  and for whom.

title: Wagners Music is Bombastic and Boring and Other Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: What Have We Lost?
description: All 15 of our columnists explain what the past four years have cost America, and whats at stake in this election.

title: How Do You Feel About Censored Music?
description: What kind of music do you listen to? Do you ever listen to songs with lyrics that are explicit, suggestive or violent? Do you prefer the clean versions of these songs or the unedited ones? Why?

title: A Nice Riff on Love
description: In early October, Priscilla Maria Page and Glenn Steven Siegel watched the jazz saxophonist Charlie Kohlhase lead a band outdoors, where the musicians notes cut through fall air. The location of the concert, by a creek outside the Institute for the Musical Arts in Goshen, Mass., was one that Ms. Page and Mr. Siegel had selected: The performance was the latest in a long line of jazz shows that the couple has organized in the region. So its natural that when, during the concert, Ms. Page and Mr. Siegel noticed a pair of gnarled apple tree stumps sitting a modest stage lengths apart from each other, they couldnt help but do a little location scouting.

title: What Losing My Father Taught Me About Parenting, Planets and Pain
description: Theres pain, and then theres stepping on a Lego in the middle of the night, my father often repeated with a laugh when his grandkids visited. They took over his living room, dining table, bedroom floors and bedside tables with messes of plastic blocks haphazardly assembled to resemble something magical and grand, excavated from the depths of their imaginations.

title: From Melbourne to New York, Oceans Couldnt Keep Them Apart
description: As rain pelted the London streets, Stephanie Hains and Christian Nilsson were scaling an iron gate at 2 a.m. The two, who met on Tinder and were enjoying a first date, had found themselves locked into Hyde Park.

title: On-Again, Off-Again, but a Cabdriver Knew Theyd Get Married
description: Sarah Beverly Koatz and Stuart Hopkins Winchester had no idea where their relationship was going in March 2013, but the Cupid Cabbie did. By the end of their yellow taxi ride one evening from Union Square to the Upper East Side in New York, he told them they would get married someday.

title: This Election Map Will Be Everywhere. Dont Let It Fool You.
description: Its full of tricks and optical illusions.

title: United States Records Its Worst Week Yet for Virus Cases
description: Cases, hospitalizations and deaths across much of the country are the highest they have been during the pandemic.

title: Do Hospitals Value Everyone? This Winter, They Have a Chance to Prove It
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich.  As hospitals in much of the country face a surge in patients with Covid-19 and the threat of influenza this fall and winter, we must be on guard against attempts to restrict patient admissions or limit intensive-care capacity. The incentives will certainly be there for hospitals to do so.

title: Friends Since Eighth Grade, Married With a New Urgency
description: David Rhoades skipped a lot of school in the mid-2000s as a student at Sturgis Brown High School in Sturgis, S.D. Not much held his attention, besides a girl a year younger who was good at painting and drawing.

title: What if America Gets a Divorce? And Other Final Election Predictions
description: Listen and subscribe to The Argument from your mobile device:

title: The Friendships Trump Pulled Apart
description: Many of my oldest friends are voting for President Trump on Tuesday.

title: These Two Were Otherwise Engaged. A Decade Later, Theyre Wed.
description: Nathan Hartman and Christopher Sipes first met in March 2011 when they were introduced by mutual friends at a dinner in Atlanta, where they both lived.

title: Trump Has Made the Whole World Darker
description: There is no escaping it: America is on the ballot on Tuesday  the stability and quality of our governing institutions, our alliances, how we treat one another, our basic commitment to scientific principles and the minimum decency that we expect from our leaders. The whole ball of wax is on the ballot.

title: The Woman President Who Wasnt
description: One of my clearest memories of election night in 2016 is running into women who were going to watch the results with their daughters, so theyd get to share the experience of seeing Hillary Clinton elected president  the moment when the political glass ceiling in America would be shattered forever.

title: Goodbye Principled Conservatism
description: If Amy Coney Barretts confirmation to the Supreme Court turns out to be the last major act of a one-term Trump presidency, it will be a fitting finale. Republicans, like the Federalist Party of yore, will consolidate power in the judiciary. Apart from that, they will have spent the past four years squandering their reputation, forsaking their principles, and trashing the kind of political culture they once claimed to hold dear.

title: At First He Ghosted, Then They Became a Couple
description: In July 2018, Dr. Samyukta Mullangi, now 31 and a first-year hematology-oncology fellow at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in New York, met Mohit Agrawal, also 31 and the deputy policy director to Gov. Ned Lamont, Democrat of Connecticut, on the dating app the League.

title: Dont Write Off the Persistent Man From California
description: A few matters might have stood in the way of a relationship between Mallika Pereira and Dr. Kennedy Cosgrove. She is a committed planner and he said his best friend in medical school referred to him as Mr. TBD. She lived in New York. He lives in Lafayette, Calif.

title: A West Wing First Date
description: More than three years after they met, Sean Christian Casey finally asked Elaine Gabrielle Joseph on a first date.

title: Biden Can Fix Latinos Disappointment With Democrats
description: MIAMI  Latinos know that Democrats are great at making promises. Now Democrats have to prove that theyre also great at keeping them.

title: Have We Learned Nothing After Four Years of Trump?
description: In the original Greek the term apocalypse refers to an unveiling, the gray rain clouds of the everyday world torn away and something long hidden finally revealed. The political apocalypse of 2016, when Donald Trump improbably vanquished the establishment of both parties, fits this ancient definition perfectly: It was a moment when all kinds of uncomfortable truths about American life were suddenly exposed, when the hidden realities of our country and our coalitions were suddenly dragged up into the light, when the failures in both parties and every faction were laid bare.

title: Dont Fool Yourself. Trump Is Not an Aberration.
description: For many millions of Americans, the presidency of Donald Trump has been a kind of transgression, an endless assault on dignity, decency and decorum. They experience everything  the casual insults, the vulgar tweets, the open racism, the lying, the tacit support for dangerous extremists and admiration of foreign strongmen  as an attack on the fabric of American society itself. And they see the worst of this administration, like separating children from their families at the border, as an unparalleled offense against the values of American democracy.

title: Why Indias Muslims Reach for Liberalism
description: By now, the world knows that Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India and his Hindu supremacist Bharatiya Janata Party (B.J.P.) have eroded the liberal principles of the Indian Constitution and are turning the country into an increasingly illiberal democracy. It is common knowledge that Mr. Modi thrives on the grievances and bigotries that pit privileged majorities against minorities living in fear.

title: When Trick-or-Treating Is Scary, for Real
description: Each Halloween, Holly Bonner and her two daughters would spend up to three hours trick-or-treating at houses and businesses before returning home on Staten Island to pass out candy themselves.

title: The Swagger of Denis Shapovalov
description: With a lefty forehand that crackles like a campfire, a stunning one-hand backhand and a backward baseball cap that dips to just above his eyebrows, Denis Shapovalov is a stirring reminder of the swaggering, swashbuckling days of Andre Agassi.

title: They Crossed Paths at Howard but Caught Feelings in a Hurricane
description: Jaime Oliva stepped out of an Uber and into harms way. Mr. Oliva, 30, a senior adviser for strategic management at the Department of Health and Human Services, was returning to his Washington office and looking razor sharp after visiting his barber in July 2017.

title: In Building Economic Team, Biden Faces Tug From Left and Center
description: WASHINGTON  If he wins the presidency, Joseph R. Biden Jr. will inherit an economy struggling to recover from its steepest plunge in decades. His economic team will need to help workers and businesses survive a pandemic winter, while developing policies to address the racial and income inequalities the crisis has exacerbated in the labor market.

title: New York Subways Pain Could Bring Riches for Bond Investors
description: You can make a lot of money betting on government bailouts.

title: The President Has Made Selfishness Our National Credo
description: Back in the early 2000s, an academic named Robert Sampson did one of the better-known studies in urban sociology of the past 20 years, discreetly dropping thousands of stamped and addressed letters all over the streets of Chicago. What he was looking for, essentially, was to see which neighborhoods would be most diligent about dropping those letters in mailboxes rather than allowing them to collect footprints on the sidewalk and turn to pulp.

title: The Fury Against Trump Has Begun a Great Democratic Awakening
description: What did we talk about before Donald Trump? What will we talk about after Donald Trump? Will there even be an after? And was there ever really a before?

title: 2016 Nonvoters, a Key Prize for Biden and Trump, Turn Out in Droves
description: [Follow our live Trump vs Biden 2020 election updates and analysis.]

title: Where Cruise Ships Are Sent to Die
description: Along the meandering industrial peninsula of Aliaga on Turkeys Aegean coast, the contents of gutted vessels lay strewn on the dusty roadside, scattered among clusters of orange lifeboats that tower so high they obscure the dramatic scene unfolding in the shipyard below.

title: Some Areas of N.Y.C. Are Getting a Lot More Testing. Guess Which Ones.
description: This week, in an anxious nation where nearly any encounter with a screen has become triggering, Kim Kardashian West took a shot with all her firepower, announcing plans for her 40th birthday. To the undoing of Twitter, she noted that she had flown friends and family to a private island to pretend things were normal just for a brief moment. The pandemic at the heart of the current peculiarities was easily circumvented by quarantine and 2 weeks of multiple health screens.

title: Armed Observers, Chants of 4 More Years at Polls: Is That Legal?
