description: Some voter intimidation is blatant, like the time when off-duty sheriffs deputies and police officers in New Jersey patrolled predominantly Black and Latino polling places on Election Day while wearing armbands with a made-up name, the National Ballot Security Task Force.

title: Why Blue Places Have Been Hit Harder Economically Than Red Ones
description: The coronavirus recession has been more severe in Democratic-leaning places than in Republican-leaning ones. Blue states like Massachusetts and California have had steeper job losses, higher unemployment and bigger drops in job postings than red states like Utah and Missouri.

title: In Trump and Biden, a Choice of Teetotalers for President
description: [Follow our live Trump vs Biden 2020 election updates and analysis.]

title: The Day After Election Day
description: There will of course be an Election Day  and it could be one of tumult, banners colliding, incidents at the polls and attempted hacks galore. More likely than not, it will end without a winner named or at least generally accepted.

title: In Michigan, a Suburban County That Flipped Blue Isnt Looking Back
description: WATERFORD, Mich.  President Trump campaigned on Friday at an airport hangar in Waterford, a city in Oakland County northwest of Detroit, and a place that has very much changed from the last time he visited there for a rally five weeks before the 2016 election.

title: How an Urban Beekeeper Spends His Sundays
description: Five years ago, Nick Hoefly picked up his first queen bee in Pennsylvania, and drove her, along with 12,000 of her buzzing subjects, to their new home  his home  in Queens.

title: Why This Professor Is Writing Letters for People Feeling Blue
description: On a recent foggy morning, Brandon Woolf was sitting on a foldable chair, in front of a foldable table, next to a Brooklyn mailbox, writing letters on a 1940s-vintage portable Royal typewriter. He was dressed in a navy blue T-shirt emblazoned with the U.S. Postal Service logo. A chalkboard sign in front of him explained the project to passers-by: Free Letters for Friends Feeling Blue.

title: The Storied History of a Brewery in Brooklyn
description: The old William Ulmer Brewery in Bushwick is trying to push its way into the present day.

title: In Brooklyn, a Ghost of Breweries Past
description: In 1985, while living on a friends couch after being thrown out of a studio in Long Island City, Jay Swift, a young sculptor, spent months scouring the city for a place where he could live and make art for the long haul. While prowling grungy, postindustrial Bushwick on his old Dawes bicycle, he turned the corner onto a one-block street called Belvidere and found himself gawking at what looked like an intimate little castle made of fiery orange-red brick and terra cotta.

title: Weekly Health Quiz: Marijuana, Lullabies and Coronavirus
description: Test your knowledge of this weeks health quiz.

title: New in Paperback: All Blood Runs Red and Frankissstein
description: ALL BLOOD RUNS RED: The Legendary Life of Eugene Bullard  Boxer, Pilot, Soldier, Spy, by Phil Keith with Tom Clavin. (Hanover Square, 352 pp., $17.99.) This absorbing biography of the first Black American fighter pilot reads like a picaresque novel, our reviewer, Thomas E. Ricks, noted. Bullard fled the Jim Crow South as a boy by stowing away on a freighter to Europe, where he fought for the French Foreign Legion and ran a Paris nightclub, among other exploits.

title: Sharknado Goes to Washington
description: WASHINGTON  When I was growing up, my brother Michael took me to see old movies at the American Film Institute.

title: What Makes a Man Manly? Trump and Biden Offer Competing Answers
description: If the 2016 election pitted feminism against machismo, this one asks voters to consider what masculinity means.

title: Suddenly, These Law Clerks Were More Than Just Colleagues
description: Shampa Panda and Christopher Bryant both were law clerks in the federal courthouse in Charleston, S.C., when they first met, in 2016, and her frequent visits to his office did not go unnoticed by their co-workers.

title: Inside the Race to Count Absentee Ballots Early
description: About 50 million Americans have already voted by mail. Heres what processing those ballots looks like in a crucial swing state.

title: 2016 nonvoters, a key prize for Biden and Trump, turn out in droves.
description: With recent electoral history and current polls suggesting that Democrats are likely to make gains in vote-rich suburbs across the country, President Trumps path to re-election has always required him to expand his support in rural and exurban counties in Pennsylvania, as well as in Midwestern states where he squeezed out slight victories in 2016.

title: Is Halloween Canceled? Not Officially, but
description: [Want to get New York Today by email? Heres the sign-up.]

title: Trump and Biden share one quality, at least: Neither man drinks.
description: A presidential election that has driven a nation to drink is being fought to the bitter end by two men who do not.

title: Biden Hopes to Fight Autocracy Abroad. Hell Have to Start at Home.
description: During the end of Barack Obamas presidency and the beginning of Donald Trumps, Frances Brown served as the director for democracy on the staff of the National Security Council. It was her job to help coordinate administration efforts to support democracy, encourage free and fair elections, and oppose authoritarianism abroad.

title: How Three Election-Related Falsehoods Spread
description: Falsehoods about Tuesdays election have overwhelmed local election officials, who said they were dealing with tsunamis of misinformation, have lost sleep and were working extra long hours.

title: A Rap Star Agonizes About His Role in Polands Culture Wars
description: LONDON  Taco Hemingway is a household name in Poland. One of the countrys biggest rappers, he has songs that get millions of views, and before the coronavirus hit, he filled arenas with bouncing fans, extravagant light displays dancing around him onstage.

title: The Field: The Shy Biden Voters Among Floridas Seniors
description: Floridas seniors played an important role in President Trumps victory there in 2016. Older voters, who are mostly conservative, make up around 25 percent of the swing states electorate and turn out in astonishing numbers.

title: The Shifting Map
description: American politics can sometimes feel static. For the last two decades, the two parties have each won at least 45 percent of the vote in every presidential election, and a small number of swing states have determined the outcome.

title: In Pandemic U.K., Brexit Is an Afterthought, as Is Trump
description: LONDON  When President Trump called the pro-Brexit politician Nigel Farage to the stage during his rally in Goodyear, Ariz., on Wednesday, it was a reminder that Britains bombshell vote to leave the European Union in June 2016 was seen as a harbinger of Mr. Trumps victory in the United States that fall.

title: What Happens on Nov. 4?
description: For weeks now, there has been a steady drumbeat of warnings  from former government officials, academics, legal experts and journalists  about the chaos and hijacking of democracy that could occur in the elections aftermath. It turns out those alarm bells are being rung inside the Trump administration as well.

title: Trump remakes his election night plans.
description: President Trump has called off plans to appear at the Trump International Hotel on election night and is likely to be at the White House instead, according to a person familiar with the plans.

title: Who Will Win Florida? What Polls Say About an Eternal Mystery
description: Welcome to Poll Watch, our weekly look at polling data and survey research on the candidates, voters and issues shaping the 2020 election.

title: What a Barrister Looks Like: A Young Black Woman Paves the Way
description: LONDON  It was looking like a typical day at the office for Alexandra Wilson as she arrived at a London courthouse ready to defend someone accused of theft.

title: Justin Herbert and the Chargers Veer Happily Off Course
description: The Los Angeles Chargers could have played it safe. Ahead by 10 points with less than four minutes left against the Jacksonville Jaguars on Sunday, the team might have handed the ball off and run down the clock to finally end a four-game losing streak.

title: Democratic Senators Prepare to Fundamentally Reform Capitalism
description: On Nov. 17 and 18, DealBook is holding our first Online Summit. Join us as we welcome the most consequential newsmakers in business, policy and culture to explore the pivotal questions of the moment  and the future. Watch from anywhere in the world, free of charge. Register now.

title: Down the Basement Stairs and Into the Past
description: The huge cardboard box had been in my mothers basement for decades until she said, When are you going to move that crap to your house?

title: Qatar Apologizes for Airport Strip Searches and Pursues Charges
description: Qatars government said on Friday that it had referred several people for prosecution over invasive medical examinations of women aboard 10 planes in Doha this month, after an investigation into the circumstances.

title: Two More Men Are Arrested Over Knife Attack in Nice
description: PARIS  The French authorities said on Friday that they had arrested two men suspected of being in contact with an assailant who killed three people at a church in Nice on Thursday, an attack that rattled the country and reignited fears of terrorism as officials blamed some foreign leaders for stoking hatred of France.

title: Will the Hardest-Hit Communities Get the Coronavirus Vaccine?
description: It is an idea that may never have been tried in wide-scale vaccine distribution: Citing principles of equity and justice, experts are urging that people living in communities hardest-hit by the pandemic, which are often made up of Black and Hispanic populations, get a portion of the first, limited supply of coronavirus vaccines set aside just for them.

title: Vote Centers Open After a Week of Wildfires
description: Good morning.

title: A Decade Later, Salem Returns to an Even Darker World
description: A decade ago, it felt practically mandatory for a certain kind of in-the-know music fan to have an opinion on Salem, and it wasnt likely to be a neutral one. The Midwestern trio of Jack Donoghue, John Holland and Heather Marlatt had been anointed the godparents of a heady strain of nihilistic electronic music that seemed to alienate as many listeners as it bewitched.

title: Stressed About the Election? Dont Take It Out on Your Investments
description: Heres an election prediction you can take to the bank: Whenever the count is over and no matter who wins the presidency, tens of millions of people are going to be elated and millions of others are going to be despondent.

title: A SoHo Triplex Sells for a Record $35.1 Million
description: In the final weeks before the presidential election, real estate closings slowed in New York City, but there were still several big transactions, including a record purchase in SoHo and another king-size sale at 220 Central Park South.

title: Reasons to Sign Up for a Health Savings Account
description: If youre eligible for a health savings account, now may be a good time to open one.

title: In Turkey, a Frantic Rescue Effort After a Deadly Earthquake
description: Rescue workers scrambled into the early morning Saturday in a frantic effort to save people trapped under debris in the western Turkish city of Izmir, several hours after a major earthquake in the Aegean Sea leveled several buildings and severely damaged many more.

title: Tiffany Deal Is a Signature Move by the Sun Tzu of Luxury
description: The soap opera also known as the largest deal in luxury, the LVMH Mot Hennessy Louis Vuitton-Tiffany acquisition, finally has a happy ending.

title: Donald Trump Jr. said virus deaths had fallen to almost nothing as over 1,000 died in the U.S.
description: Donald Trump Jr., echoing his fathers inaccurate claim that the country is turning the corner in fighting the pandemic, said on Thursday night that deaths had dropped to almost nothing, as the nation reported 1,004 deaths from the coronavirus in one day during a record-breaking surge in cases.

title: Word + Quiz: outcropping
How Does Harris View Big Business? Her Time as Californias Top Lawyer Offers Clues
description: In September 2011, some of the nations biggest banks were about to sign a $4 billion legal settlement with regulators for improperly foreclosing on homeowners. But Kamala Harris, the attorney general of California, felt it didnt do nearly enough to help her constituents. She told lawyers for JPMorgan Chase and Bank of America that if the banks didnt raise their offer, she would walk. And when they balked, she did.

title: Whats in Our Queue? Stath Lets Flats and More
description: Im the TV editor here at The Times. Here are five things Im watching, reading and listening to.

title: How to Talk About the Election With Your Kids
description: With the election just a few days away, I have transformed into an absolute and terrible mess of a mother. My kids can sense that Im vibrating with emotion, and I can sense that its freaking them out. Should I be talking to them about the election and about my hopes and fears? Or should I be shielding them from my worries so that they feel safe and grounded?

title: Egyptian Teen Seeks Justice in Rape Case, and a Battle Erupts Over Womens Rights
description: CAIRO  It was a party Aya Khamees has tried hard to forget.

title: Youre Not Too Old to Talk to Someone
description: Three years ago, Janet Burns felt herself sliding into depression, a too-familiar state. Ms. Burns, a retired federal worker living in Rockville, Md., grew up in a home she described as abusive, with an alcoholic father. Sometimes, she said, I get into a slump and cant get out. Several times, psychotherapy had helped her regain her equilibrium.

title: U.S. Says Virus Cant Be Controlled. China Aims to Prove It Wrong.
description: The United States is hitting records in daily coronavirus cases. But China, the country first afflicted with the scourge, is having a different experience.

title: What to Cook This Weekend
description: The Times published Molly ONeills recipe for old-fashioned beef stew (above) in 1994, in an article called A Simmer of Hope. Nearly a million readers have called it up on NYT Cooking in the last four weeks alone.

title: Election Distractor
description: Is the election giving you nervous energy? Click on this.

title: Brexit Britain looks ready to turn the page on Trump.
description: When President Trump called the pro-Brexit politician Nigel Farage to the stage during his rally in Goodyear, Ariz., on Wednesday, it was a reminder that Britains bombshell vote to leave the European Union in June 2016 was seen as a harbinger of Mr. Trumps victory in the United States that fall.

title: The Lessons of the Pirate League
description: At first glance, the three men sitting around a table in the Embajadores restaurant in downtown Bogot made unlikely companions. True, they were all roughly the same age, in their mid- to late-20s. And, as they traded tales of adventure, their accents would have given away that all three were Argentines, a long way from home.

title: Daily schedules: Trump and Biden in Minnesota and Wisconsin, Harris in Texas, Pence in Arizona.
description: There are four days until Election Day. Here are the schedules of the presidential and vice-presidential candidates for Friday, Oct. 30. All times are Eastern time.

title: Acupuncture Helped People With Back Pain Walk and Bend Better
description: A double-blinded randomized trial of electroacupuncture found it may result in a modest improvement in daily functioning for those with chronic back pain, though it provided little pain relief.

title: Whitewater Unions, and a Toobin-Like Bathroom Mistake
description: Send questions about the office, money, careers and work-life balance to workfriend@nytimes.com. Include your name and location, or a request to remain anonymous. Letters may be edited.

title: Behind the Cover: Trump and the G.O.P.
17 Players in Five States, Composing Over the Internet
description: Last month, I did something I used to do often before the pandemic: I watched a rehearsal. But this time it wasnt a matter of sitting in a concert hall and watching a group work onstage.

title: Pentagon Offers Little Rationale for Trucking Firm Bailout
description: WASHINGTON  The Department of Defense offered few details to a congressional oversight committee about why a struggling trucking company, YRC Worldwide, was determined to be critical to national security, a designation that allowed it to receive a $700 million stimulus loan.

title: Joe Biden and the Arts: No R.B.G. but a Loyal Promoter of Culture
description: Joseph R. Biden Jr. is no aesthete. Not many presidential nominees have been, though some, after a stint in the White House, have decided to take up painting  with varying degrees of success.

description: THE BEFORELANDBy Corinna Vallianatos

title: In Critical Wisconsin, the Fox Valley May Decide the States Winner
description: LITTLE CHUTE, Wis.  The 12,000 residents of this village 24 miles south of Green Bay backed Barack Obama in 2012 and Donald Trump in 2016. But in 2018 they made a narrow split decision  a 461-vote margin for Gov. Scott Walker, a conservative Republican, and a 132-vote advantage for Senator Tammy Baldwin, a liberal Democrat.

title: Scientific Journals Commit to Diversity but Lack the Data
description: On June 16, three weeks after the killing of George Floyd set off a wave of protests that would blaze across the globe, Jol Babdor received an unexpected email.

title: Kendrick Lamars Welcome Return, and 11 More New Songs
description: Every Friday, pop critics for The New York Times weigh in on the weeks most notable new songs and videos. Just want the music? Listen to the Playlist on Spotify here (or find our profile: nytimes). Like what you hear? Let us know at theplaylist@nytimes.com and sign up for our Louder newsletter, a once-a-week blast of our pop music coverage.

title: An Artists Portrait of His Brother
description: In each installment of The Artists, T highlights a recent or little-shown work by a Black artist, along with a few words from that artist putting the work in context. This week, were looking at an untitled in-progress painting by Henry Taylor, who is known for almost impressionistic portraits that are inspired by memory, history and scenes of everyday life. Taylors first exhibition with Hauser & Wirth will open at the gallerys space in Somerset, England, in February.

title: Biden and Obama will hold their first joint rallies on Saturday in Detroit and Flint, Mich.
description: Joseph R. Biden Jr. and former President Barack Obama will make their first public joint appearances of 2020 at rallies in Detroit and Flint, Mich., as the Biden campaign makes a final push for a Blue Wall state that crumbled on Democrats four years ago.

title: Trump Has a Women Problem. These Senators Arent Helping.
description: Even with everything we know about President Trumps deep and abiding disrespect for women, it was disconcerting to see him treat a U.S. senator  from his own party, no less  like a dog.

title: The Sound in Their Ears? Black Thinkers Sharing Lessons in Survival
description: In 1993, Toni Morrison appeared on Charlie Rose. The occasion was her new novel, but the conversation turned to the eruption in the streets of Los Angeles after the acquittal of three white police officers whose beating of Rodney King had been captured on video.

title: Without More Enforcement, Tax Evasion Will Spread Like a Virus
description: Few people enjoy paying taxes, but as Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr. reminded us, Taxes are what we pay for civilized society. On reflection, most of us therefore offer at least implicit support for penalties against tax evasion  penalties that have little meaning unless backed by significant enforcement resources.

title: Looking for Comfort? Turn to This Beef Stew
description: A few weeks ago, as the temperature decreased and my pandemic fatigue increased, I did something I hadnt done in years: I simmered up a homey beef stew.

description: This article is part of the On Tech newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it weekdays.

description: To the Editor:

U.S. Expels Migrant Children From Other Countries to Mexico
description: U.S. border authorities have been expelling migrant children from other countries into Mexico, violating a diplomatic agreement with Mexico and testing the limits of immigration and child welfare laws.

title: Michael Skakel, Kennedy Cousin, Will Not Face 2nd Murder Trial
description: The case was tabloid fodder and its legal twists and turns transfixed much of the country. In 1975, a 15-year-old girl was found slain in an affluent Connecticut suburb, bludgeoned to death with a golf club. Michael C. Skakel, a neighbor and a cousin of the Kennedys, was ultimately charged and found guilty of murder, but his conviction was overturned by the states highest court.

title: Carb Country
description: Hello and welcome to Five Weeknight Dishes. If you ever cook to meet your mood, then next week could be quite a ride in the kitchen  a time for drink mixing and nacho making? Maybe you embrace noodles in uneasy times, or pasta, or stew? Are you an anxiety baker?

title: The Weekender
description: The future of endangered lemurs. A new book about Sylvia Plath. An underused treatment for addiction. Lorraine Braccos new TV show. And more.

title: Overlooked No More: Rosa May Billinghurst, Militant Suffragette
description: This article is part of Overlooked, a series of obituaries about remarkable people whose deaths, beginning in 1851, went unreported in The Times. It is also part of The Timess continuing coverage of the centennial of the 19th Amendment, which gave women the vote.

title: Its Snowing in New England, but Election Day Looks Sunny for Much of U.S.
description: BOSTON  Fluffy, granular snow blanketed New England on Friday morning, accumulating up to four inches in some places and leaving roads slick and slushy, five days ahead of an election whose outcome is expected to hinge on voter turnout.

title: Louisville Officer Who Fatally Shot Breonna Taylor Is Now Suing Her Boyfriend
description: One of the three police officers involved in the fatal shooting of Breonna Taylor has sued Ms. Taylors boyfriend for assault and battery, the latest development in a case that electrified this years widespread protests for racial justice.

title: Review: Hugh Laurie Plays a Politician Trying to Avoid Cancellation
description: Need to lend some charm, suavity and wry humanity to an otherwise objectionable middle-aged British male? Hugh Laurie is your man, filling that neo-George Sanders role in characters both mildly vainglorious (the spaceship captain of Avenue 5) and utterly despicable (the arms dealer of The Night Manager).

title: Virus Hospitalizations Are Up in N.Y.C. But This Time, Its Different.
description: At one New York City hospital, coronavirus patients began arriving a few weeks ago from Brooklyn neighborhoods and nearby suburbs that have seen a resurgence of the virus.

title: Review: Touch of the Poet is a Powerful Study in Toxic Pride
description: Its all Byrons fault. Before James Dean and Gary Cooper and Heathcliff and Rochester  all the real and fictional men lounging at the center of the Venn diagram of bad boys and sad boys  Byron made such a career of drinking, lusting and gallivanting that he became a type. The Byronic hero: temperamental, hedonistic and romantic. I am such a strange mlange of good and evil, the poet once wrote of himself, that it would be difficult to describe me. Save it for your Tinder profile, bro.

title: A Pinnacle of Coral Is Discovered in Australias Great Barrier Reef
description: Explorers of the Great Barrier Reef have discovered a giant pinnacle of coral taller than the Empire State Building.

title: Its Like Playing With Kobe: An Unlikely Intergenerational Bridge Team
description: One afternoon during the height of coronavirus lockdowns, 16-year-old Finn Kolesnik found himself in a cold sweat. He was on the phone with Bob Hamman, 82, one of the greatest bridge players ever.

title: The Many Lives of Lentils
description: At my house, dinner is not a three-course meal every night. More likely, its a main course and a green salad. Sometimes, it is a one-pot main course, though not always. (I find that even when cooking a simple meal, at least two pots and pans are often involved.) And, quite frequently, dinner is meatless.

title: Europes Locked Down, but Schools Are Open
description: Germanys bars, restaurants, theaters, concert halls, gyms and tattoo parlors are shuttered to stem a sharp rise in coronavirus cases. France and Ireland have also moved to shut down large swaths of society. But in all three countries, students and teachers are still in classrooms.

title: Trump Is a Poor Model of Masculinity
description: To the Editor:

title: Boarded-Up Windows and Increased Security: Retailers Brace for the Election
description: Nordstrom, the high-end department store chain, said it planned to board up some of its 350 stores and hire extra security for Election Day on Tuesday. Tiffany & Company, the luxury jeweler, said that windows of select stores in key cities will be boarded in anticipation of potential election-related activity. Saks Fifth Avenue said it was implementing additional security measures at certain locations in the event of civil unrest due to the current election.

title: As Trump and Biden criss-cross the Midwest, the key could be a purple region within a purple state.
description: With President Trump and Joseph R. Biden Jr. converging today on Wisconsin  a state the president won in 2016 by roughly 22,000 votes, or less than a percentage point  the key to winning the state could lie in places like the Fox Valley.

title: Women Converge on Warsaw, Heightening Polands Largest Protests in Decades
description: WARSAW  Ignoring the threat of prosecution and the dangers posed by a surge of coronavirus cases, tens of thousands of women outraged by a court decision to ban nearly all abortions in Poland converged in Warsaw on Friday, intensifying what have been the largest demonstrations in the country since the fall of communism in 1989.

title: From Fashion to a Fantasia in Stone
description: Priscilla Rattazzi sealed her reputation as a fashion photographer in the 1980s. By the end of that decade, Ms. Rattazzi, a Roman living in New York, had turned from fashion to portraiture, capturing the likenesses of Diana Vreeland, Loulou de la Falaise, Gianni Agnelli (her uncle), and other contemporaries with an unexpected combination of astringency and warmth.

title: TVs Horror Hosts: 70 Years of Screams and Cheese
description: Vampires, demons, Michael Myers  in horror, many things never die. One Cleveland television station is betting theres something else thats immortal: the appetite for horror hosts.

title: Americans May Add Five Times More Plastic to the Oceans Than Thought
description: The United States contribution to coastal plastic pollution worldwide is significantly larger than previously thought, possibly by as much as five times, according to a study published Friday.

title: The weather on Election Day matters. This year most of the country will see clear skies.
description: Fluffy, granular snow blanketed New England on Friday morning, accumulating up to four inches in some places and leaving roads slick and slushy, five days ahead of an election whose outcome could hinge on voter turnout.

title: Peter Secchia, Confidant of Ford and Bush, Dies at 83
description: This obituary is part of a series about people who have died in the coronavirus pandemic. Read about others here.

title: What Went Viral This Week
description: Here at Daily Distortions, we try to debunk false and misleading information that has gone viral. We also want to give you a sense of how popular that misinformation is, in the overall context of what is being discussed on social media. Each Friday, we feature a list of the 10 most-engaged stories of the week in the United States, as ranked by NewsWhip, a firm that compiles social media performance data. (NewsWhip tracks the number of reactions, shares and comments each story receives on Facebook, along with shares on Pinterest and by a group of influential users on Twitter.) This weeks data runs from 9:01 a.m. on Friday, Oct. 23, until 9 a.m. on Friday, Oct. 30.

title: Instagram Tries Clamping Down on Misinformation
description: Instagram on Thursday took aim at the spread of misinformation on its platform, announcing that it would temporarily eliminate users ability to view some recent posts ahead of Election Day.

title: Who will win Florida? What the polls say about an eternal mystery.
description: This years presidential race in Florida looks similar to 2016 in at least one regard: It will probably be very close. But whos voting for whom will be quite different.

title: Love Letter: Can a Marriage Survive a Haunted House?
description: As Halloween draws near, spooky happenings and ghost stories abound. But for Allyson McOuat, a writer in Toronto, eerie visitations became a year-round phenomenon when she moved into a three-story Victorian house that had been owned by a couple who died tragically.

title: Magic in the Dirt
description: What we can learn from the harvest of 2020.

title: This is no time to let up, Kamala Harris tells Texas Democrats.
description: FORT WORTH  Senator Kamala Harris urged Texas Democrats on Friday to keep fighting hard, as early voting numbers shattered records in this traditionally ruby red state.

title: Trump will finish with a two-day, 10-event dash ending in Grand Rapids, the site of his last 2016 rally.
description: President Trump will cap off the 2020 presidential campaign with a two-day, seven-state, 10-rally mad dash that embodies his total saturation approach to politics and his faith in overcoming obstacles through perpetual motion, force of will and a torrent of talk.

title: Hospitalizations rise in N.Y.C., but stays are shorter and fewer patients are dying.
description: Hospitalizations have been slowly but steadily rising in New York City, eliciting painful memories of the surge of infections in the spring that killed more than 20,000 people. But this time is different: Patients with serious cases are spending less time in the hospital on average and are less likely to be put on ventilators. And fewer patients are dying.

title: Enzo Mari, Industrial Designer Who Kept Things Simple, Dies at 88
description: This obituary is part of a series about people who have died in the coronavirus pandemic. Read about others here.

title: The End of a Beloved Delhi Institution
description: Times Insider explains who we are and what we do, and delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how our journalism comes together.

title: Pandemic Grandparenting, Beyond the Dreary Video Calls
description: As a veteran television journalist, Sally-Ann Roberts knows how to tame an unsteady landscape and will it into submission. She survived 40 years reporting and anchoring the news for WWL-TV in New Orleans, covering 10 races for mayor and in 2005, Hurricane Katrina, a storm that submerged four-fifths of the city in water and left her rebuilding her home for nearly two unforgiving years. But as far as grandparenting during the coronavirus pandemic, she says shes met her match.

title: The Mandalorian Season Premiere Recap: Back in the Saddle With Baby Yoda
description: Almost a year ago, the Star Wars spinoff series The Mandalorian debuted on Disney+ with a first episode that had been kept mostly under wraps  unseen by the critics and largely unspoiled by advertising. That secrecy preserved what turned out to be a wonderful surprise: the introduction a fun new character, called the Child on the show but immediately dubbed Baby Yoda by the fans. This tiny, adorable, superpowered creature became TVs breakout star last fall, raising the question of what Jon Favreau, the creator of The Mandalorian, might possibly spring on the audience in the second season.

title: Lil Wayne, Latest Rapper in Trumps Orbit, Sees Backlash Over Photo
description: For as long as Donald J. Trump has been a brand name  representing playboy bling and New York business savvy in the 1990s up through his freestyle approach to presidential politics today he has flirted with hip-hop. Sometimes, famous rappers reciprocate.

title: Trump, in Michigan, calls Laura Ingraham politically correct for wearing a mask.
description: President Trump accused doctors of trying to profit from coronavirus deaths and mocked the Fox News host Laura Ingraham for wearing a mask as she attended his first campaign rally of the day in Michigan on Friday.

title: Some Older Voters Shift to Biden in Florida. Will It Be Enough for Him?
description: FORT MYERS, Fla.  For Joseph R. Biden Jr. to capture Florida, he would need a lot of voters like Dave Niederkorn, a retired businessman who cast his ballot for President Trump four years ago and soon came to regret it.

title: Trump Mocks Laura Ingrahams Face Mask During Rally
description: President Trump called Laura Ingraham, a Fox News host, politically correct for wearing a mask during his rally in Michigan on Friday.

title: Europe Risks a New Economic Downturn as Lockdowns Return
description: FRANKFURT  On paper the European economy is snapping back smartly from the pandemic, growing more in the third quarter than it ever had. But images from Paris, Madrid and Frankfurt tell a different story. Cafes are rolling up their awnings, theaters are canceling performances, and its starting to look like March again on city streets.

title: Lori Loughlin Begins 2-Month Sentence for Role in Admissions Scandal
description: The actress Lori Loughlin reported to federal prison on Friday, five months after she and her husband pleaded guilty to charges that they conspired to have their two daughters admitted to the University of Southern California as rowing recruits, even though neither participated in the sport.

title: Trumps Campaign Is Building an Army of Poll Watchers. What Can They Actually Do?
description: President Trump and his campaign have been calling for an army of poll watchers on Election Day. What is poll watching, and when does it cross the line? We look at how a federal consent decree restricted the Republican Party for decades, and why its expiration could make a difference in 2020.

title: Masks Work. Really. Well Show You How
description: A visual journey through the microscopic world of the coronavirus shows how masks provide an important defense against transmission.

title: What Will You Do With the Extra Hour?
description: Welcome. Daylight saving time ends this weekend, clocks falling back one hour to standard time on Sunday. Depending on where you live, this may mean earlier morning light and sunsets that strike in the afternoon. Larks and owls have been having it out over the utility of changing the clocks since the practice was instituted in the United States during World War I to conserve energy. What do the men around here do with their extra hour?, one ruralite was reported to have asked of Marcus M. Marks, a Manhattan borough president who advocated for daylight saving time. They spend it in the dance halls and then the trouble begins, he claimed.

title: Two Museums Tried to Sell Art. Only One Caught Grief About it.
description: Two museums planned to sell works from their collections at a Sothebys auction on Wednesday night.

title: Undecided Voters Could Still Decide the Election. They Tend to Dislike Trump.
description: John Holland, 74, is proud to call himself a political independent, and he has always made a point of voting for the candidate he prefers, not a party to which he had sworn allegiance. In mid-October he told a New York Times/Siena College poll he wasnt yet won over by either President Trump or Joseph R. Biden Jr.

title: Herb Adderley, a Packers Hall of Fame Cornerback, Dies at 81
description: Herb Adderley, the Hall of Fame cornerback who played for Coach Vince Lombardis Green Bay Packer teams that won five N.F.L. championships in the 1960s, including the first two Super Bowls, and then helped take the Dallas Cowboys to their first Super Bowl victory, died on Friday. He was 81.

title: The Daily: An Audio Guide to the Election
description: The 2020 campaign  like much of the year  has been filled with convulsions and unexpected turns. And The Daily team, along with our guest reporters, have been there for it all. Over the last few months, we have drilled down on what the candidates truly stand for and traveled into towns and cities across the country to document the hopes and anxieties among voters.

title: In Iowa, Biden Criticizes Trumps Treatment of Farmers
description: Joseph R. Biden Jr. slammed President Trump on Friday for trade policies that have cost farmers and manufacturing so badly.

title: The Three A.M. Club
description: It was that ghastliest of hours  3 a.m.  bedtime a distant memory and daylight an eternity away. In the silence of his Salisbury, Conn., house, the interior designer Matthew Patrick Smyth jolted awake.

title: The last Democratic presidential candidate to win Texas, Jimmy Carter, seeks to turn Texas blue.
description: Its a familiar line in Texas political circles: The last time Democrats carried the state in a presidential race was when Jimmy Carter won in 1976. Now, at 96, the man who accomplished that feat is lending his name to a fund-raising appeal to help his party possibly flip as many as 10 congressional seats in the Lone Star State.

title: Stocks Suffer Biggest Weekly Decline Since March as Virus Spreads
description: Stocks fell on Friday, dropping for the fourth time in the past five days in a retreat that has added up to Wall Streets worst week since March, as rising pandemic cases, new shutdowns and a sell-off in large technology stocks all dragged the major benchmarks lower.

title: Most Conservative Christians Support Trump. Will They Help Him Win Again?
description: [Read our 2020 presidential election electoral college explainer.]

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
description: The United States just had its worst week ever for the virus.

title: Trump Is Said to Set Aside Career Intelligence Briefer to Hear From Advisers Instead
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump has dispensed with intelligence briefings from a career analyst in favor of updates from political appointees including John Ratcliffe, the director of national intelligence and a longtime partisan defender of his, in the closing weeks of an election targeted by intensifying foreign interference, according to interviews.

title: The Daily: Special Election Edition
description: What will day-of turnout look like? Will vote counting go as planned? And how will President Trump respond to it all? You can find out in real time with us. Because were going LIVE.

title: Stream These Vintage Heist Movies
description: Some of the most popular heist films of the last 25 years are remakes of beloved classics. Heres where you can get away with streaming the originals, plus some other vintage-cool crooks.

title: After a Summer of Racial Reckoning, Race Is on the Ballot
description: [Race affects our lives in countless ways. To read more provocative stories on race from The New York Times, sign up here for our Race/Related newsletter.]

title: Advertisers Flock to Election Night, When Live TV Is the Main Event Again
description: The companies that buy commercial time on the major broadcast networks and cable news channels are anticipating huge interest in election coverage on Tuesday  and a vote-counting process that spills even into the next night.

title: Coronavirus, Migrant Children, November Books: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this newsletter in your inbox? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Kyle Rittenhouse Must Go to Wisconsin for Trial, Illinois Judge Rules
description: WAUKEGAN, Ill.  Kyle Rittenhouse, the Illinois teenager accused of killing two men during protests over a police shooting in Kenosha, Wis., will be tried in Wisconsin, a judge ruled on Friday.

title: Cruise Ships May Set Sail on Sunday, but Only With Crew
description: Cruise ships can prepare to set sail again beginning Sunday under a conditional order issued by U.S. health officials that aims to mitigate the risk of Covid-19 transmission at sea by requiring a host of measures, including testing and quarantine, all designed to keep crews and passengers safe.

title: Above Billionaires Row, a Spinning Crane, Falling Debris and More Fear
description: Maria Loi was not surprised on Thursday night when she heard that debris was raining down from a luxury high-rise going up along the stretch of West 57th Street in Manhattan known as Billionaires Row.

title: Steven Cohen Is Approved as Mets Owner After Clearing 2 More Hurdles
description: Steven A. Cohen, the billionaire hedge fund manager, received two critical rubber stamps on Friday that all but completed his $2.4 billion purchase of the Mets: One was from Major League Baseballs owners and the other from New York City  the latter having posed a potential hurdle of late.

title: An Open Letter to Justin Turner and M.L.B.
description: Justin Turner, its time for you to apologize.

title: Trump Says Black Voters Arent Supporting Biden
description: At his rally in Green Bay, Wis., President Trump maintained that Black voters are not supporting Joseph R. Biden Jr., the Democratic presidential nominee, because of his support of the 1994 crime bill.

title: A.J. Hinch Hired by Tigers After Suspension for Astros Cheating
description: Soon after A.J. Hinch was suspended and fired in January for his role in the Houston Astros sign-stealing scandal, Detroit Tigers Chairman Chris Ilitch wondered from afar if, and how, Hinch would be welcomed back into baseball after serving his penalty.

title: Goodfellas, the Sequel? 4 Arrested in $6 Million Heist at J.F.K. Airport
description: The man walked into an office at Kennedy International Airport with paperwork that showed the flight information and serial numbers he needed to pick up an expensive shipment. Everything appeared to be in order, and he drove off with a truckload of Prada.

title: At End of Bitter Campaign, Joe Biden Anguishes Over My Only Surviving Son
U.S. Coronavirus Cases Set New Record as Infections Soar
description: CHICAGO More than 99,000 coronavirus infections were reported across the United States on Friday, setting the single-day record for cases as the nations outbreak spiraled further out of control. The previous record had been set only a day earlier, providing a sense of how quickly the current surge is mounting.

title: Cruise Ships Can Sail Again, With Strict Rules. Heres What to Know.
description: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention on Friday lifted its no sail order on U.S. cruise ships and set out a framework for how cruising could restart.

title: Frances Hardening Defense of Cartoons of Muhammad Could Lead to a Trap
description: NICE, France  When the satirical magazine Charlie Hebdo republished caricatures of the Prophet Muhammad in early September, it triggered a chain of events that included two stabbings, protests in Muslim nations, the boycott of French goods and criticism from allies. Tensions rose higher when one young Islamist extremist beheaded a teacher near Paris this month, and another slit the throats of two people and fatally stabbed another inside a church in the southern city of Nice this week.

title: How Lincoln Survived the Worst Election Ever
description: Long before Covid-19, Alexis de Tocqueville described a presidential election as a form of sickness in which the body politic became dangerously feverish before returning to normal. Emotions ran too hot, and the fragile forms of consensus that were essential for democracy  what Tocqueville called our habits of the heart  evaporated, as party hacks exhausted themselves in vitriolic attacks on one another and the system.

title: Freedom as the Muzzle of a Glock
description: RIFLE, Colo.  At the Shooters Grill, whose waitresses pack heat, I found Gary Nichols enjoying a burger. A man with bright blue eyes and a shock of gray hair, he got right to the point.

title: Glimmers of Hope for a Winter With Tropical Travel
description: TORONTO  I have been dreaming about Calgary all week  the airport, specifically.

title: Political Satire Isnt Dead. Its Been Turned Into Horror Stories.
description: Political satire seems virtually impossible these days. How do you make fun of leaders and institutions when some of them are so bonkers that it feels like Borat is going to pop out at any minute and tell us were on camera? But satire is still healthy, if youre willing to look in the right place: horror stories.

title: Woman Who Mailed Threat to Susan Collins Gets 30 Months in Prison
description: A woman who prosecutors said sent a threatening letter to Senator Susan Collinss home in Maine in October 2018 because she was upset with her vote to confirm Brett M. Kavanaugh as a justice on the Supreme Court was sentenced on Thursday to two and a half years in prison.

title: Time Running Short, Trump and Biden Return to Northern Battlegrounds
description: [Read our 2020 presidential election electoral college explainer.]

title: A Slow Killer: Nursing Home Residents Wither in Isolation Forced by the Virus
description: KIRKLAND, Wash.  After months of near-isolation inside his senior care facility, Charlie no longer recognizes his wife of almost 50 years. In another nursing home, Susans toenails grew so long that she could not squeeze into her shoes. Ida lost 37 pounds and stopped speaking. Minnie cried and asked God to just take her.

title: N.E.H. Funds Restoration of Statues Toppled During Protests
description: In response to an executive order from President Trump condemning the destruction of historical monuments during recent racial justice protests, the National Endowment for the Humanities is allocating $90,000 to repair or rebuild damaged statues, including one of Christopher Columbus that was toppled in Baltimore.

title: How to Take On the Tech Barons
description: In a rare bit of bipartisanship, Democratic and Republican lawmakers now agree that Big Tech has gotten too big, too powerful, too quickly.

title: Do Dunkin and Arbys Go Together? Private Equity Group Bets $11 Billion They Do
description: In one of the largest restaurant deals in more than a decade, Dunkin will join some of Americas best-known restaurant chains, including Arbys and Buffalo Wild Wings, under a single privately held owner.

title: What Keeps Facebooks Election Security Chief Up at Night?
description: Facebook is not the entire internet. But it does reflect and account for some of the greater webs chaos. With just days to go, hyperpartisan pages on the platform are churning out propaganda to millions of followers.

title: Terrapin Topper
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  This sharp Stella Zawistowski grid is like an Australian mystery flight, full of misdirects and international flair. There are loads of odd interesting entries, none faddish, many charmingly retro (like these guys, from 1994). Also, note how lovingly Ms. Zawistowski clues her little fill, all those short entries that we need to solve in order to chip away at the tough stuff.

title: After Trump accuses doctors of profiteering, medical professionals push back.
description: At a rally in Michigan on Friday, President Trump repeated an extraordinary and unfounded claim that American doctors were profiteering from coronavirus deaths.

title: Quotation of the Day: In Floridas Republican Heartland, Some Retirees Shift to Vote for Biden
description: For me, at 71, its stealing a lot of the percentage of my remaining life.

title: No Corrections: Oct. 31, 2020
description: No corrections appeared in print on Saturday, Oct. 31, 2020.

title: Fights in Front of Fans Test Boxings Business in the Pandemic Era
description: Gervonta Davis, a fighter nicknamed Tank, is honored to have a live audience.

title: Trump will barnstorm Pennsylvania as both campaigns focus on the crucial state.
description: President Trump will hold four rallies across Pennsylvania on Saturday and his wife, Melania, will host a fifth event in the swing state, as both the president and his Democratic challenger, Joseph R. Biden Jr., zero in on what could be a linchpin in the race for the White House.

title: In Times of Crisis, Life-Affirming Picture Books
description: Tomi Ungerer, who died in 2019, was a wonderfully idiosyncratic, uncompromising artist whose books never condescended to young readers with platitudes or secondhand morality. His books, in fact, rarely seemed intended for kids at all.

title: Square Dancing Belongs Somewhere Far Away  Like the 1800s
description: LUPE WONG WONT DANCEBy Donna Barba Higuera

title: Float Like a Butterfly, Sting Like a Bee: A Black Heros Boyhood
description: BECOMING MUHAMMAD ALIWritten by James Patterson and Kwame AlexanderIllustrated by Dawud Anyabwile

title: Everyone Needs a Buddy
description: TWINSWritten by Varian JohnsonIllustrated by Shannon Wright

title: Philip Pullmans New Dark Materials Book Brims With Familiar Delights
description: SERPENTINEWritten by Philip PullmanIllustrated by Tom Duxbury

title: One More Thing the Pandemic Election Upended: First Campaign Job Rites of Passage
description: When Alejandra Escobar signed up to work her first campaign job as a field organizer with the Nebraska Democratic Party, she pictured knocking on doors and talking to voters one-on-one.

title: Hes a Rare House Republican in a District Trump Lost. Can He Hold On?
description: Two years ago, a pair of House Republicans in Central New York became prime targets for the Democratic Party, which had hoped to unseat them in the midterm elections by exploiting voters unhappiness with President Trump.

title: Investing for the Future in the United States of Agita
description: Four years ago, I didnt have a plan. Donald Trump was the surprise winner of the 2016 presidential election, and I wasnt quite sure what to say to the people who were on the verge of losing their minds.

title: Trump Dismisses Virus Coverage and Biden Dismisses Virus Leadership: This Week in the 2020 Race
description: Welcome to our weekly analysis of the state of the 2020 campaign.

title: Halloween Makeup Ideas, From Euphoria to Twilight
description: It should come as no surprise that Halloween will look a bit different this year, but one normal morsel you can count on is that Party City is probably fresh out of cat ears by now. If youve left your costume to the last minute, do not fret.

title: Spirits of Grandfathers Past
description: Grouse Creek, Utah, is about as off the beaten path as a town can be. To access this sleepy community, you have to cross miles of dirt and gravel roads over hilly terrain. A tiny two-pump gas station is the towns only commercial building, along with a Bureau of Land Management bunkhouse, a shed-like post office, a small schoolhouse and a church.

title: Crispr Gene Editing Can Cause Unwanted Changes in Human Embryos, Study Finds
description: A powerful gene-editing tool called Crispr-Cas9, which this month nabbed the Nobel Prize in Chemistry for two female scientists, can cause serious side effects in the cells of human embryos, prompting them to discard large chunks of their genetic material, a new study has found.

title: The Yarn Store Would Like You to Vote
description: A few nights ago, Shana Gadarian, a political scientist at Syracuse University, was ordering a takeout dinner when the DoorDash app suggested she use the time waiting for her order to make a voting plan.

title: The Election Work Diary of a Reporter With 2.5 Million Subscribers
description: Peter Hamby has found a way to be a political journalist for a new generation.

title: What if They Could Make the Pandemic Go Poof?
description: It was a Sunday evening, and Ken Scotts audience was spellbound. Parents and children were oohing and ahhing as he delivered a string of miracles.

title: Theyre Calling You on the Squid Phone
description: Earlier this week, and more than 2,700 feet underwater by the northern Great Barrier Reef, a remotely operated vehicle named SuBastian engaged in a stare-off with a burrito. Thats what the creature looked like from a distance: an untoasted cylinder floating eerily upright in the oceans twilight zone, like takeout from Triton.

title: Networks Pledge Caution for an Election Night Like No Other
description: Batches of ballots that will be counted at different times, depending on the swing state. Twitter gadflies and foreign agents intent on sowing confusion. A president who has telegraphed for months that he may not accept results he deems unfavorable.

title: The Year of Blur
description: For Kate Baer, a poet in Harrisburg, Pa., 2020 feels like a time warp. She compared it to when she and four friends escaped to a woodsy cabin in Maryland and tried cannabis edibles. Time stopped, Ms. Baer, 35, said. And this is how time feels in this pandemic. Fluid and very confusing.

title: Americans Surge to Polls: Im Going to Vote Like My Life Depends on It
description: [Follow our live Trump vs Biden 2020 election updates and analysis.]

title: The Capital of Sprawl Gets a Radically Car-Free Neighborhood
description: Phoenix, that featureless and ever-spreading tundra of concrete, has been called the worlds least sustainable city. It has been characterized as a sprawling, suburbanite wasteland and a monument to mans arrogance. The Onion has darkly predicted that by 2050, most of Earths landmass will be swallowed by the encroaching Phoenix exurbs. The Walk Score index ranks the place as the second-worst big city in America for pedestrians, and traversing it has been described as a slog through a desert, plus the occasional McDonalds.

title: Fueled by Cash, Health Care and Trumps Woes, Democrats Aim for Senate Control
description: BOZEMAN, Mont.  Voters caught up in this states exceedingly close Senate race could be forgiven for believing Gov. Steve Bullock, the Democratic candidate, was sharing the ballot with Senator Chuck Schumer of New York, the minority leader.

title: A Frazzled World Holds Its Breath While the U.S. Chooses Its Leader
description: [Follow our live Trump vs Biden 2020 election updates and analysis.]

title: Campaign 2020: Lets Never Do This Again
description: ATLANTA  The masks, when used, can muffle the dueling chants of a live-action partisan clash. But the messages of this election season still have a way of carrying.

title: With early voting underway in Florida, Democrats worry about Black and Latino support.
description: As the sun set on the C. Blythe Andrews Jr. Public Library in Tampa on Friday evening, a steady stream of mostly Black voters trickled in, hoping to cast their ballots four days before Election Day.

title: Typhoon Goni Makes Landfall in Philippines, Packing Catastrophic Winds
description: MANILA  Typhoon Goni, expected to be the strongest storm to hit the Philippines this year, made landfall on Sunday morning, with weather officials predicting catastrophic wind damage as it roared through the country.

title: Russian Provinces Hit by a Second Wave of Coronavirus
description: MOSCOW  One video shows bodies in plastic bags stacked in the basement of a hospital in the Siberian city of Barnaul after a morgue overflowed.

title: Sean Connery, Who Embodied James Bond and More, Dies at 90
description: Sean Connery, the irascible Scot from the slums of Edinburgh who found international fame as Hollywoods original James Bond, dismayed his fans by walking away from the Bond franchise and went on to have a long and fruitful career as a respected actor and an always bankable star, has died in Nassau, the Bahamas. He was 90.

title: England to Shut Pubs, Restaurants and Most Shops as Virus Surges
description: LONDON  Prime Minister Boris Johnson announced plans on Saturday to shut down pubs, restaurants and most retail shops throughout England, a stark reversal in the face of grim projections that the country could face a deadly winter from the coronavirus unless it takes draconian action.

title: As Tanzanias President Wins a Second Term, Opposition Calls for Protests
description: CAIRO  After a pivotal poll marred by violence, opposition arrests and accusations of rigging, Tanzanias electoral commission said late Friday that President John Magufuli had won a second five-year term  a move that led the opposition to call for peaceful protests on Saturday and urge the international community to reject the result.

title: Did This Building Grow a Beard? Nope. Those Are Legs.
description: Shortly before Halloween in 2018, an administrative building at Glacier Bay National Park & Preserve in Alaska began to sprout a beard.

title: My Co-op Is Losing Revenue in the Pandemic. Do I Have to Pay?
description: Q: I live in a Manhattan co-op. Our building plans to levy an assessment on shareholders because it is no longer receiving rent from commercial tenants due to Covid-19. Weve already been paying an assessment for two years for other reasons. That fee was supposed to end soon, now it might increase. Do I have a legal right to fight this?

title: When Parents Lose Their Jobs, Their Children Also Suffer. But Sometimes Theres a Consolation.
description: In six months without steady work, Gregory Pike, a single father in Las Vegas, has fallen behind on his rent and utilities, borrowed money he cannot repay, turned to food stamps and charity, and fretted that his setbacks may cloud his daughters future.

title: Cut Off From the World Again, Australia Now Finds Silver Linings
description: SYDNEY, Australia  They used to call it the tyranny of distance. Australias remoteness was something to escape, and for generations, the country that hates being referred to as down under has been rushing toward the world. Trade and immigration made Australians richer than the Swiss, creating a culture where life can be complete only with overseas trips and imported purchases.

title: Comfort Food Forever
description: Ali Slagles French onion macaroni and cheese (above) is one of more than 400 warming dishes featured in the super collection here. Make a vegetarian chili or stew, chocolate pancakes covered with raspberries and caramel sauce, or try a new fried chicken recipe.

title: Dramatic Rescues After Major Earthquake Kills at Least 39 in Turkey
description: After a day of dramatic rescues, residents in the Turkish city of Izmir clung to hope Saturday night that survivors might still be found in the devastation of the magnitude-7.0 earthquake that killed at least 39 people in Turkey and Greece, injured more than 800 and leveled numerous residential buildings.

title: Navy Commandos Rescue American Kidnapped in Niger
description: WASHINGTON  U.S. Special Operations commandos carried out a predawn raid on Saturday to rescue an American citizen who had been kidnapped this week from his home in southern Niger.

title: The Economy Is Down. Why Are Home Prices Up?
description: Many Americans will have heard stories about people fearful of the pandemic fleeing from crowded cities and driving up home prices in the rest of the country. But there is a much bigger tale to tell here.

title: Republicans, Not Biden, Are About to Raise Your Taxes
description: The Trump administration has a dirty little secret: Its not just planning to increase taxes on most Americans. The increase has already been signed, sealed and delivered, buried in the pages of the 2017 Tax Cuts and Jobs Act.

title: Im Dreaming of a Blue Texas
description: Its happening again the belief that this is the year Texas will turn blue.

title: Is France Fueling Muslim Terrorism by Trying to Prevent It?
description: MARSEILLE, France  Once again, terrorism strikes France  and once again, terrorism is exposing the countrys dangerous contradictions.

title: Police Reform Is on the Ballot
description: In 2017, after the Portland, Ore., police fatally shot her 17-year-old grandson, Donna Hayes got invited to City Hall to meet Mayor Ted Wheeler, who expressed his deepest sympathies. He had been in office for only seven weeks.

title: 15 Sean Connery Movies to Stream
description: Sean Connery died Saturday at the age of 90. Best known for originating the role of James Bond in movies, the Scottish actor had a career that lasted nearly 60 years, most of which he spent playing a variety of mans man roles  from suave spies to violent brutes. At a time when most popular British thespians were known as Shakespearean-trained aesthetes, Connery became an international star with a screen presence that was earthier and sexier. His musical highland burr and awe-inspiring physicality immediately drew eyes and ears, even when he was playing opposite some of the most accomplished and attractive performers of his generation.

title: The Race for Miamis Perennial Tossup Seat Starts Leaning Democratic
description: MIAMI  It felt like 100 degrees on a recent Saturday when Carlos A. Gimenez, the Republican candidate in Floridas most competitive congressional race, stood on a busy street corner in the Miami suburbs with a gaggle of masked relatives and campaign volunteers, waving signs at the honking cars.

title: The Presidents Taxes: A Readers Guide
description: Over the last several weeks, The New York Times has published the findings of its investigation into more than 20 years of President Trumps federal income tax records  information that he has fought to keep hidden in defiance of presidential tradition.

title: Variety: Cryptic Crossword
description: CRYPTIC CROSSWORD  Im getting down to the nitty-gritty this week  quick explainers and links to spoilers. By my reckoning, we have solved one John Forbes cryptic in these environs, but Mr. Forbes is a longtime cryptic setter and you can find plenty more of his puzzles for future solves.

title: Trump and the Working Class
description: To the Editor:

title: How Are Americans Catching the Virus? Increasingly, They Have No Idea
description: When the coronavirus first erupted in Sioux Falls, S.D., in the spring, Mayor Paul TenHaken arrived at work each morning with a clear mission: Stop the outbreak at the pork plant. Hundreds of employees, chopping meat shoulder to shoulder, had gotten sick in what was then the largest virus cluster in the United States.

title: Poll Watchers Endure, Minus the Partisan Drama
description: WASHINGTON  Amid the clamor of President Trumps continuing demands for his supporters to look out for fraud at polling places, it is easy to overlook the fact that in many polling places, someone already is keeping watch.

title: As Augmented Reality Evolves, the Reporting Is All Around You
description: Times Insider explains who we are and what we do, and delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how our journalism comes together.

title: Obama will head to South Florida and Atlanta on Monday, Biden campaign announces.
description: Former President Barack Obama will travel to to Atlanta and South Florida on Monday, the Biden campaign announced Saturday afternoon, a move aimed at boosting turnout in closely contested states where victories for the former vice president would open multiple paths to the White House.

title: Greek Orthodox Priest Wounded in Lyon, France, Shooting
description: PARIS  A Greek Orthodox priest was shot and wounded Saturday in the central French city of Lyon, but the motive was unclear, local authorities said.

title: Did President Trump Keep His First-Term Promises? Lets Look at 5 of Them
description: [Follow our live Trump vs Biden 2020 election updates and analysis.]

title: Can Trump Woo Enough Black Men to Hurt Biden in Battleground States?
description: [Read our 2020 presidential election electoral college explainer.]

title: Rescue Workers Search for Survivors After Major Earthquake in Turkey
description: A magnitude-7.0 quake that struck in the Aegean Sea also killed at least two people in Greece. Hundreds in Turkey were injured and many thousands displaced.

title: The Wall Is Still Motivating Voters. But This Time Is It Against Trump?
description: YUMA, Ariz.  It might be seen as a monument to the massive changes the Trump administration has brought to the countrys immigration system. Or it could be seen as a reason people are fighting fiercely to vote him out.

title: An Ancient Hill and Forgotten Dead: Afghanistans Haunted Outpost
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  It seemed the perfect vantage point for the Marines: a 30-foot-high dirt pile overlooking the low-lying poppy fields of Helmand Province. What they could not explain were the strange lights at night, the whispers in the darkness, the mysterious radio static, the sudden chill in a summer breeze and the recurring whiff of corpses.

title: Elvia Ramirez Dies at 17; Youngest Covid-19 Victim in North Dakota
description: This obituary is part of a series about people who have died in the coronavirus pandemic. Read about others here.

title: How the Skakel-Moxley Murder Case Unfolded Over Four Decades
description: Prosecutors in Connecticut said on Friday that they would not retry Michael C. Skakel for the murder of his 15-year-old neighbor 45 years ago, ending a case that transfixed much of the country and went all the way up to the United States Supreme Court.

title: Their First Try Backfired, but Giuliani and Allies Keep Aiming at Biden
description: [Follow our live Trump vs Biden 2020 election updates and analysis.]

title: Biden and Surrogates Hit Trump on Taxes in Closing Argument
description: As former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. and his surrogates make their closing arguments in battleground states stressed by economic hardship amid the pandemic, they often focus on one number: $750.

title: Kentucky Police Training Quoted Hitler and Urged Ruthless Violence
description: A slide show once shown to cadets training to join the Kentucky State Police includes quotations attributed to Adolf Hitler and Robert E. Lee, says troopers should be warriors who always fight to the death and encourages each trooper in training to be a ruthless killer.

title: Final Weekend Campaigning Reflects Both Traditional Barnstorming and 2020 Chaos
description: President Trump predicted bedlam and a lack of clarity about the presidential results until weeks after Election Day as he barnstormed Pennsylvania, while former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. made his first joint appearance with former President Barack Obama at an event in Michigan.

title: Obama Rips Into Trump During Drive-In Biden Rally
description: Former President Barack Obama on Saturday joined Joseph R. Biden Jr., the Democratic presidential nominee, on the campaign trail in Flint, Mich. It was their first joint in-person appearance of 2020.

title: Vehicles flying Trump flags try to force a Biden-Harris campaign bus off a highway in Texas.
description: AUSTIN, Texas  Multiple vehicles bearing Trump flags and signs surrounded a Biden-Harris campaign bus heading from San Antonio to Austin on Friday, forcing campaign officials to scrap two campaign events, according to reports by Democratic officials on Saturday.

title: James Bond Actors Say Sean Connery Defined an Era and a Style
description: Sean Connery was remembered on Saturday by other James Bond actors and franchise producers as one of the true greats of cinema who most embodied the fictional spy character James Bond.

title: Britain Expands Coronavirus Restrictions
description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson announced expansive new restrictions on Saturday that effectively establish a national lockdown amid an increase in coronavirus cases.

title: West-Southwest
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  Weekend solvers are familiar with Julian Lim; hes constructed 11 themeless Fridays and Saturdays for the Times over the last several years. This might strike you as logical, if youre noticing (like I did) a high degree of difficulty in the fill. This is only Mr. Lims second Sunday; its theme is straightforward and low-key brilliant, in my opinion, when viewed as a whole.

title: Typhoon Goni Leaves Philippines After Only Grazing Manila
description: Typhoon Goni, which made landfall in the Philippines with intense winds early on Sunday morning, by the end of the day appeared to have spared the area in and around the capital Manila, with its 13 million residents.

title: Trump Predicts No Results on Election Day
description: During his rally in Newtown, Pa., on Saturday, President Trump warned that voters would be waiting for weeks to get final election results.

title: Trump Camp Uses Online Gimmick to Fuel Donations Into December
description: President Trumps campaign is raising money for a prolonged political and legal fight long after Nov. 3 and recently began automatically checking a box to withdraw additional weekly contributions from online donors through mid-December  nearly six weeks after Election Day.

title: George Shultz Speaks Out for Renewing U.S. Leadership Overseas
description: WASHINGTON  In the final years of the Cold War, Secretary of State George P. Shultz negotiated the first arms-control treaty in history to eliminate an entire class of nuclear weapons, a crowning achievement of President Ronald Reagans tenure and the start of a new era of nuclear de-escalation.

title: Police in North Carolina use a chemical spray to disperse a get-out-the-vote rally.
description: Police officers and sheriffs deputies in Graham, N.C., deployed a chemical spray and arrested eight people at a march and rally on Saturday that were intended to honor George Floyd and encourage people to vote, according to the police and participants.

title: Stanford Study Seeks to Quantify Infections Stemming From Trump Rallies
description: [Follow our live Trump vs Biden 2020 election updates and analysis.]
